Reviews.Title: “Nice place close to everything!”
Reviews.Author: sunandcervesas
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went there and would return,maybe even take our 3yr old. It is a fairly quiet resort so not alot of loud partiers there while we were there anyway. The rooms,hotel,gardens,and pool are kept very clean. Food is good and there was always something we could find that we liked and the staff is very friendly. Location is excellent because it is right at the end of the famous 5th ave strip where you can go from bar to bar,shops and restaurants that is almost 20 blocks long! It is about a 10-15 min walk to the beach from the hotel. If your looking for nightlife take a walk down 5th ave there are dance clubs,live bands,and best of all the Coco Bongo! My wife and I walked down 5th ave day or night and felt very safe!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service & staff”
Reviews.Author: flower066
Reviews.Content: It's been a year since I stayed here, but having booked another holiday for this year I got to thinking and thought I'd leave this one a review. I stayed here for a week with my fiance in March 2011. Aside from a little confusion with a mix up in our booking name everything went smoothly. We had a suite rather than a standard room and it was perfect, couldn't fault it. The staff at the resort are friendly, were happy to let me practise my spanish on them and really seemed as though nothing was too much trouble. The food was good quality and the drinks selection at the bar was good. Really enjoyed everything about the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel for the money”
Reviews.Author: polarbears_11
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our second stay at the Real Playa del Carmen. Once again we were were pleased with the staff...and other hotel amenities. Special thanks to Daniel, Vyaney, Alex and Rachel for making our stay so enjoyable!! Also to Bersain, Sonia and Esmeralda in the dining room...so kind and friendly!! Unfortunately we did feel the food was not a good as last year...never saw bacon or sausage for breakfast...a bit too many mexican choices. We felt that there was room for improvment here! But overall definetely a place we enjoy...as it is small, quaint and friendly...we also like the location even tho it is a short walk to the beach. Bear in mind it is not a five star hotel but very nice for the money. The Polar Bears!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not really a four stars”
Reviews.Author: Johanne R
Reviews.Content: Do not ask for a standard room, at least get a nicer room (but they will charge extras) and don't count on good food. We had burgers for dinner one night and then hot dogs another night. The buffet is similar days after days.

Reviews.Title: “Old Resort has Charm and Value”
Reviews.Author: bryna123
Reviews.Content: Travelled Feb 11-18 2012 checked in 4:30 check out 11:00 am I do lots of research before I book so I really had no high expectations or surprises about food and facilities. This resort is very compact. Six buildings of rooms. The main buffet, nightime show stage and A la carte restaurant are all under the same roof. Walk a few steps from there and you are in the lobby or at the pool. You may think it would be easy to get around but be careful of the walkways with gaps and uneven stones. Very easy to trip even before a few drinks! Foliage is mature and beautiful. Grounds extremely well maintained. FOOD and DRINKS I would say the food was better than I expected. Always fresh but very limited variety. There are just 7 serving stations including the coffee, dessert, bread and salad bar, so actual hot food stations are just 2, sometimes 3. We never did see a lunch buffet as we were always off the resort to eat elsewhere, as planned. If we dined here three times a day everyday I would not be satisfied with selection. You can get bacon at breakfast from the omelet station. It is chopped up small for in omelets but still tasty. There was always local fare to try such as fried taco chips with sauce, or smothered pork for breakfast. Maria's a la carte for dinner had good chicken fajitas and service was great. We liked the red and white wines offered. Think good home brew quality. Mixed drinks were tasty and not watered down. The 24 hour snack bar is hit or miss depending on the time of day and when it was last stocked. It was always interesting to look under the lid. Nice to be able to pour your own beer or wine anytime of day. STAFF Always friendly and smiling. Most are very young. Service is not over the top but if you ask for something they respond willing to help. The bellman, Jesus, was teriffic. Maid always left unique towel art, some of the best I've seen! Entertainment team work very hard and are nice to chat with on the beach during the day. It makes you want to catch a show or two. ROOMS 101 and 103 Tulum building #1 We booked the upgraded Master Suite. This was to ensure us a ground floor room, patio with hammock and use of the Gran Porto Real facilities. Upon check-in they ask for proof of your booking. I had a Westjet print out but my friend at first could not find hers.They would not give her the upgrade until it could be proven through calls to Westjet and a credit card imprint, that she indeed had the upgrade. It worked out after an unwanted hassle at the front desk so be sure to print off everything! The pictures of rooms on the website are accurate enough but at first we were taken to a second floor Family master suite. The balconies are barely big enough for the two plactic lawn chairs on them. We had to return to reception and wait another hour for the right rooms to be ready. By 6 pm they were ready. Our mini bar was not stocked until the next day but after that no problem. Our fridge kept things barely cool but AC was wonderful. Both our rooms had new AC units. No smoke alarm in our room but our friend (103) had one. No DVD player but friends room had one. No table on the balcony but friend had one. If you need these things just ask. Our safe required a key and you have to sign a paper saying you will pay $100 USD if it is lost. Bathroom tiny and shower leaks water over the floor if the curtain isn't just right. Only toiletries provided are two small soap and shampoo. No hairdryer but ask at the front desk for one. We had a set of bunkbeds along with our King bed in the room, like the family suites have. If you find the King bed hard ( and it is) you can always crash on the softer bunk. We grew to like to room as the week went on. It's large and comfortable. It was clean, just the age of the resort make grout and tiles look dingy. UPGRADE Is it worth it? I'm still not sure. You have to wear two bracelets. We ate lunch twice at the Gran Porto beach grill ( basic burgers, fries, dogs, and chicken) You cannot eat at their buffet in your swimsuit, so spending the day at the beach requires a change of clothes if you plan to eat in. We used their lovely 24 hour lounge for internet. 20 pesos for 20 minutes. We ate dinner at the Italian A la carte,( best steak we've had in a long time) and the Mexican A la carte ( nothing special and the Real has a Mexican). They make you sign a slip anytime you enter the Porto restaurants. The Porto resort is very nice so I will look for a deal there first before upgrading the Real next time. LOCATION Outstanding!!! This was why we were staying here and do not regret it in the least. The lobby is open to 5th Ave. On warm evenings the lobby bar is perfect for people watching while you can hear the latin music playing from the Cuban dance club across the streeet. We walked walked walked all over town. Never did take a cab or shuttle to anything. So enjoyable to be out about town and venture off 5th to eat and shop. OVERALL Great value for prime time travel in the heart of Playa. We have stayed in much nicer places in Mexico ( Grand Palladium and the Catalonia Yucatan) but enjoyed this trip more. We knew we wanted to explore Playa for more than a day trip. Didn't mind the stroll to the beach in the least. Don't book here if you want to spend most of your time on a resort.

Reviews.Title: “great value and service”
Reviews.Author: lacemoon
Reviews.Content: This resort is not on the beach and it could do with some updating but what a treat. The food is very good with loads of variety...both familiar items and new foods to try. The lay out is perfect you do not have to walk far to go the pool or bar. The staff are welcoming and congenial without being smothering. The luscious vegetation is magnifcent. The resort is just lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Too far from the beach!”
Reviews.Author: travel_junkie266
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here in September 2010. It was our first major trip ever and we were definitely very excited to go to Mexico. We were disappointed by the hotel's distance from the beach (about a 15 minute walk) and location of the hotel's "beach club" on the beach. It was annoying to have to walk back and forth every time we wanted to go to the beach (and we got some pretty good blisters too!) The beach was pretty to look at with white sand and the water was beautiful, however there are lots of rocks in the water that hurt our feet and made it difficult to get out into the water. The bar service at the beach club was good and there were tons of open chairs when we went (probably because there weren't many people staying at our hotel). The service at our hotel was great and the staff were extremely friendly and helpful and tried their best to make our stay enjoyable. Our room was basic but clean. Unfortunately the food at our hotel was not good at all but we managed to find some good vendors along the street. Most of the time when we ordered drinks or even water at our hotel, the plastic glasses had soapy bubbles in them. The location of the Real Playa del Carmen is good for shopping, dining and entertainment since it's right on 5th avenue (which is great because you won't get that at your hotel!) I would definitely go back to Playa del Carmen because we had a blast but there are hotels with much better value in Playa than this one.

Reviews.Title: “second time at real never again”
Reviews.Author: dan s
Reviews.Content: hey travelers we went back to real playa for second year in a row from last year to this year night and day. went for two weeks this time.staff was great place was clean but food was terrible the last five days. the last day on check out they took our wrist bands and would not give us any food or drinks while waiting in their lounge for our bus to the air port. had to upgrade at an extra $ 340. then had to change rooms cause the upgraded room was small and dark. the food my god the food from the day before was in the buffet the next day . ribs were recycled three days in a row we will not be going back there so sad loved it there and price was good

Reviews.Title: “Third vacation at the Real Playa Del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: Christoble0556
Reviews.Content: This is the third vacation that my wife and I have spent at the Real Playa Del Carmen. We seem to enjoy it more and more every time that we go there. It is a small three star resort with service that exceeds any service that I have found at any five star resorts. We befriended a Doctor and his wife that were staying at the Royal which is a 5 diamond resort a 10 minute walk away. When we compared the service at both resorts, we came to the conclusion that the service was better at the Real Playa Del Carmen. Under the supervision of Bersain, the dayshift staff consisted of Sonja, Marbella, Heydi, Maria and Freddie who were all a delight to deal with. The afternoon shift under the supervision Raul had Eberito, Mateo, Michel along with others taking care of your every need. There is also Christian at the front lobby bar during the day and the very hardworking Cesar in the evenings. If you are a person who likes to meet new people from around the world, then the Real Playa Del Carmen is the place to be. It is a resort in the heart of Playa Del Carmen that due to its small intimate nature, you can’t help but meet new people. This time we met some very nice people from Sweden as well as Finland and Norway. Western Canada also had some people staying there that were a real hoot. I also ran into people like ourselves that have been there before and predictably enough, for the same reasons we are repeat customers. My wife had a conversation with an older couple that have vacationed in Cancun in the past. They had found Cancun to be a place although nice was one of either beach or cement with very little greenery or vegetation. They changed to Playa Del Carmen where more vegetation is evident. Specifically at the Real Playa Del Carmen, the resort buildings surround a beautiful garden type atmosphere well taken care by the head groundskeeper Francisco, an honest lovable man that takes pride in his work. The animation team was the resorts entertainment and were a driving force for bringing many people together socially. The team consisted of four members. The spokesman Danijel from Croatia, Alejandro from Mexico City, the beautiful Raquel also from Mexico City and their gorgeous choreographer Vyaney from Vera Cruz Mexico. The shows they provided in the evenings were very interactive with the audience and everyone always has a good time. I found their international show to be very good and they were also putting the finishing touches on a new show called “yesterday” which was also quite enjoyable. During the afternoons you often see them busily practicing for the evenings shows. Don’t be surprised if they come and ask if they can sit down and have lunch with you as they do this with guests every day. It is always interesting conversation and it made my wife and I feel more welcome then we already did. There is a lot of Mexico that I still want to see but it may have to wait a while because I want to go back to the Real Playa Del Carmen again. It is in a nice central location for doing a lot of things where you would normally need arranged transportation if you were in a resort outside of the town. For instance it is walking distance to Coco Bongo and to the ferry dock to go to Cozumel. A word regarding the house tequila that is offered at the Real Playa Del Carmen, It is called “Monte Azul” and I found it to be one of the best sipping tequilas I have had. It has just a hint of Vanilla in it. I have sampled many of the Mexican tequilas from Don Julio, Tres Mujeres, Corralejo, 1800, etc. which are all good but rather expensive tequilas. This one took me by surprise. Be aware that it is hard to find for purchase, I was told it was only available in Cancun. Set pretension aside, try the Real playa Del Carmen, meet new people, enjoy the animation team. By the end of our vacation we both felt as though we part of a bigger family. Christoble and Wendy from Ontario

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our stay in this Hotel. And will go back if we ever visit Playa del Carmen Again.”
Reviews.Author: pingolin
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband liked this hotel and the people working there. We would go back if we ever visit Playa del Carmen again Carla and Paul Bertrand

Reviews.Title: “Dump”
Reviews.Author: aleycat4x4
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is a dump.We booked 10 rooms in April 2011 for Jan 2012.Didn't get the rooms we asked for.Toilets didn't flush in 3 rooms.The dead bolts didn't work.The 1 bed had blood on it. No Battery in the smoke detector.When call they just closed the cover.A/c in 4 rooms didn't work.Staff could understand English.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fantastic staff!”
Reviews.Author: Mz L
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the Real for 1-week to celebrate NYE and my birthday in Playa. We arrived Dec 31st and left Jan 7th. This was my first vacation :) As I am new to travelling, I am also new in knowing what to expect when visiting another country. I did however have a pretty grounded expectation of this hotel having done a lot of research online before arriving which included reading the reviews on this site and others. We booked the trip with the assistance of a travel agent and chose the Master One Bedroom Suite Upgrade to enjoy full all-inclusive privileges at the sister resort - Gran Porto Real on the beach. Room The rooms are adequate - bed, bathroom, couch, etc. and could use a serious upgrade. Decor and cleanliness reminded me of a college dorm party room. With the upgrade we paid for I was quite disappointed with a couple things: 1) The overall cleanliness of the room was sub-standard. The maids seem to work really hard with tidying things left laying around (make cute towel animals n' stuff), but I was confused what exactly they were cleaning. Bedspread looked like it had been in there (and not washed) since 1985 and I think our linens may have been changed once during our stay. 2) The shower sucked. Period. Could not move the shower head from a horrible direction which in addition to having to contort my body to take said shower, the floor got soaked every time. Water stayed hot long enough to get shampoo happening.... rinsed off cold. 3) The mini-bar contained half eaten food and half full bottles of water, pop and beer when we checked-in. Stayed this way the whole week. Food The buffet was repetitive and a little weird at times. Tripe soup at breakfast? Not so much. Thankful that there were at least some familiar choices at each sitting. Did always find something to eat that wasn't too bizarre. Ate a lot of fruit and salads and tried things that looked okay here and there without getting sick. 24-hour snack bar Fries, grilled cheese, nachos, cheese sauce, salsa, etc. Sounds good, right? Not if it's been sitting there since the bedspread was last changed. The only thing good about the snack bar was the never-ending beer tap after stumbling in off 5th Ave for a night cap, and meeting other travelers who were doing the same. Staff The staff are fantastic! Most of the people working at the hotel speak english to some degree. They are very friendly, funny and always going out of their way to make your stay happy and restful! The bartenders are awesome and the wait staff the best. I'm horrible with names to mention anyone personally, but there was more than one outstanding employee who provided us 5-star service. Simply the best! One of two reasons for rating this hotel 'very good'. Location The location of this hotel is PERFECT and the only other saving grace for me to have chosen a 'very good' rating for this hotel. Right at the end of 5th Avenue, which was always hustling and bustling with fun people and things to do. Short and enjoyable walk to the beach, shopping and nightlife. Loved the vibe in the front lobby bar, and could have sat on the swings for hours people watching and talking to other travelers. Nightly Shows Hilarious and fun! A great way to start the night if you're going out. Grab a bite and have a few drinks while watching their animation team do something fun. They give away prizes and have cool games. The Grounds BEAUTIFUL! I think most of their energy goes to maintaining the grounds. Kept very neat and clean. Always seeing someone sweeping, picking up garbage, etc. Lots of flora and fauna to admire. The Master One Bedroom Upgrade If you're thinking about it, forget it. Not worth the extra $. The bar at the beach club will serve you regardless of the upgrade. The website advertises, 'All Inclusive guests have full privileges of all restaurants, bars & facilities at Gran Porto Real Resort'. We had a real run-around with the Gran Porto staff to eat at one of their restaurants, and the food wasn't worth the hassle. They kind of treat you like 2nd class citizens because they know you're from the Real, using the upgrade. The only thing I was grateful for in using our upgrade was to check out the resort. We did, and wondered, 'If the same owners can keep this place looking nice, clean, etc., why don't they do it at the Real?'. Not sure what's up with that. Another thing that may be worth mentioning... They fumigate the food service area at night. I'm not sure how often, but we came back to the hotel late after celebrating NYE out and about to see someone fumigating with a backpack and hand-wand. We're talking the whole food service area/kitchen section was under a cloud of chemical 'smoke'. Kind of turned me off for being in there the rest of the week eating and drinking. Especially knowing the cleanliness standards of our room may match that of the food area. Wasn't crazy about possibly eating poison or having it all over the fixtures in there and not being cleaned off very well or at all. This may be one of the things that are common in Mexico that being a new traveler I'm naive to, even so... they should tell the guests when this is taking place and what pesticide(s) they're using. Bottomline? Great location, excellent service. Rooms need upgrading, food could be a bit nicer/fresher. I'd stay again just for the location (if it was cheaper than anywhere else on 5th), but not all-inclusive.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel i ever stayed in my life!”
Reviews.Author: Isaacn
Reviews.Content: Bad experience, horrible room, the person That cleans the room rings my bell every morning to wake me up even when the not disturb sign is on just because she wants to leave early, the bedroom bathroom is broken and the whole room smells like bad, horrible pools, the jail has better food, Iberia been Many times in playa del Carmen and I can tell That You can get better hotels for half the Price, if You want to enjoy your trip dont consider staying at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Good for the money”
Reviews.Author: mmeilleu
Reviews.Content: If you want a solid base for a vacation you spend mostly on the beach, walking around, in bars, and so on, then this is the place--not on the beach but a short walk away from it. Buffet is nothing exciting, but reliable. Rooms are clean, service is friendly, grounds are well-kept. Quiet location, but keep an eye on how development on the north end of 5th Ave proceeds; as shops and bars spread that way the neighborhood may start to get busier. Snack bar isn't worth a visit unless you want chips or a quick beer, and don't waste your time in Maria's--it's just the buffet food served on nicer plates. If you want to be pampered, if you'd rather not move far from your hotel, then you'll be happier paying more for something nicer and closer to the beach. Daniel and the 'animation team' (love that name) were great, as were the bartenders at the Real bar by their Gran Porto on the beach (you get access if you do the all-inclusive package).

Reviews.Title: “BEST X-MAS AND NEW YEAR'S EVE EVER”
Reviews.Author: Bruce A
Reviews.Content: We went to Real Playa del Carmen for the 2nd time, but this time was our best last weeks of the year 2011. The quality changed a lot, the staff and the service is just great. The buffet and the drinks are not the best but for x-mas and the last day of the year was commpletly awesome. The cleaners decorate very nice our bedrooms and always kept everthing in the place. All my respect the the Animation Staff. WOW...they did an amazing program of activities and shows for us. That was so great that on the christmas day came Santa Claus on a bike and surprised all the kids in the restaurant with gifts and mexican games. The internacional show is so awesome, with just 4 of them they make always crazy, funny and entertaining shows. The great and fantastic night was on the 31st of december. Espectaculaaaaar! The last dinner was really good with the brand new show of the 70's and 80's (lot of music from my time). The Entertainers worked really hard, we saw them dancing every night practicing until the midnight. Alex, you did a great performance in Sex Bomb. The girls, we love your afro-hairs. Congratulations dear: Viannei, Raqel and Alejandro, of course a special hug and greetings to the great leader Danijel. We miss you

Reviews.Title: “the worst "resort" ever/ its zero star...”
Reviews.Author: VancouverTakemeaway
Reviews.Content: This resort ruined our Christmas vacation. This was the worst trip ever, thanks to this resort. It is not a 3 or 4 star, its a 1 star. I am not a picky person or need pampering, just need comfortable, clean and food that was good. We arrived to find that the room we paid for not available, but another one was for more money. As I travelled with my sister, i was not worried to take the one king size bed room. That was far from what we got. It was a king sized hard dirty bed on top of blankets (to make it softer?) and then on top of two double sized wooden box springs. I have never slept on bed this bad. AWFUL!. The food was horrible. It was inedible. On day three of my trip i got food poisoning from the buffet. I spent the next day in bed ( on the horrilble hard awful bed) running to the toilet and back. I missed a very expensive day trip to the Ruins.... not fun. The food was always cold, nothing tasted like anything and i saw a chef mixing coleslaw with her hands and then shoving some in her mouth to eat! GROSS! I don't know what gave me poisoining but i had eaten nothing all day except for dinner at the buffet. HORRIBLE! Toast was cold, couldn't even melt butter on it, scrambled eggs tasted like cardbooard, nothing was fresh except for the bananas... We then booked a night at the a la carte restaurant. A little better, still yucky. Pasta with sauce that tasted like nothing... very boring. Yuck. The wine at the resort, disgusting, only one kind and tasted a lot like vinegar. The drinks.. were so so.. very skimpy onalcohol, had to ask for doubles in order to get singles.. The snack bar.. WOW...NASTY!!! cold leftovers from the nasty buffet. It was all disgusting. Not fresh, not good,. lots of it, simply disgusting. The people at the resort, very nice, good people,friendly and caring! i felt sorry they worked there. The amination team was excellent! they tried hard and were entertaining and funny. We really liked Danielle from Croatia.. we also felt sorry that the team had to eat the food there.! There is also another very bad thing... there is a time share thing in the lobby. While i was sick in bed, my sister talked to this lady ( I think Mariella?) in the lobby,she thought that since she worked for the hotel it was ok.. it was NOT OK. A timeshare thing. Go to the other resort Grand Portal and take a time share thing and then they would feed you breakfast and five you 500 pesos towards things at the resort.. After reading it, i said " TIME SHARE" and i didnt want to do it.. We went to canel with this lady and she came UNHINGED!angry that we dare cancel.. that her job was in danger.. blah blah.. that we COULDN"T CANCEL! like hello!!! i can do whatever i want! Anyhow.. it was just another thing to color badly the vacation.. stay away from this scam! The resort is clean, the pool was small but nice & the workers are nice. I would not stay here again ever, nor will i ever stay in a Real resort anywhere.. they know how bad this is and yet continue to do it. We also got some chocolates from the show at Christmas dinner.. and then we left it in our room..SOMEONE actually was in our room and ate most of the chocolates and left a half bitten piece in the box!!!! more disgusting. The room was noisy, the a/c was as loud as a jet taken off... awful awful and more awful The best part of our vacation was arriving home and staying overnight in a real hotel with a real bed and the next day we had a real buffet breakfast, Do yourself a favor and don't stay here, its terrible. It has clouded my judgement of Mexico... and i know there is lots of beauty there.. lots of places to stay... try any but this one.

Reviews.Title: “Guys you are the best”
Reviews.Author: wil E
Reviews.Content: my friend and I spent two weeks in this beautiful and friendly hotel. we have been enormously pleased with the welcome and the friendly people at this hotel especially the leaders. The kindness of these two leaders has been wonderful, you've made our holiday one of the wonderful holiday. We even decided to return next July 2011. The food, the decor in our room every day wowww. Thank you to the manager, servers and all the team .... we love you Facilitators, thank you, your show was sublime. Celine Dion would be proud to see you interprete of her songs, wowwwww. `I recommend all Canadians and other nations to come to you and live such beautiful moments. Thanks a lot G and Wil.

Reviews.Title: “I'd stay here again:)”
Reviews.Author: Debbie A
Reviews.Content: I was the Real from Dec. 5-20th, 2011. I feel the resort was price comparitive. I've stayed at both the Royal & Gran Porto but I paid considerably more. The rooms are modest but very clean, the food selection was great and the staff was fantastic. I love the location, right on 5th Ave. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it, unless they renovate & update immediately”
Reviews.Author: Carolyn-Fe
Reviews.Content: Playa del Carmen is our favourite vacation spot. We've been there at least 7 times over the years. This all-inclusive hotel is in dire need of a major over-haul. Rooms were sub-standard. There were cob webs on the ceiling, no guest amenities in the room. Although the manager 'upgraded' us and moved us to another room. This hotel would have been considered 'modern' if we were still living in the 1970's. Renovations are well over-due. For what we paid, we were better off elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “a gem in the rough!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jmgflwrlady
Reviews.Content: We spent a week here and enjoyed it thoroughly. The hotel is small, has a small but decent buffet, small clean rooms and a staff that goes the extra mile. We love to walk and the location was ideal.... 5 minutes to all the beach that Play del Carmen offers...just steps to the pedestrian 5th Avenue. I mentioned to the animation team that I wouldn't feel like I was in Mexico until I had my ceviche ...and the next meal the gentleman in charge of the kitchen brought me a huge bowl.. thank you, thank you. We found everyone polite & ready to help and would love to go back next week if we could. We had 2 sets of friends staying the same week, one in Playacar and the other in Xcaret, and even though their rooms were fancier & the buffets bigger, we wouldn't trade the ability to get out & walk and even make it to Cozumel from our location!!!

Reviews.Title: “it was ok probably would not stay again”
Reviews.Author: jilly1golf
Reviews.Content: it was ok...food i thought was good and i am picky rooms are out dated but the killer for me was the pool it just isn't fun no animation team around it everyday like the other hotels so no volleyball pool games etc. they were doing it at the beach till a fight broke out and they stopped the volleyball. also dinner is not till 7pm those with children thats late also for me i am diabetic and eat around 5:30 - 6pm i think 7 is too late everyone was nice but again i would pay a little more and upgrade

Reviews.Title: “Better than not going at all...”
Reviews.Author: mistinm
Reviews.Content: We stayed here July 2011, but after just getting back from Playa again in December, it reminded me that I had never wrote a review of this hotel. This hotel is in a good location on 5th avenue, but it needs some work. I didn't have high expectations...but I wouldn't stay here again. Unless you will eat anything and don't care about taste, I wouldn't choose the all-inclusive option. We really tried to eat here, but always ended up eating in town instead. The "buffet" is weird. They usually had mashed potatoes, some kind of shredded beef, peas and I don't even remember what else, not much. They never had chips, guacamole, salsa or pico! :( The front desk staff are rude and will always tell you "10 minutes" for clean beach towels even if its 30 minutes. The pool was gross! It had a layer of oil on top and all sorts of things floating in it. Pretty sick.The beach club sucked, you couldn't move the beach chairs an inch and the beach was rocky. If this is all you can afford its better than not going at all...if you have $100 or $200 more you can spend, I would go elsewhere :(

Reviews.Title: “This place is a blast!!”
Reviews.Author: Danfromohio
Reviews.Content: This place is great a group of use just got back and I can honestly say I had a blast. From the minute we walked in the door we were greeted with smiles. The hotel is very nice and clean and there was always something on the buffet that I liked. I never walked away hungry. The drinks were well liquors and draft beer but they never stop coming. The staff never lets you run dry they are so friendly and nice. The beach is a short walk or you can ride the shuttle where they have games and kayaking for you to do oh and the very important beach bar. But I would have to say my favorite part of this hotel was the animation team. They are very talented and funny they really get they guest involved. They are all wonderful dancer and just love to have fun. So I would highly recommend the shows they will keep you entertained. So if your looking to have a great time this is the place thanks hope to be back soon cant wait to see all my new frinds!! Sincerely Dan from ohio

Reviews.Title: “At these prices it isn't hard to be a good value.”
Reviews.Author: MexicanFoodMike
Reviews.Content: Ok so I read the reviews and decided to give this hotel a shot for a few days on my last trip to Playa. I think the reviews were accurate for the most part. This place is not the the Ritz but it also doesn't cost $1000 per night. To be fair to them they delivered a fair value. I get the impression that many of the other reviewers were perplexed when a $50 dollar a night all inclusive isn't incredible. You want a great location and a very economical hotel, this place is perfect for you. If you want something nicer your simply going to have to open your wallet wider. At the end of the day you typically get what you pay for so adjust your expectations to your budget and relax!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: Idsku
Reviews.Content: Real Playa del Carmen is a big hotel with a nice pool side and its own beach not so far away from the hotel. On the beach you can get any drink you want from the bartender and enjoy it under a palm tree on the beach chairs. In that beach it's not so nice to go swimming, but you can go swim a little bit further without problem. The food of the buffet restaurant is not so special but in the restaurant Maria, which is right next to it and also belongs to the hotel, the food was very good. The service in both restaurants is excellent. The staff is very friendly and makes you feel welcome in the hotel. The animation team was very good and their shows were really funny! The all included package means you get all the food and drinks for free. However, you can only get one kind of wine, which doesn't taste so special. There is also only very mild beers available such as Sol and XX Lager. To my taste they are too mild and tasteless. They have a high variety of cocktails though. There is no vegetarian menu in the buffet restaurant. Every salad contains at least one kind of meat. It's also hard to find out what ingredients they have used in the menu, so if you have a special diet (or you eat very healthy), the buffet might be a problem for you.

Reviews.Title: “good budget choice”
Reviews.Author: Kirkcaldy67
Reviews.Content: The Real Playa del Carmen is in a great position right on 5th Ave Norte and with it's beach club at the Gran Porto Real less than a ten minute walk it's perfect for the beach as well. I stayed in one of the master suites which gave me privileges at the beach club included. The room was spotlessly clean and good value for money. The staff is friendly and the food good. Carlos (I think on loan from the Gran Porto) was a great help in sourcing things I was looking for. A Cuban bar and restaurant the Bodeguita Del Medio, is directly across from the hotel has a great atmosphere with great live Cuban music and of course fine Mojitos! This is a good budget hotel which is close to the action and yet within easy walking distance of the beach. And as part of the Real Resorts chain, spotlessly clean with great friendly service. I would return.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and well priced”
Reviews.Author: Pauteam
Reviews.Content: The best price and animation , danijel and , in playa del Carmen all inclusive and very personal treatment.. Thanks guys!!

Reviews.Title: “Great time!”
Reviews.Author: LanaEdm
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 7 nights at the Real Playa del Carmen and thoroughly enjoyed our stay there. The hotel is very conveniently located right at 5th Avenue, and is a short, easy walk to the beach. We had a great room on the ground floor that was kept spotlessly clean by the housekeeping staff, which brings me to the number one reason to stay at this hotel. The entire staff is exceptional including front desk, security, the friendly maintenance personnel and groundskeepers and, above all, the terrific and incredibly hard-working wait staff who made our visit so enjoyable. We were so privileged to get to know Sonia, who worked the daily breakfast and lunch service, and who is an absolute joy. We looked forward to seeing her every day. And Fredy and Rodriguez always made us smile. Unfortunately, we were not able to learn everyone’s name which is really a shame because so many more deserve recognition. Kudos to the fantastic Animation Team who put on nightly entertainment at the hotel and presented a different activity or theme each night. Daniel and Vianey (apologies if any of the names in this review have been misspelled) are incredibly talented and absolutely hilarious. Their show featuring dances from around the world is a must-see and really showcases the talent of these two entertainers. So, don’t sit in your hotel room at night - go and interact with the Animation Team and other hotel visitors - it is so much fun!

Reviews.Title: “Smile :-)”
Reviews.Author: NewfieIslandGirl
Reviews.Content: Let me first start by saying that I am very well traveled and have stayed in resort from two star to five and one-half star and have taken six cruises. I have been to Cancun, St. Lucia, Cuba, Puerta Plata, Punta Cana, Jamaica (seven times), Costa Rica, Spain, etc. Below is my fair and honest review, including recommendations. I am from St. John's, Newfoundland and Labrador, Canada, and am a 38 year old female who traveled solo to this resort. I wanted to enjoy the simplicity of the sun and beach. However, when I arrived the weather was not so great the first couple of days, which was expected as it was hurricane season. This resort is a simple, modest three and one-half all-inclusive resort located directly on 5th Avenue. It is small and quaint. The resort is SPOTLESS clean and the food and drinks are very good. The service is impecable! I have read reviews about the food being repetative and not being a big selection and my response to that is that this resort is very small in that there are only 142 rooms here. Obvioulsy, there is not going to be as hugh of a selection as there would be on a hugh resort. All the food offered was healthy, non-greezy and tasty. If I were to make a recommendation: more food labels and perhaps try a different meat daily for breakfast, ie: ham, bacon, sausage, instead of weiners every day. I would not consider this a complaint as I was completly happy, but just a recommendation to provide more variety suitable to a typical Canadian/American breakfast. I stayed in room 418(b) which is a one bedroom located on the 4th Floor (six flights of steps). There is no elevator on the resort so staying on a level other than the first could be an issue for some. However, it was not an issue for me as I like to try to stay fit and enjoyed the hike. Johnny was the guy who cleaned my room and he did an amazing job! Every day my room was kept spotless clean with an arrangement of towel animals. One day I had five towel animals in my room. Also, at night a card at night with two hersey kisses saying, sweet dreams. The staff on the front desk were very helpful and everyone on this resort spoke English very well. I didn't experience any significant language barrier. I went to the spa on day number two and had a facial and massage for $60 which was AMAZING! The staff there are well trained and certified. The beach is a short stroll, maybe 7-10 minutes down 5th Avenue. I enjoyed the walk. The beach is beautiful! The beach club staff are also fantastic and even brought drinks to me while I was sunning in the lounge chair. I wouldn't even have to ask for another drink, they would ask if I was ready for another one. I booked the Coba tour from Maricio from Best Day and it was fantastic. We biked for two kilometers to the highest temple in Mexico, climbed the 120 steps to the top, biked back, kayaked, hiked, swam in a sonada (underground cave), ziplined, hung from vines in the jungle, had a blessing from a Mayan doctor, had lunch prepared by Mayan women and then shot tequilla to finish. It was an awesome day and quite adventurous. The entertainment staff were very friendly and nice and made efforts to make everyone on the resort feel at home. I would recommend this resort without question. To stay at the sister property is an extra $500 per person, per week. Personally, I would rather have a clean accomodation with good food and drinks and have my extra $500 to explore Playa and enjoy some nightlife, restaurants and shopping. The only negative thing I would say is that the only snack available at the beach club were nachos, salsa and fruit cocktale. As the "day life" on this property is pretty much non-existant, it would be nice to be able to order something simple, ie: hot dog, hamburger and fries and the beach club. I went to the beach daily and left around 10. In order for me to have lunch I would have to walk back to the resort or strip which would take at least a half-hour away from the beach and sun. Most days I pretty much skipped lunch and just filled up on frozen drinks, however, this is not ideal. I highly recommend that to offer a better quality of service and allow travelers to fully enjoy the beach that some food option should be available. I hope someday to return to Playa and maybe even stay at this property again. I hope this review helps and if anyone has any questions, please feel free to email me at: newfieislandgirl@hotmail.com.

Reviews.Title: “great holiday”
Reviews.Author: frannybannanny
Reviews.Content: I have travelled to many places and stayed in lots of different hotels from 2 star to 5 and my sister and I really enjoyed our stay. No place is perfect and if you look hard enough you can always find something. We would like to see more labelling of food on the buffet as I would like to know when there is fish in something. The staff was very friendly especially Sonia our breakfast and lunch waitress and our Omlettte chef made our breakfast perfect everyday! We did upgrade our room to the groundfloor as I have a bad back and cannot do the stairs and didn't mind paying the extra for that privelige and also it came with a fridge which was also useful. The food was good/small selection, but tasty and hot which was a surprise considering it was a buffet. The desserts were delicious not a lot of choices but different every day.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Tracy G
Reviews.Content: Great all inclusive resort that is within walking distance to shopping and beach. Great staff and food. Loved the Animation/ Entertainment Team of Daniel and Viena.

Reviews.Title: “Good location is all it has going for it”
Reviews.Author: ballking
Reviews.Content: The pictures and video online are very deceiving. We are budget travelers used to motel 6's and Dennys food and this hotel was I would say a notch below those simple standards. The food was the same everyday, rice, beans some sort of meat in a sauce. It was not great. Breakfast was dry hard pancakes, dry french toast. I would go with the yogurt or omelette as your best bet. The all inclusive deal with the drinks was what attracted us... however, we were surprised to learn that in the hotel lobby 3/4's of the liquor on the shelf we had to pay for, 1/4 was what was included in the all inclusive deal. And it was the cheap liquor you would never buy yourself. The beach was about 6 blocks away, the shuttle to the beach was scheduled to leave just about every hour but somehow when we showed up at noon to go to the beach we were told the shuttle was done for the day?! The beach is ok, it has the best snorkeling. It is rocky, and there are sand bags but we are easy to please, blue clear water was all we needed! The 24 hr snack bar was like going to 7-11, expect old hot dogs, chips and that liquid cheese that comes in a can. The room was not very comfortable, hard bed and hard pillows. Overall I was not impressed and would try somewhere else next time. I do need to say that all the staff were very friendly and just great wonderful people.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place to spend a week!”
Reviews.Author: humanwavetheresa
Reviews.Content: We chose Real Playa Del Carmen for the price and the location. When I first walked in I was disappointed...the resort is small and a bit tired looking. The rooms are basic - small and no bar fridge, hairdryer or elevator. However, by day two, I was in love with the resort and the staff! We have had great service before but never as friendly, personal or fun as this group! The location was awesome. Step outside the door and walk the 5th avenue. The better beach is a couple of blocks to the left where the sand is white and rock free and the water as clear as a swimming pool! The buffet was small but the food was quite good. We upgraded to a ground floor room part way through the week, which netted us a bar fridge, a bit more space and a terrace. Our son and his wife were happy with their quaint room as is. Danijel and his lovely assistant and dance partner were tireless in entertaining the guests - during the day on the beach and in the evening with the clever shows. If you're looking for variety of food and a fancy pool - pay more and go to the sister hotels the Royal or Porto - both in Playa del Carmen and quite nice . If you want clean, fun and personal - and like spending less - give the beach club a try. We'll go back for sure! Big thanks to the whole staff - especially Rodriguez and all our servers, Danjel and Miss V. From Team Canada - Theresa, Hugh, Danny and Char!

Reviews.Title: “Superb value”
Reviews.Author: canmex
Reviews.Content: Older hotel, standard rooms a little on the small or cramped side but a king size bed which was very comfortable.....somewhat noisy air conditioner, but it worked and you got used to it. The pool was very clean, and the service personnel where exceptionally accomodating. The buffet was perfectly acceptable, good quality and variety...again, waiters where exceptionally good. A 10 minute walk to the beach club.....more than enough chaise lounges, and snacks and drinks available. or you can take a shuttle that runs every half hour The rooms have a wall safe, a must to keep valuables and credit cards. Most staff speak English....value for money?? I would give this hotel 9 out of 10..no hotel is perfect

Reviews.Title: “The Staff Made The Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dundagirl
Reviews.Content: We visited and had a lovely time at the resort. It didn't offer much in the way of amenities to keep you occupied but if you just wanted to hang around the pool then this would be your type of place. We weren't much into the pool so we left the resort almost everyday for entertainment and fun. The food was not the best, I would have loved it if everything was labeled so I would know what it is that is on the buffet. I would often see parts of the previous day's offering on the buffet for the next day. The staff was alway smiling and trying to keep the guests happy, they were hopping to keep the place clean and offering drinks and any help that you may need. Thanks to Daniel, Exar and the rest of the crew; Alphonso trece is my new favorite drink. The first night we got to the resort we were so tired we went to bed early but couldn't sleep because we heard a lot of noise. We later discovered it was the entertainment team doing their thing. Thanks Daniel and Vianey for keeping us entertained. My daughter had a blast being part of your show. Go Canada. Our room was on the ground floor which was a bonus, as the hotel does not have elevators so you have to take the stairs and on those extremely hot days doing stairs would not be an option. I had some issues with the room but there were addressed and rectified immediately. Aranceli always had our room clean and with creative towel art that my daughter absolutely loved. Thanks for doing such a fantastic job The hotel is located right on 5th avenue, the shopping mecca so getting to and from the bustling vendors who were all your "friends" was quite easy. 5th Ave also boasted lots of fantastic restaurants I missed just walking to the beach, however the hotel provided shuttle service to and from the beach. Keep your eye on the schedule though, we missed it on one of the hotest days and waited what seemed like hours for it to arrive to bring us back to our hotel just in time for a nice refreshing shower. We had a great time on this our first trip to Mexico and again I must say that the staff made the hotel look like a 5 star resort. Keep up the good work.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and friendly people.”
Reviews.Author: the_traveler_69_10
Reviews.Content: Steff very friendly and always ready to help, especially Restaurant Staff and alfo the Activities team. Thanks to all, great job. Alejandro the GM, very profesional person.

Reviews.Title: “We really liked and are going back!!!”
Reviews.Author: Rhonda70
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Mexico and we really liked the resort...........ok, it is not new and shiny but the staff was great, food was awesome, service was outstanding and the deal we got........well, we were just happy that we were going to have an opportunity to put our feet in beautiful white sands so everything about the hotel was a bonus......okay the one thing we did feel cheated out of was the beach..........rocky and full of sand bags BUT............just a short walk up was a public beach in great shape so we filled our bubba mugs and moved on..........felt sorry for the people who paid for 5 star hotels who shared that bad beach with us........we got a great deal but if we paid big bucks and had that beach we would have been ticked......... I highly recommend to catch a cab to nearby Talum and go to Paradise Beach for the day and of course view the local ruins, NOW THAT IS A BEACH!!! But the shopping and nightlife was great...........if you are looking for a five star then dig deep in your pockets and go else where.........however, if you are an average traveller just happy to get away from the cold and snow and enjoy yourself, you will not be disappointed................we weren't we booked to go back again next year already!!!

Reviews.Title: “very disappointing 2 Star hotel”
Reviews.Author: misio327
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving to the hotel, we found out that our room was not ready. We had to wait in the lobby for 30 minutes with our bags. This also happen to be the last 30 minutes of lunch. This was a very disapointing start to our vacation. We had a room on the ground floor which was very convenient, considering we were traveling with a toddler who used a stroller. Our room was considered the "Family Suite". It had enough space for a king size bed, sofa bed, tv, mini bar, and small bathroom. It seemed very small. We knew the hotel was not on the beach but were not expecting it to be so far. We had to walk over 10 blocks each time we wanted to go to the beach! It was a draining walk especially with a toddler. The servers were very nice and helpful. Unfortunately, I felt like the resort was not well taken care of. The pool was dirty, and was not cleaned regularly. Frequently, you could see gargage and cigarrete buds next to the pool and nobody seemed concerned about cleaning it up. It seemed like the resort was filled with many local people, and a few tourists from other countries. Even the waiters were suprised to see Americans in their resort. The food was buffet style. It was not labeled and not appetizing. It seemed like the food was recycled from meal to meal. They did serve hot dogs, and hamburgers, and tacos. There was NO guacamole! They did serve nacho chips with cheese almost at every meal. The resort was also weired about giving out water bottles. We were frequently denied a water bottle and given filtered water in a glass. This was annoying since we really wanted to take a water bottle for our walk to the beach. A few times we ended up buying a water bottle from the local stores becuase they woudn't give us one. For the 5 days we spent at the resort, all the snack bar had is nachos and cheese. Overall, we were disappointed and expected more considering the positive reviews on tripadvisor. It was all very decieving.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: jhathaway
Reviews.Content: I felt like we really learned the lesson of you get what you pay for with this hotel. We knew it wasn't near the beach, but we didn't know the rooms wouldn't be very nice, there's not a room there that has a bathtub, we weren't able to get a lounge chair once while we were there, the pool was small and the food was not great. The staff was nice & courteous but that's about the only upside. It was nice to go to the other resorts' beaches but you aren't allowed to go in their pools (we tried!) and it really just makes you sad you didn't just book a room there. Cleanliness also, the sheets were typically not clean, bed was uncomfortable and there was tons of trash just lying around the hallways etc. Not terribly impressed. Overall, again I just say, we got what we paid for, but I wouldn't recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place on fifth ave!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: bricahrdella
Reviews.Content: Forget about mega resorts if you love the feel of being in town with all the fun and excitment. Me and my wife stayed here for 8 days and would go back in a heart beat. We upgraded our room to the master one bedroom with hotel upgrade to use the grand porto resturants and hotel ammenites. This was worth it. We asked for a gound floor by the pool and we were directly in fornt of the pool/ resturant. Huge deck with a big table and the pool waiter keep up on us with ice cold beers and even an ice bucket to put them in. The nice thing about this place was NO TAP corona they had differnt local bottles off beers. The food was ok but you can use the grand porto's resturants which are great. Right at the end of 5th ave with out side lobby seating and a live band every night across from the outside seating. I love the night life in playa and me and my wife have been to playa 10 times and this was the best. The only thing I would complain about was the 24hour snack bar. It was just hot dogs and nachos but what soaks up the alcahol better. Try playa wings and pizza and you wont be dissapointed. We mainly used the grand portos adult sky deck pool and the walk there in the moring was great exercise and nice with not to many people out. I would recomend staying here if your on a budget or not. We are getting ready to book again. Great resort and great staff

Reviews.Title: “Bad Hotel not near the beach”
Reviews.Author: gineguay
Reviews.Content: When arrived at Real Playa Del Carmen, I realise that the beach was at 10 min walk from the hotel and the the Real was a shabby hotel. The guy told me that I didn't pay for all inclusive and it was not true! I try to reach the customer service of CheapOair and took me 30min. No body took care of me. I contact them twice and same crapy result. I won't recommande the cheaper service to my worst ennemy. So don't go theire and do do any business with cheapOair, the customer service is bad and doesn't not include shuddle or any service before and after. The rent me a car without my permission. It was an horror show dearling with them!!!

Reviews.Title: “The Real Resort definitely exceeded our expectations!”
Reviews.Author: HEYYYYYYY
Reviews.Content: The Real Resort is a very quaint and beautiful setting. The walk to the beach was short and enjoyable - you were able to see some of the local vendors in town, which were very expensive, but still fun to look at. We had been warned that Mexico could be unsafe, however we always felt very safe and never had any problems. The All Inclusive was definitely worth the money - free drinks at the beach and delicious meals with wonderful variety. We were pleasantly surprised by the entertainment each night at 8:15 in the resort's restaurant. The shows were run by the Animation Team - three amazing comedians, dancers, and performers. There were prizes awarded during audience participation, there was beautiful dancing, and some skits made us laugh so hard we cried. Another plus was the staff. They were friendly, helpful, funny, and always had a smile on their face. The restaurant staff were always there to help out, and the Trip Coordinator was very helpful in organizing amazing trips to Akumal, Rio Secreto, Xel-Ha, and the Mayan ruins of Tulum. Overall, it wasn't too fancy but was well worth our money and time. The Real Resort is definitely a do-again! We would recommend this resort to anyone who enjoys the flavor of Mexico, but doesn't need the staleness of a five-star hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Best Kept Secret in Playa Del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: TRIPP15
Reviews.Content: Sorry for the long review but the bad reviews are oh so wrong!!! If you want a taste of Mexico and with an AI plan this is the place! We are not picky travelers at all and for us the Real Playa Del Carmen was just right. We checked in on June 6th for a 2 week stay. After getting a room on the fourth floor in the Chichen section we decided with the humidity so high to up grade to a ground floor room and were very happy. Even though this resort is not on the beach it’s location is perfect, close enough to 5th ave to enjoy it when you want and far enough that you wouldn’t even know it was there. The room: For us it was perfect. Nice patio with a table, 2 chairs and a hammock. Nice little seating area slightly separate bedroom and small bathroom. We also had a fridge which was restocked daily with beer, water and pop. The maid did a fantastic job of keeping our room clean. Also the AC was wonderful but we actual found some times it worked so well we would have to turn it off and open up the windows. The bed was firm but not overly so and we never had a problem sleeping. The food: Excellent! As one of the other reviews said not quite sure what half of it was, (then complained about it?) we didn’t know what some of it was either but we tried it all and enjoyed it. It was so nice to go to the buffet and eat something other than hamburgers/hot dogs like they do at the bigger more commercial resorts. We had not one complaint about the buffet food and enjoyed every meal there. The only meal that we found slightly lacking was the A la Carte. Instead of complaining and whining we just went over to the buffet and grabbed something there. The pool: The pool was great. Nice and small with enough loungers that no one ever went without. We also enjoyed the fact that they did have music playing but instead of being loud and obnoxious it was just wonderful background noise. By afternoon the water was more like luke warm bath water which we enjoyed as it soon became our favourite gathering place to have cocktail with a wonderful group of people we met at the resort. We also had the luxury of having pool service every afternoon drink wise and were delighted as it was not something we were expecting. The beach club: We knew well in advance what the beach area would be like in front of the beach club. (that is why we are so surprised by the snarky reviews from some people) DO your research! We went down quite a few times to the beach club and sat on the swings and had a drink wandered around came back had a drink. On a few occasions we filled up our bubba kegs and walked across the pier a few minutes put down our towels and spent a whole afternoon there walking back to the beach club to get our drinks enjoying a perfect beach and water. The pool bar: One word amazing!! During the day out by the pool or sitting at one of the tables on the patio playing cards they were always making you drinks and getting to know you so that when they saw you later they would remember you and ask about this or that as we would them. We also learned quite a few phrases at the pool bar that we are still practicing for our next trip. I think this is one area where management might want to lighten up on as we enjoyed the interaction with the staff here immensely and found that just because they would be chatting with the vacationers they were still working hard and doing a perfect job. When management started to hover we noticed the difference in the level of interaction with the staff immediately as the staff seemed to be tip toeing around trying not to draw management’s attention. (this was not only evident at the pool bar but every where through out the resort towards the end of our stay) The lobby bar: Great to grab a drink on the way back from walking 5th ave in the afternoon heat. They were more than accommodating in making you anything you wanted or making special drinks you may never have tried before. The beer was cold and the tequila flowing what more could you ask for!! The staff: This is where we think the hotel shines the most. Never have we encountered such warm, friendly and accommodating staff and we travel to Mexico 1 or 2 times a year. I even made a point of writing down every persons name so I could mention them and say THANK YOU for an unforgettable experience. From the Bartenders, Wait Staff, Animation Team and every single person who works there job well done!! Marceloni (Okie Dokie) Sonya (cream for my Husband’s coffee every morning) Omar and Mateo (never had to wait for a cocktail and wonderful pool side service) Luis and Gustavo our wonderful lobby bartenders Sonya the Omelet Chef who made the best every morning Fernando the bell boy what a wonderful and attentive employee Glendi (whose new cocktails were wonderful and a treat (thank you for the Spanish lessons) Rodrigo and Bersain great service with a smile every day The animation staff Vyaney, Danijel and (brand new) Paco thank you for entertaining us each evening we enjoyed the shows and for also playing Uno with us on a cloudy and very overcast day. For any of the employees I may have missed please accept my apologies. This place is the one place we would come back to and will. We are already planning our trip for the fall and look forward to seeing all of the wonderful people that work there again!! Hopefully also the great people we met at the resort. Tarik and Jodie from Abbotsford, Iolo from Wales/Belize and Steven and Sandra from Scotland. Laurie and Bob

Reviews.Title: “Best Party Ever”
Reviews.Author: Chicharito123
Reviews.Content: Well this my first trip to playa del carmen and I decided to go alone which well turned out to best decesion! Before arriving to the resort I knew I wasnt going to a luxury 5 star palace and that was fine by me. Upon arrival i was greeted by the most up beat door man who insisted to carry all bags to my room and on top of that he brought me over a really good drink which I wasnt expecting, so off to a good start. My room was nothing special but had everything I needed for a solo traveller so I wasnt complaining, well...there was one thing, that was the toilet wasnt working, but they fixed pronto! As far as the food goes, it wasnt that bad but my only complaint would be the snack bar, yeah avoid the snack bar food!! The best part about this resort had to be the people and the atmosphere they created, everymoring the staff would eother shout out or greet with "chicharito" which was the nickname i aqquired during my stay here, and omar you were the coolest guy there! The entertainment was very interactive and they truly made you feel part of the show, well especially me! great job daniel! the games were fun especially the picture game!! Since this is not a huge resort, meeting new people was very easy and we all had a great time in the lobby and you really felt close with everyone...bottom line if your looking for a resort to have an up close and personal expierence with everyone, then come here! again thanks real for making feel like part of the team! on a side not I will be back in 3 months so watch! jajaja see you in october!! CHICHARITO!!!

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel, good location but can find better in Playa Del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: sus0xf0rd
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend stayed at the Real Playa del Carmen for two weeks this June. We loved our trip to Playa del Carmen, the beach is great and there's enough to keep my easily bored boyfriend happy. There's loads of lovely restaurants (our favourite El Carnicero for the best steaks). Playa del Carmen is in a great location for doing trips and seeing more of Mexico. We booked last minute and so were not expecting anything amazing. Our room was pretty basic but nice and clean. The only problem was the really really noisy air conditioning. The food was ok, the breakfast had quite a lot of options although it didn't really vary for the whole 2 weeks. The beach bar food was practically non existent, all that was available was chips and salsa so not really lunch! We were disappointed with the a la carte restaurant which was the worst mexican food we had all holiday. The staff were lovely and really friendly which is really the hotels strong point. Another plus for this hotel is the location, it is in a nice quiet place but the centre of Playa del Carmen is less than 5 mins walk. This hotel is ok for a base which is what we wanted but if you are going to spend a lot of time in the hotel then it's worth spending a bit more money. If I was to go again I would spend that extra money on a nicer hotel.

Reviews.Title: “not really what we expected......”
Reviews.Author: kelbelle4
Reviews.Content: having read the reviews, and seen the website online we were expecting a bit more from this resort. when we got there and checked in, we unfortunately had a room at the very top of the building and having to go up 32 stairs just to get to the room was annoying... the room itself was cozy - but stiffling!! we got in at 4 pm and the a/c was not on. there was an available upgrade to a room with a king size bed and mini fridge for 18$ extra a day, but we didn't upgrade. so... no mini fridge. the bed was a decent size though. tv was small, had mostly spanish shows, and anything that wasn't spanish had subtitles. the only thing we really liked about this resort is the location. it's quite close to downtown, which is nice, because you're close to a lot of restaurants and the nightlife. the beach is a 15 minute walk away from the resort (you could take a shuttle there, but they only come once an hour). there were approx 10 beach chairs available at any given time, and a rather small pool. the staff were nice, especially a man who took your bags at the time of check in (he helped me with mine all the way upstairs) and he was always smiling and saying hello. luis, at the bar, is also very nice, and sang me a song for my birthday which was sweet! we weren't impressed with the food... not quite sure what half of it was, and wasn't really edible to us (mystery meat?), so we ended up only eating it maybe 3-4 times the whole time we were there :( which is sort of sad since we did pay for it to be all inclusive. you get what you pay for.... we wouldn't stay here again because it was smaller than what we had hoped for, and it was the only resort we've ever been to that wasn't located directly by the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for us”
Reviews.Author: JazzyKaz
Reviews.Content: Anyone who has stayed in any of the older hotels and resorts in Mexico's tourist areas will have no problem here. My wife and I stayed here for two weeks last January. We had upgraded to a one bedroom. The room itself was more like a regular hotel room with a long hallway, more or less. But I found it acceptable. We were located away from the pool overlooking the gardens where the local birds entertained us in the large tree. The only issue we had was with the toilet. The water pressure was almost nonexistant, so you had to flush a number of times. We did have a mini fridge, and since we didn't go all inclusive, it was nice to have. We prefer to eat at the great restaurants just steps outside the hotel. But we were asked if we wanted to add the all inclusive when we were checking in. We declined, but a few days in, we asked if we could do this day by day, and we could. This was brilliant, because we were able to take advantage of the AI when we were feeling lazy and wanted to just hang around the hotel, or maybe go to the beach club, which was a great option. So we ended up with the best of both worlds. The food at the AI was fine. There was decent variety and quality was good. I almost hate to say, but the entertainment was really, really lame. After two weeks of staying here and hearing the same thing almost everynight.....uhh. Oh well. I know they tried their best. There are two outstanding reasons for booking this hotel. #1 by far are the staff that work here. I thought the people on the Pacific side were great, but these people here are just amazing. Extremely warm and welcoming. Always a smile, from the maids, bellboy, waiters, front desk. Just can't say enough about them. The #2 reason to book here is the location. Quiet side of 5th Ave. but steps away from all the restaurants and shops. In my experience, if you like AI's on the beach with fancy water fountains and modern mega resorts that are so isolated from the "Real" Mexico, you won't like it here. For those of you who do realize that you are in a very different country than Canada or the US and want to experience a little more of the culture than just sipping a Margarita at your pool, this is a pretty sweet spot.

Reviews.Title: “Too many problems... avoid”
Reviews.Author: fryman04
Reviews.Content: This hotel's only pros are the location, right on 5th av., and the barman Omar. Now for the cons: I was placed on a 3rd floor room. Problem is that it got direct sunlight all day long, which meant that it turned into a small oven. The rooms have a crummy 15 year old AC unit which never manages to cool the room even slightly. It is also placed on the floor and to catch a small breeze when sleeping we had to move the bed and tables around. Bed is old too, with spring coils bumping in your back. Hot water stopped after 2 days so we had to take cold showers. Pool is tiny. Most of the staff is friendly, except for the lady at the omelette station which must hate her job since she never, ever smiles. She also pay no attention to what you order and doesn't cook the ingredients well, I had to eat raw onion and peppers thanks to her. The parking lot is a pain in the butt, with people stopping you every single time you go out or in and asking for your room number I had several important emails to send and the internet service here sucks. When it was not down completely it was so slow that even sending an email was a huge task. Food is completely average. Buffets with same ingredients over and over. The beach club is located on the worst beach in Playa, where you can't even swim in the ocean because it is full of sandbags, rocks and sea weed. As you can see, this is a lousy plce to stay in, when there are hundreds of better options in Playa. I wouldn't recommend this place to ANYONE

Reviews.Title: “You can't beat the Real”
Reviews.Author: mark_and_bev
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from our 7th visit to the Real Playa del Carmen and were once again pleased with the overall quality of this hotel. Our room was a Master one bedroom suite on the bottom floor. The room was very clean and well maintained. The bed was very firm but for a person with back issues was perfect for my wife and I. Entertainment in the evenings was enjoyable with lots of audience participation. We ate everymeal in the buffet and the menu was never repeated. We like this size of hotel where the staff becomes well aquainted with the guest and visa versa. I believe this is the only all inclusive of this size right on 5th avenue. If you want a vacation in a laid back setting and very economical I would highly recommend this hotel. We are already planning our 8th visit soon.

Reviews.Title: “Third time around”
Reviews.Author: onabudget007
Reviews.Content: This was our third trip to Playa and the hotel and this time we took our kids and grandkids. It was enjoyed by all. We have always been treated very well by the staff and this time was no exception. Our kudos go out to Bersain and Rodrigo, who went out of their way to make sure we had all that we needed, both at the hotel and the beach. At the hotel they made sure we had what we needed for the grandkids in the resturant, highchair, drinks, extra napkins you name it. The staff loved to come by and get a high five from our grandson and he loved giving them back. At the beach Bersain made sure that we had shade for the kids, chairs to sit on and plenty of fluid for the kids and us. No he did not ignore the rest of the guests. Also made sure that we were able to get a ride back to the hotel if the kids were tired or asleep (the hotel is not right on the beach but we had no problem with that because the walk does you good down there and just nice to see and say hello to the locals that you get to know) The girls who did the activities on the beach were just as great. They would do their job and then when they had a couple of minutes they would come and play with the grandkids. Gave us all a little break. If you are looking for a five star hotel then no don't come here. (who spends that much time at the hotel anyways) If you are looking for a more authentic Mexico atmosphere, laid back, not stuffy, more like you are part of the family then stay here. No it is not perfect but then what place is. There is always something wrong or not the way you like it at any place. We truly enjoy this place and have no problem putting up with a little glitch, if one happens. Life is too short to get up set over little things. The staff is willing to help if you just ask nicely and don't go in with guns blazing. We are looking forward to our fourth trip again. Hoping a lot of the same staff will be there so we can pick up where we left off on the friendships. This hotel is right on 5th Avenue and makes a wonderful walk before and or after the evening dinner. 5th Avenue is growing and there is more happening all the time. Just remember if you want perfection die and go to heaven otherwise have fun when you go to Mexico wherever you stay.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel”
Reviews.Author: armantas
Reviews.Content: good hotel end nice personeel good prijs to.near the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Having fun in Mexico!”
Reviews.Author: Flora_Simon
Reviews.Content: I'm from Brazil and I really enjoyed my stay in Mexico! Playa del Carmen is incredible! It was a really good trip and I loved the hotel. It's not a fancy resort, but they have the All-Inclusive option. The dinner were always the funniest part. After visiting places and beaches all day, we arrived at the hotel, took a quick shower, and went to the restaurant to have dinner watching the show time. The show were always good, and one day the animation team asked my father to take part in and play a game with they. It was really really good and I will never forget this trip. I recommend for all of you. Other good point, is that the hotel is really well located. Is really near from beach and is in the main street of the city. They have a beach club, which you can relax, sunbathe, have a drink... It was the best choice we have made. And the prices were really good too.

Reviews.Title: “Best Holiday ever! Thanks to the staff and animationteam!”
Reviews.Author: JoyceHollanda
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the " Real" for 18 days in April and May. The best 18 days ever spent. The hotel is not very big and luxurious. It's not a 5 star resort were the staff doesn't know your name or even recognise you wen you walk in. If you are looking for a hotel to relaxe this is the place to be. The 5th avenue is right outside the lobby and the beach club is a 10 minutes walk. If you walk along the beach it's realy beautiful. The food was fine, not excellent, but for a small hotel the food was good. The beakfast was the best. Fruit, toast, eggs everything you could wish for they have it. Lunch is also great. Salades, pasta and always rice with meat and sauce, Dinner is also very nice. The drinks are great, you can even take them to your room. The room was sober, but oke. It was clean and de ladies make animal figures of towels. The staff is great!! We had very long flight (13 hours) and the staff welcomed us pleasant! All the staf recognise you and try to emember your name and know where you from. Rodriguez tried to teach us Spanish every morning. Sonya, German and all the others check if you're oke and get everythng for you. Omar makes the best cocktails ever. Just tell him wat you like and he'll mix the nicest cocktails. Special thanks to the animationteam: Danijel, Daniela and Vyaney!! Your shows are amazing, beautiful and very funny!! The dance shows were beautiful and the quiz shows were a lot of fun! We enjoyed participating! Hopefully you can make many more shows like this! Kids also enjoy the shows and the games at the beach. We had the best time thanks to the staff and animationteam. We will definitaly recommand your hotel to our friends and family. Your friends from Hollanda

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great People”
Reviews.Author: Gizmo110
Reviews.Content: We had a great experience at the Real Playa. We would definitely return. This is not a 4 Star resort, but it is very nice and relaxing. The rooms and grounds were nice enough(the bed was a little firm for my taste) and the food was adequate. There were enough choices on the buffet that you never left hungry. It was also nice that you had access to a beach club which was wonderful. The thing that I will remember most about my experience is the people. They are some of the friendliest I have ever met. They truly seem to want to please. And all with a smile. A special thank you to Teodore, German, and Omar for making sure we enjoyed our stay. Also the location is great, within walking distance to everything on 5th Avenue. As a final thought I would say if you are looking for luxury this probably not for you, but if you want a relaxing and friendly hotel this is your place. It is a great value for what we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Comfortable, Affordable”
Reviews.Author: rbauer76
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel on a deal from Funjet for our honeymoon. We stayed in a master one-bedroom suite on the top (6th) floor--it had a good view of the pool. It was incredibly clean and the staff was very friendly and accommodating. It is in a quieter location, which was very nice for relaxation but if we wanted to go anywhere in town, the fact that we were at the north end of 5th Avenue meant an extra 5-10 minute walk to most of the shops and restaurants.
