A little hut on the back of the property offered couples' massages--it was the best we've had for price and quality. For each of us to receive a 60-minute deep-tissue massage, we paid only $66 total! We purchased the all-inclusive package for food and drinks, and we probably wouldn't do that again. The food was average to good on most days, but we had more fun going into town to choose different restaurants. The drinks were not very strong, which meant we mostly stuck to beer, and there were very limited choices for brands. We ended up buying liquor at Walmart and making our own drinks so we didn't have to go back and forth to the bar so often. The waitstaff and bartenders were great. On our second day, after we met with our Funjet representative to arrange our return trip to the airport, we were asked to sit down with a Real Resorts representative--normally we would have said no, but we didn't really feel like we had a choice. He told us all about how they don't offer timeshares anymore because they weren't good for the customers, but they have new, better offers that we could learn more about if we went to a different hotel for a 2-hour breakfast or lunch and listened to a talk of some sort. When we politely tried to refuse, we got a little bit of a guilt trip--he said he has a family to provide for, how could we say no to the free gifts he was offering, etc. That was a complete turnoff--we understand that they have to try to sell their product, but this person took it too far. Other than that, however, we had a very pleasant stay. Just beware that if you stay there, you'll probably get sucked into the same situation.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome staff, hotel, and location”
Reviews.Author: MicheleGR41
Reviews.Content: First of all, all of the other reviews are way off. This is a small boutique hotel, not a huge resort. That is just what we wanted. You can walk to everything. 5th Avenue is right outside the lobby, beach is 2 blocks away, and if u upgrade, the Gran Porto is about 6 blocks walking, which is nothing. The staff here is awesome, Omar, Xzar, Teodore "Teddy Bear", my "Chicka" at the buffet bar, Gus the bell boy, Sonya, I know I'm forgetting some of them, but they are what makes the trip that much better. The shows, especially Daniell, are funny and lots of audience participation. The food was good for a smaller hotel, but there are soooooo many places on 5th ave, it didnt matter. I will definately be back at this hotel. Home and already miss it and my amigos. Just stay away from Sergio, he is nice, but pesty. He wants u to go to the other resort down the road and actually followed us down the road a bit.

Reviews.Title: “Had a nice relaxing vacation in "Playa" at the Real Playa del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: beachy5759
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the "Real" the week of April 10 -17. Being in Playa a few times in the past (taking the ferry over from Cozumel) we pretty much knew where the hotel was. Right at the north end of 5th avenue (main street from where everything is). My husband and I liked it there. It was more of an "Old Mexico" quiet laid back feel away from all the hussle and bustle. Which is what we are looking for. If we wanted to check out the action and night life it was right out the front door. The rooms were adequate. The bathroom was tight, but everything worked. Even had hot water in the shower (which my husband always complains about when traveling in Mexico). The rooms were clean and the bed was fine. Some people complained about the beds being stiff, but we actually slept good all week. The air conditioners are loud and could be updated. The view wasn't the best (4TH FLOOR overlooking the 24 hour service area) Would have liked something by the POOL or even on the 1ST 2ND or 3RD FLOOR - Too many stairs. But for the most part it was OK. Keep in mind this is a 2* hotel and everything will be fine. The food was good. We had the buffet every day - breakfast was the best meal of the day (everything you can think of on it). There was a main course every night for dinner - turkey, beef roast, fish, fajitas, pork, etc. Some of the food wasn't to our taste, but we never went away hungry. After dinner there is a show evey night and that was fun to watch. As for the 24 hour service area that could use a little attention. The pop was warm on some occasions or out of serve for awhile. The selection of food was minimal and maybe they should consider a taco bar with beef, chicken, cheese, salsa, guacamole, lettuce, tomatoes and onions with chips and flour tortillas. As for the drinks, there was always and abundance of those. Anytime we wanted, and they were delicious. Marcielano made me specialty drinks all the time - ticket to fly - dirty monkey - tornado - mango tango - iceberg - rainbow - etc. They were the best. I wish I had one right now. I think the best part of our trip would be the nice friendly staff. We enjoyed all of you. Thank you to Sonja - our favorite waitress (and baby Kevin) Bersain and Rodricko - who served us drinks everyday at the hotel and beach club Marcielano - My favorite all time bartender (Te Quiero) Lizzy - our housekeeper Theodoro - He waited on us a couple times too I miss you all and look forward to staying there and seing you again.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING”
Reviews.Author: mexicolover058
Reviews.Content: i stayed here with friends and it was absolutely amazing ! we had a great experience and want to go back as soon as we can. the food, location and rooms were all excellent but the best part of the trip was the animation staff ! danijel, vyaney, daniela and gabriel were great and so much fun ! they performed in shows everynight and they were great to watch. international and hollywood was our favourite. i recomend this hotel to anyone looking to have a great time. SAY HI TO THE AMAZING STAFF FOR US !

Reviews.Title: “WOW!!! Esta Bien!!!”
Reviews.Author: crazypy
Reviews.Content: WOW, had a great time in Playa del Carmen. My friend Élaine and I (P-Y) Just love it there. Big parts of it was in fact because of the staff of the Real Beach Club. Daniel and Vianney were just amazing to say the least. Spectacular FUN!!!. Thank you very much for a great time. A real all inclusive, never had to wait for a drink. The rooms would need a litle TLC but considering the price we paid, well anough said. LOL. Food is OK!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, But ........”
Reviews.Author: Dardal
Reviews.Content: Spent a week at this resort in March. Rooms were clean, food was good, although not much selection, but what was there was good everyday. Service in buffet was excellent, especially Omar and Sonja. Treated us like Royalty. Bar staff in lobby were very friendly and entertaining. Wireless internet available in lobby for free. Just get your code from your tour agent. The pool is really small and not much sitting area around it. As for entertainment, we never saw any shows as we were out every night on 5th ave. and we only saw the entertainment staff on the first night we were there. In their defence though, we left early every morning for the beach club and spent the day there. Only a 10 minute walk from the resort to the beach club. Club had light snacks there everyday and were ok. Although there was nothing we could find wrong with this place, we just don't think we'd go back there. Just wasn't for us . If you like a quiet resort and friendly staff, this is a good place to go.

Reviews.Title: “amazing staff, to help with an amazing time”
Reviews.Author: R33DY
Reviews.Content: activities are available throughout the day, large pools, adult areas, amazing food, staff are very friendly and do their best to ensure you enjoy your experience. the roomas are spacious, and are always kept clean, theres always entertainment going on with the excellent entertainment team who get everyone active. Nathan Reed

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional staff, location and fun place to be!”
Reviews.Author: gr8tfulgal
Reviews.Content: Location is great for being close to everything.....The patio, bar, restaurant, front desk and Activities Team Staff are wonderful!! It was such a fun stay and the facility feels like "old Mexico". It was great to be near everything and have the convenience of getting to the Beach Club, shopping and nightly activities.

Reviews.Title: “Older resort in a good location. If you know what to expect you will enjoy your stay”
Reviews.Author: SunSandandBeach40
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Real Playa Del Carmen in March of 2011. Did our research, got a great deal, knew what to expect and had a very relaxing vacation. The Real in only a short walk away from the beach and about 10 minute walk to their beach club. It is however right on 5th Ave and all the activity. The resort is older and has seen better days, but it is a great vaue if you are not expecting a 4 or 5 star resort. We stayed in a 1 bedroom suite, which was nice. Can't tell you about the basic rooms, but don't expect frills. Basic, older but clean and livable. Food is edible but the same basic things ever day. What we learned was they only put out basics in the buffet line. No tortillas, salsa etc. So we would ask for the things we were missing and the waiters would go out of their way to get them for us. One day we felt like ice cream and all we had to do was ask. Very friendly staff for the most part. Specifically Rodrigo and Andeas waiters and Reyes as the lobby bar tender. Also need to mention the beach bar tender and a young man who served us drinks every day on the beach. Sorry, can't remember their names. If you make reservations at Maria's, their sit down and order restaurant, try the flank steak. Excellente'. Maria's is actually right next door to the buffet and only seperated by a railing. Not many Americans, lots of Italians, Swedish, Fins, Canadians and yes, French Canadians. Nice people for the most part, but talk about a melting pot. Do not know how the staff keeps up with all the different languages. The Swedes need to relax a bit more, had several up tight Swedes pushing for first service. Heah, we were on vacation and just let them go. If you stay here definately try out the Cuban bar accross the street. Live music each night. It seemed like one of the hot spots on 5th Ave. The beach club is nice, lots of chairs and umbrellas. They serve chips and fruit most days. Drinks are great and cervesa is cold. I believe most of the beer they serve is on tap Dos XX's. The beach at the club isn't the greatest, lots of rocks, but their is a small lagoon about waiset deep to cool of in and or snorkle for limited fish species. The best beach is just a few steps away if you want to swim and play in the ocean. All in all this was a very inexpensive vacation and nice. We knew what to expect, and got everything we asked for. We are not super picky and realize this is Mexico. Take it all in stride, slow down and enjoy another culture. We have been all over Mexico and not sure if we will ever stay here again. It isn't because of the amenities, the hotel. We just like to switch it up and try new things and places each time we go.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Tazman55449
Reviews.Content: The best part of Real Playa del Carmen Resort is the staff, Thanks Danielia, Jesus, Reyes, Gustavo, and everyone else. Sorry names have slipped this old mind. My wife had special needs and the staff went out of the way to accomodate her and us. I would say the accommodations were a bit wore, bed was hard as in most places, our room was nice. This resort is a 3.5 star resort and is just that. If your looking for a 5 star hidden in 3 star prices, not happening. I didn't expect more, so not disappointed. If there was a down side, food was mediocre at best, but available. Location: not on the beach, but everything is definately walkable if you choose too, even the ferry peir.

Reviews.Title: “Location, service, weather....this place has it all.”
Reviews.Author: jimbo772000
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week at Real Playa del Carmen. Across the board, the level of service is excellent. We enjoyed most of the restaurants and loved going to Pelicano's for breakfast and lunch, because of the outdoor beach location. The daily fresh salsa/guacamole and chips was a treat. The weather averaged near 85 degrees everyday. On the windy days, we enjoyed swimming in the moderate sized waves, even using boogie boards provided on the beach. On the calmer days, we used our own mask/snorkel gear and saw a surprising variety of fish and sea life in the rocky reef area near the pier. One day, we were surrounding by a massive school of at least 10,000 fish (3-5 inches long) for about a half-hour.....truly incredible. We grabbed a lounge by the pool everyday (instead of the beach), because it was both relaxing and entertaining at the same time.....great place to people watch. The lobby bar was kind of a gathering place both before and after dinner. The bartenders in the lobby bar were always busy and very friendly. With one open wall to the outside, there was usually a nice breeze making it very comfortable. The after dinner shows were okay, with the best ones focusing on the native music and dance. We were guests of a member and would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “A small quiet resort, with a great beach club!”
Reviews.Author: Icensnow
Reviews.Content: If you are hoping this resort compares to five star resorts for food, entertainment , and room quality, look elsewhere. If you prefer a nice quiet resort with a friendly staff and all of the necessities, then this is the place for you. First off, the people that work here are great! The bartenders are always on the lookout for you, and the front desk staff, security and bellhops were courteous and helpful. The housekeeping and grounds staff keep the place looking and feeling clean. The chefs and dining staff were always smiling and accommodating. I will break it down as follows: Hotel Location: Right at the end of 5th Avenue, this place is in great location to be close enough to the shops and restaurants, while far enough to be quiet and calm when the partying starts downtown. We never felt unsafe or threatened walking around at all hours of the day. Beach Club: A hidden gem, basically right in front of the Grand Porto Real is the beach club, which shares a bar with the Grand. The only annoyance was the bartender for the Grand will not wait on you, and it took us a little bit to figure this out, but after that when you know who to go to, the service was great and the drinks too. I would only complain that the snacks at the beach are pretty much chips and pico de gallo and are not very easy to get at. Improve that and this beach is great for sun and people watching. Hotel Rooms: The hotel is old, and while I did not go to Mexico to hang out in the rooms, when we first arrived we were a little nervous we had picked a Motel 6. The bathrooms could use a little updating, and the air conditioners are weak. I think the problem may be that the pigeons sit and sleep on or in front of the air conditioners at night and this causes some noise and lack of performance, maybe some chicken wire would help! :) The beds are pretty bare bones, and it is time to install flat panel TV's, I forgot how nasty old televisions are. The room was usable, but probably close to a 2 start not 4 as advertised. I will say the mini-bar was stocked daily and that was nice. The housekeeping made nice "towel animals" and the rooms were clean. Food: I will try to be brief. The breakfast is the best meal. Eggs, pancakes, toast, pastries, fruits, etc...the best meal of the day. For lunch you could always find something to nibble on. And lets just say for dinner, it is nice to be close to all of the restaurants so you can get some variety mixed in. Maria's restaurant had menus and the food was a bit more upscale, but basically was the same food as the buffet, just with nice table service....check it out. To finish up, the pool was a nice way to cool off at the end of the day. There is a 24 hour club. The food selections are pretty weak there, usually what was not eaten at breakfast or lunch ended up there. My suggestion would be make it a nacho bar and have self service hot dogs or sandwiches. The self service bar was nice in the 24 hour club. All in all this is a nice budget resort and for the price we booked we can't complain, but if you think you are going to a 4 start resort or better, think again! This is the right hotel for the right person, now get out and enjoy the city and the beach and ocean.

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: skinnyfroglegs
Reviews.Content: My husband and I found this to be a really good time, what made it so great was the staff. Reyes and Jesus are unbelievable bar tenders, they made the trip for us. Not to mention Veronica, Gustava, Bersain, Sonia and Marcello. This will be without a doubt the best service you will receive anywhere in Mexico! Take the highest upgrade so you get more variety for food,this allows you to eat at the Peurto Real, the food can get a little repetitive, but is always good. However, out your door step and 1/2 block down are some of the best restaurants I've eaten in. This hotel is nice and quiet and check out the shows in the evening, they may not be professionals but some of the shows are down right entertaining!

Reviews.Title: “Great service, very friendly and helpfull staff”
Reviews.Author: Gringo911
Reviews.Content: We would like to thanks to a very helpfull managers of the hotel and of the restaurant (Alejandro Cerón). We enjoyed our 10 days in this resort very much and we would recommend it to everybody. I have visited Mexico many times before, but this was the friendliest place ever.

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect alot with this place”
Reviews.Author: kkarnes
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Gran Porto before and loved it, but it was booked for the week we were coming down, so we thought we would stay here and beable to use the Gran Portos bars and returaunts, This place is a joke, we upgraded so we could use the gran portos bars and resturaunts, and beach, we were told over the phone yes this is what you get for the upgrade, we had 3 couples and we all were told the same, but as soon as we checked in we were told we could not use the gran portos facility, it would be another $210.00 a day for each couple. the food is terrible at night, the breakfast was good, and the staff were great. the first night they had the name brand booze out at the bar, after that we never saw that again, all I can say is watch what you get when booking this place, Ive been coming to playa for 10 years and this is the worse place I've stayed at. save your money and stay at a smaller place down near the beach

Reviews.Title: “excellent vacation in this hotel”
Reviews.Author: ger1953
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 weeks in december 2011 in Hotel Real Playa del Carmen. It was our 4th time in this hotel. It is a small and quite hotel, good food and a lot of drinks, perfect situated at the 5th Avenida and close the the beach. The animation team (Daniel, Carlos, Vyaney and Daniela) is very friendly every day entertainment or show in het hotel and activities at the beach. The service in the hotel is excellent, very friendly and helpfulf. The waiters Rodrigo and German, the bartenders Marcelino and Reyes, the staff Bersain and housekeeping manager Giovanni and the frontdesk. Our room was every day excellent cleaned by Betina. We had a fabulous time and we would definatly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend, great staff, very relaxing”
Reviews.Author: newtraveller049
Reviews.Content: My partner and I and 2 family members stayed at Real Playa del Carmen. Yes it is a smaller resort but we found it very relaxing, friendly and cosy. We have stayed at a 5 star and a 4 star before and decided to try the "less expensive" resort. We were not disappointed at all. The 4 star we stayed at last year had a terrible buffet, everything tasted the same. The Real, on the other hand, was great. Good variety, very tasty and well designed, displayed. We had a standard room which was OK since we did not spend very much time in our room, it's quite OK for sleeping, freshening up. We did have the air conditioner on most of the time. It did not make the room like a freezer which is also OK with me, but it did cool the room quickly. As for sleeping, it was great. There was a bit of noise from the main road behind our resort but nothing an average person could not live with. The waiters in the dining room were excellent, especially Alajandro and Omar, great young men. Yes we would and have referred people to this resort. I would go back in a minute.

Reviews.Title: “It's the people who made it great!”
Reviews.Author: thebergens
Reviews.Content: Our room was small and the matress hard as a rock. The bathroom needed a lot of upgrading, our cold shower faucet fell off! The toilet did not flush well but the towels were fresh and there was ample supply of soap and toilet paper. My parents' room was a lot bigger but the airconditioner couldn't accomodate that size of a room so they were hot at times. It was the staff that made the difference. Everyone was so friendly and accomodating. I was feeling sick the second day and someone came to give me a drink that would flush out my system. I felt better the next day! The pool was adequate but there were never enough lounge chairs to sit on unless you got up early to save one for the day. The entertainment was great! Not only were they good at what they do performance wise they were also very personal, engaging in daily activities to help keep you from getting bored! We made new friends within the week we stayed. I would come back just to see them again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, small friendly, lower budget resort, good location”
Reviews.Author: polarbears_11
Reviews.Content: We just spend two weeks at the Real Playa del Carmen and had a great time. The service was excellent, very friendly and welcoming, especially the entertainment team, (Hi Yvaney) and waiters, Rodriguez and Serviano. It is a very nice, safe and fun place to hang out it you are looking for a lower budget hotel. As well because it is a smaller resort you get to know the staff and other guests too. The longer we stayed the more we enjoyed this resort. When we requested or needed anything (ask at the front desk) they did their best to help us out. The Best Day staff is also very good and helpful and their tours are very well run and lots of fun. We did try another tour but found that the guides could not speak much English and the other people on the tour were not English speaking either, so this did not make the tour as enjoyable. Our one complaint would be that there was no computer with internet service available for the guests. In this day and age this is a MUST service to provide as cell service is not always available. Thanks to everyone for a great holiday, Eldon and Maureen, Rosthern, Sask.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't ask for better service or nicer staff.”
Reviews.Author: cervasas
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is on the main stretch in playa right on the end two blocks from the beach. You couldn't ask for better service or friendliness from the staff or the animation team who put on an awesome show every night and organized lots of activities on and off the beach. I would recommend this resort to anyone travelling to playa who would like to enjoy a smaller friendlier environment away from the big resorts.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly and fun”
Reviews.Author: Camandad
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel the first week of January and had a fabulous time. First of all the staff were extreamly helpful, friendly and profesional at all times. the waiters in the dining room were attentive and cheerful, and very patient with us while we practiced our broken spanish. the food was very good and well presented with a variety of fresh fruits and vegatables with every meal. The room was spotlessly cleaned everyday and there was plenty of hot water (which we didn't have when we stayed in Cancun). The Animation Team were lot's of fun and made our stay that much more enjoyable with their entertaining evening shows and the activities at the beach. We took advantage of the stretch class on the beach in the morning, the kayaks, the bicycles and just hanging out getting to know them. I also have to mention the fantastic front desk staff who were always promt to help me with anything and the bartenders who always made fabulous drinks. We would definatly recommend this hotel. The only negatives were the mattress on the bed was uncomfortable and we wish they had more selection of beers.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME ANIMATION CREW AND ENTERTAINMENT VENUE”
Reviews.Author: renraid
Reviews.Content: Was pleasantly clean, affordable, bar tending was wonderful, and the entertainment crew was outstanding with the shows presented well put together and a lot of heart evolved with the production thank you guys

Reviews.Title: “Great fun, great food, friendly place - room: not so much!”
Reviews.Author: lucodu
Reviews.Content: Was there for two weeks with my partner... we were initially diappointed in terms of location as we were under the impression that the hotel was part of a larger complex that extended to the beach... not the case at all (i.e. several blocks from the beach). Although still a great location... right on fifth avenue (pedestrial mall with tons of boutiques and services). We were most disappointed with our first room though: hard mattress (like no head-banging on that baby!) and extremely (not joking!) loud air conditioner... we could barely hear each other yell! Not pleasant at all (I do want to hear what my lover is telling me when screaming, eh?! ;-). Seriously, we upgraded to the "superior suite" (for $12/night which they ended up paying for the first week) where the bed was fine but the airconditioner still loud (but we didn't have to yell anymore ;-). Ask for the "model suite" if you go there: it has the ultra quiet a-c.; I would have paid the big bucks to get that one (not really!), had our four sweetie girl friends (Betty, Laura, Mindy, Rose -hey, hi ladies!! we miss you still!!) from the US not occupied it. Oh, and no toilet pepper in the toilet please!! That would have been nice to know! I am so scarred that I still put the soiled toilet paper in the waste basket... and I've been home for a week already! Go figure! ...joking!! Staff was super friendly; we especially connected well with several servers and the most of all the animation team - kudos to Danijel, Vianney and Daniella! What a team! Great people! We even joined the animation team for a couple of shows (upon invitation, of course!). Too bad we can't post videos here to give you a sample of some of the skits. See the pics below though. Oh, and I found the food particularly good, tasteful and varied. We did not even bother making reservations to the onsite restaurant. I would say this is among the top two hotels re: food between the 10 other hotels where I've stayed (i.e. Cuba, D.R. and Mexico - hotels ranging from 3 to 4.5 stars). Lots to do in or around PDC: pyramids in Tullum, Xechen itza and Coba - we visited the Coba ones (tallest one in the area) and it was quite nice - make sure you reserve bikes! We ended up renting a car at Thrifty's via internet reservation ($30 US) and had to pay for entrance (about $4 US each) and gas for a total of $65 for two people as oppose to the $120 US each that the tour guides at the hotel were offering for Coba. We also visited a couple of "cenotes", i.e. caves filled with water; the ones we snorkeled in were open-sky types, so no worries for clostrophobia or sharks for this matter ;-0). Some of them have tiny fish that eats away your dead skin (but not sharks, you're too funny, you!)... should be fun! Again, those cost under $5 US each for admission; you could rent out snorkeling gear for under $5 if you did not have your own snorkeling gear. Best and cheapest way to travel there is the "collectivo" i.e. public transit: i.e. medium size air-conditioned vans with leather seats! wish we had those in Ottawa!! so you could travel outside of town for under $3, for instance to go to other cities (e.g.: Tullum, I believe), or Akumal (where you can swim with sea turtles and sting rays - which we did, and again this was cheap: free admission! All in all, this was a very nice, relaxing, fun-filled two weeks for us. Oh, and we played lots of vball (sometimes up to six hours per day... we kinda like vball... sorry ;-)). Oh, and with the hotel, we had access to the snack bar at the Real Porto Playa del Carmen... servers would come to our chairs and serve us drinks and snacks. they also had snacks, like tuna mixes with nachos, fresh fruit, and lots of variety in terms of drinks too! My favourite was "Miami Vice" (affectionately pronounced "Miami Byce" ;-) sin alcool, por favor! as I am not a big alcohol drinker. The beach was quite nice but not so much in front of the Porto Hotel which is located on the right of the large pier... but on the left of it, super beautiful beach, on the shore and in the water. (Off) white powdery sand... very nice to the touch ;-)). I think that covers most of it. In short... well, I guess you just have to read over the title ;-))

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: lovethebeach005
Reviews.Content: All I can say is thank goodness we didn't sign up for the all-inclusve package. One look at the buffet confirmed that as did conversations with other guests, many of whom upgraded to the Royal or Porto to get away, an expensive option. The location of this hotel is okay, at one end of 5th avenue, a five minute walk to the beach or 10 minutes to the beach club. Plenty of chairs at the beach club but it is located at the worst part of the whole shoreline. Rocky, shored up with sand bags to combat erosion, right near all the fishing vessels. The front desk staff are very friendly but it's not enough to make up for this tired old hotel. We had a master suite which means a sitting area with balcony, dressing area with closet and daybed and a king size bed and TV in the bedroom. Very noisy air conditioner that barely put out, a teeny fridge that did not keep anything cold, not even cool. No other appliances at all, not even a clock. All the furniture was old with stained cushions, the sheets and towels were often stained as well. I was afraid to touch the bedspread. The maids changed the towels, rinsed out the shower and swiped at the bathroom counter, sometimes swept around a bit.I witnessed this first hand as they would ring the buzzer and insist on coming in if we weren't out of the room by 9am. I felt surrounded by grime, found a huge mat of someone elses hair on the floor on day 10, must have been there the whole time... We felt harrassed by the Best Day tour people in the lobby as well as the Real people trying to get us to upgrade to the 5 star Porto or Royal. The Tulum tour we booked with Best Day was the worst tour I've ever experienced, They kept us at a jewellry store for over an hour, then we had to wait for an english speaking tour guide who immediately disappeared, we ended up touring the place ourselves, learned nothing about Tulum. We had to pay extra to use a credit card to pay for the tour, never experienced that anywhere else we used a card. Internet only available in the lobby, usually one bar, very slow. It's a very small place, one buffet restaurant, one other place only open evenings. The pool was very small as well, must be some camera they used to phtograph it! Hardly any lounge chairs on the property, tough to find a seat. I really wish I had listened to the reviews instead of my travel agent. We enjoyed playa del carmen and would go back but never to this hotel. I would recommend not going all-inclusive in playa del carmen, there are so may great little restaurants to enjoy but try to stay off 5th avenue when picking one. read the reviews before you go.

Reviews.Title: “The staff make this resort worthwhile”
Reviews.Author: Christoble
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Real Playa Del Carmen from Jan 14 till Jan21 2011. It is the second time that we have stayed there. Last year we stayed there for the first time and we came away impressed with the intimate small setting of the resort right in the heart of Playa Del Carmen on the north end of 5th Ave. We had wanted a smaller place within easy walking distance to so many things right in the town. We got more than that. Being a smaller resort we were able to meet up and become acquainted with other guests from all over the world that we still keep in touch with to this day. As for the staff, they bent over backwards to cater to the guests. They will learn your name and greet you by name every day. If you have a favourite cocktail, they will remember that too. This year’s visit actually exceeded last year’s visit. It is often said that you can never go back, it will never be as good as the first time. Not so in this case. The staff remembered us. It was like a reunion. We met new and interesting people from all across Canada, Denmark, Russia, England, Argentina. We sat down and enjoyed the company of a foursome from Winnepeg approaching their seventies. The men were musicians in their younger day. Brian was a drummer who played with many different people. One of the people he played with left stating it was time for him to leave the area and go seek fame and fortune in California (more on him later). If you are looking for big resort with several buffets and al a carte restaurants, the Real Playa Playa Del Carmen may not be for you. There is only really one buffet and one a la carte restaurant but the food is as good as any 5-star resort that I have been to. There is an upgrade to include other restaurants that are not at the facility if you want. If you want a fancy modern room then this place may not be for you. The resort is older and the rooms are older but they are clean and made up every day. The Real Playa Del Carmen is appropriately designated a 3.5 star resort with 142 rooms. If you want your resort to be right on the beach and somewhat secluded , then you are out of luck here. However, they do share the beach club with their sister resort the Porto Real. It is 10 minute walk or there are shuttles back and forth all day. The Real Playa Del Carmen is definitely for you if you like: - An intimate type setting where you get the opportunity to interact with other guests from all over the world. In a small resort this is inevitable. In the bigger resorts you can spend a week there and not run into the same person twice. - A staff that will go out of their way to help you and remember you. Reyes and Jesus tend the lobby bar. If you are there, get them to make you a spiderman shot. Gustavo is there to tend to your needs in the front lobby and can have a good conversation with you regarding American football. Back in the restaurant there is Teodoro who can show you magic tricks, the brothers Bersain and Rodrigo who will make sure your needs are met in the buffet. The afternoon shift has Glendi at the bar along with Omar waiting tables in the buffet all under the supervision of Raul who incidentally always has a quick meeting with the staff before commencement of the dinner hour. I am not sure about the travel and tourism industry but in my business it is considered an industry best standard. Janeth and Andres will take care of you at Maria’s restaurant where I found the food to be as good as any place I have been to in the Mayan Riviera. Mateo makes sure the resort is clean and Francisco is in charge of the groundkeepers and take takes care of the property with a pride as though it was his own. All these people make the Real Playa Del Carmen an all inclusive resort that I will always remember favourably and hope to return to. - The entertainment group was a lot of fun this year. Daniel, Daniella and Viene (I hope that is how you spell it) were a very interactive group that I looked forward to every night. If you get a chance, check out their international showcase. It was a pretty big production for the three of them to put on. - Walking tours, there were so many walking routes you can take on your own and see different things. There was no need for any taxis that you always seem to rely on when in resorts outside the city. The resort is located on one end of fifth avenue directly in the heart of the shopping district. A ten minute walk to 30th avenue will put you in the heart authentic Mexican quisine that is a fraction of the cost of the restaurants on fifth avenue. Walking north you can do a 20 minute round trip walk and get a glimpse of real Mexican living and culture. It is only a 10 to 15 minute walk to the beach and beach club where you would get to see a lot more than what you would in a secluded resort outside the city. At no time day or night did either my wife or I feel threatened by anything or anyone. Everyone was pleasant on the streets and more often than not, were willing to offer up a smile and a greeting as you walked by. Even in the wee hours of the morning. At the end of the night you could see the locals close up shop and sometimes get together right there to unwind with each other sharing a drink or a story. I felt as though I could have joined them if I wanted to (perhaps if my Spanish was better) and they would welcome me in. - A 24 hour self- service snack food and drink area with complimentary red or white wine and a self- service beer tap. If you so desired, you go down and get whatever you wanted, eat or drink there or take it to your room. An amenity I have not seen in any of the other resorts that I have been to. My wife and I personally look forward to going back there one day. If all goes well, January 2012. Oh, I almost forgot. The name of the musician that left to make it big in California was Neil Young. I don’t think Brian had any regrets in not going with him. He looked very satisfied with the decisions he had made in his life and I hope to be the same way too. Christoble and Wendy from Ontario, Canada.

Reviews.Title: “Just the right place”
Reviews.Author: mklRED23
Reviews.Content: We were surprised with all service, food, beverage just great, all employees so helpful, we had a great time and we will come back again, thanks to all staff

Reviews.Title: “We absolutely love this place!!”
Reviews.Author: davedulce
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have been here a couple of times (about a week each time) and we are looking forward to coming back many more! We are not extremely demanding, but we do have reasonable expectations. It surprises us to see any negative reviews about this hotel. The service is excellent, the food is very good and it is conveniently located on the Fifth Avenue. The grounds feel private and comfortable and the rooms have a feeling that you are in a cabin of your own. In addition to it meeting and exceeding our criteria, the rates are also excellent!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: PrairieGirlmistatim
Reviews.Content: Good value for your money, excellent location, beach was wonderful. Can't say enough good things about the service, everyone at the hotel was quick to help and eager to please. The buffet had a lot of variety. We found the best meal was the lunch, always something fresh cooked. The grounds were very well kept, pool area was also very nice. The pictures on the web site are accurate - they look just like the ones I took. Our room was fine and had plenty of room. We had a good sleep every night, very quite (except for the entertainment until 11 can be loud). Remember this is a 3 star hotel NOT a 5*. We would not hesitate to stay here again and we probably will.

Reviews.Title: “no regrets”
Reviews.Author: bestofale
Reviews.Content: I was given a little card with the trip advisor information by the animation team and also by one of the waiters at the main restaurant. My family and I decided to spend Christmas in Cancun this past year. This was our first visit to Cancun and Playa del Carmen--aside from a few little glitches, we loved our experience!! I am delighted to give praises to the whole animation team; Daniel & Daniela are great (friendly, fun, & very good to kids.) Our experience at the restaurant wasn't always the best, eventhough we understand is a buffet type operation--the best service we received was during breakfast time--we remember Rodrigo, he was always friendly, kind, and super willing to help (asking if we were OK or if there was anything else we needed it.) We can't say the same about the rest of the restaurant team, they always seemed to act busy, almost distracted as if they were pressured by the bussiness of the place. The chefs and helpers were nice, although we weren't impressed by the quality of the food; especially the pasties and desserts. Our experience at the beach was wonderful, it is really nice to be able to use the mini-bar; Bersain was so cute, he offered to take pictures of us, he catered to us and the kids with such gladness~needless to say; we loved going to the beach for drinks and snacks (loved the tuna & peanuts!) & Bersain's service. Our room was always clean but unfortunately the phone didn't work very well and we were always having to call for extra towels (regular and hand towels) as my mother and I have long hair and need 2 towels each. We enjoyed the front desk staff as well as the bar-tender that works the morning & noon shifts. The agents for Best Day Travel were also pleasant. Kindly submitted, Alejandra Zemlicka bestofale@hotmail.com *THE HOTEL'S LOCATION IS WONDERFUL, WE ENJOYED THE CLOSENESS TO THE SHOPS, TRANSPORTATION, RESTAURANTS, THE BEACH, AND IT IS FUN WALKING THE WHOLE 5TH AVE FOR EXCERCISE AND ENTERTAINMENT.

Reviews.Title: “a place for fun”
Reviews.Author: feru1
Reviews.Content: very nice hotel..well locate on the fith avenue,near everything.The food is good but not much variety,but hey have very good maya cuisine.A nice beach bar not to far ,10 minute walk.The best thing about this hotel is the Staf, very nice people ready to help you and to please you.

Reviews.Title: “Playa Del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: Etremblay
Reviews.Content: Hi, We when to Playa Del Carmen to the real Hotel. These guys are awesome. They took care of our needs and the entertainment guys, Danijel and Daniella were very dinamic and freindly. Loved it and will go again. Eric And Danie

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: Info155042
Reviews.Content: Look for the bartender Bersain, fantastic service with a smile. Best Day/Wesjet Rep, Emilio Lopez provided great service. Overall staff were friendly and very co-operative, food was okay, service in the dining room not that great.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas at the Real-Playa Del Camen, Mexico-5th avenue”
Reviews.Author: RobinRichard
Reviews.Content: We found this resort to be very affordable and very pleasant. We were impressed with the staff and activities personnel. They made the stay fun! The food was delicious. The selections are not as numerous as larger places, but there is plenty to choose from. We enjoyed daily omelets, made fresh to your specifiations. Meat was grilled daily, also, The desserts are delicious, especially the chocolate, vanilla and strawberry cakes. We enjoyed the 24/7 snack and drink area which you can access anytime of the day or night, if you purchase the all-inclusive, which we recommend doing. The beach area is not far-we walked twice daily. There is also a shuttle which we never rode, but was available nearly every hour. The beach club has friendly staff who wait on you and bring drinks. There are also daily snacks of melon, chips and salsa. Back at the resort, 5th avenue is right out the front door with a bar across the street teaching salsa, free. You can walk the entire length and still get back for the nightly shows in the theatre, which we highly recommend. The staff are very friendly, and the shows are very funny plus extremely well delivered. You will enjoy this. Once we went we did not miss a night. They start around 9, so plenty of time to do other things. The rooms are comfortable. We took a single but will get the suite next time. Rooms are cleaned daily. Water is very hot in the shower so adjust accordingly. We were impressed with the Christmas Eve activities which included Santa and his helpers, for the children. Each child was given a gift while on Santas knee. This same group went door to door to deliver a gift bag of candies to each visitor. It was very thoughtful. We had the best time at this resort, and we have gone to several. We will definately book this resort again, next year.

Reviews.Title: “The personnel were excellent and the entertainment was very refreshing and friendly.”
Reviews.Author: bjtrona
Reviews.Content: Although this hotel is not directly on the beach it is close by and 5th Avenue and taxis are quite handy. One is afforded the luxury of a quiet hotel or the excitement of nearby stores, restaurants, and entertainment.

Reviews.Title: “BEWARE - An Absolute Living Nightmare!”
Reviews.Author: PLAYA155043
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked an all inclusive holiday to stay at the Real Playa Del Carmen for our honeymoon. We reviewed their website and the photos made the property look nice and the rooms clean so we decided to book. Upon arrival I was mortified to be taken to a property situated amongst a large amount of surrounding construction and a very dirty and unkempt landscape. When walking to the room I was even more taken aback by the state of the grounds and the buildings. By the time we reached the room I was beside myself, I stood on the balcony while my husband walked around the room with the staff. Once the staff left I looked around the room and broke into tears. The room was dirty, had black mold, was missing baseboards, the furniture badly stained, the shower bottom stained with mud/dirt . . . not my idea of a romantic honeymoon. We ended up moving to a sister resort on the beach and it cost us an additional $840 US to move but I would not have spent one night here. Their website is definitely false advertising . . . BUYER BEWARE

Reviews.Title: “Great place!!!”
Reviews.Author: Bianca_SF
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for a week and loved it! Staff is very friendly (especially Omar, Bersain, Luis & Marcellino), grounds are beautiful, buffet has lots of choices that change everyday. Nightly entertainment in the evening (sometimes fun, sometimes pretty plain...). It's not a big fancy resort but a smaller version (around 150 rooms) with a personal feel to it. It's definitely worth it to upgrade to a studio room with a nice balcony. Even though the hotel is not directly located on the beach, you are right on La Quinta (the pedestrian street in Playa) and it's only a 10 min walk to the beach club which is great fun! Definitely recommend this place!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place and green areas”
Reviews.Author: betterman05
Reviews.Content: Some friends and I stayed at the Real Playa and had a fabulous time the room had a mexican feel with a small balcony was comfortable, the service is great, the hotel is located right on the 5th. avenue, so quite and so was the food, staff helpful all time, we will be back,

Reviews.Title: “Nice older style hotel and grounds”
Reviews.Author: goldpanner99
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Real for the second time in November, it was low season, so not very crowded at all. We upgraded from the Tukan, and got the Premium plan, so we could access the Tulipanes restaurant and the Living Bar on 5th Ave. Both were fabulous, Tulipanes has a great lunch menu, and the Living Bar is just fun. It's not a loud or boisterous place, but our favorite for a quiet drink or two, we would sit in our favorite seats and just people watch. Francisco at the Restaurant, and Carmen at the bar were always excellent, we made sure to tip also. That may have helped the service, but I find even at an all inclusive, recognizing the servers is always appreciated. Rooms were fine, really it was just a place to unwind for an hour or so before bed, so we didn't spend a lot of time indoors. Beds are hard (typical it seems!) food at the buffet was good, we always had breakfast there, lunch sometimes, dinner was at Tulipanes, or out. There are some great restaurants within easy walking distance. And the new French bakery across the street was a fabulous find!

Reviews.Title: “Really not a 4*”
Reviews.Author: Wil54
Reviews.Content: This was my 2nd visit to this hotel and I was a bit disappointed. Food was 2 years ago much better. Red wine is undrinkable. Not much choice in food. Entertainment at night is very poor, karaoke and trivia ( quiz ). Rooms are fare ( we had the most expensive one ) but bathroom is antique. Service and staff however is very good.People are very friendly. We took an upgrade so we could eat at the Gran Porto Real. This is a complete different story. If they call this a 5* hotel, then then Real is not more than a 2/3*.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: catbehemoth
Reviews.Content: This is a really nice to stay during vacation - staff is friendly, food is great

Reviews.Title: “Third Time Back to the Real Playa Del Carmen and We Will Return!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: chattingkat
Reviews.Content: Our third time we have been to Playa Del Carmen was our third time to stay at the Real Playa Del Carmen hotel. The service is outstanding and the staff should be commended for the effort and friendliness they portray to the visitors. All our trips have been very memorable due to the staff, the food, the location and feeling very safe and special. If you needed information, they always would either find out the answer or just tell you. Staff like Bersain, Rodrigo, Sonia, Jhonny, Luis, and many more that I cannot remember their names, become a great part of your day to service you, chat with you, make you laugh and of course teach you some Spanish, as we taught them some English. It was so interesting finding out about how they live and their family and of course they wanted to know about our life and family. Most of all most they would always call you by your first name or just look up and say Hola!!! with a big smile. The buffet for Breakfast, Lunch and Supper had so many choices. Each night had a theme and if there was not something you liked on the buffet, then you couldn't have liked food. Choices every night between beef, pork, chicken and fish. Many salads, vegetables (very fresh), fruit (also fresh), home made bread, buns, and awesome desserts. Each dish had a sign telling you in Spanish and English what the dish was so you didn't end up with a surprise. Also don't forget the alcoholic and not alcoholic drinks. If you are adventureous, just ask your waiter or waitress to bring you a surprise drink and wow - great flavours. The top shelf alcohol was extra though. Maria's, the a la carte restaurant, was only open on Monday, Wednesday, Friday and Sunday as this is the off season, but didn't have to book a reservation. In the busy season it is open everynight and you have to book then. The lobster is extra and they have a very limited menu, but the food is excellent and of course the service again is superb. The portions are not big though. The staff were always sweeping, cleaning, straightening up and always had time to chat. Our first room was a little small, but we upgraded to a larger room for $20 a night more with a small fridge that everyday they would replace water, beer and soft drinks. Our rooms were serviced and cleaned everyday. I just loved the elephants, the doves, the little girl and the dinosaur made out of towels that were left on our bed and the features made out of the flowers and greenery grown on their beautiful grounds. Yes, the rooms are older, but they have the Mexican flare and decor. Each room has a TV with satellite and they have Wi-Fi in the complex. Some of their air conditioners are noisey, but mention it to them. For the great value of the complex, you end up in your room very little anway. The Real does not have over 3000 people staying there, it is small, very quiet and you walk 5 minutes to anywhere you need, to the restaurant, the lobby, the snack bar, the games area. The beach is about 15 minute walk with many ways to get there and they have a great beach bar with swings to sit around the bar with snacks with great staff and service. The beach right out infront of the beach bar has some rocks, but again a small walk to either side, you find a great place to go swimming. They offer you kayaks and floating boards on the beach. If you find the sun too hot, you ask for an umbrella and your wish is their command. Vendors do not bother you on the beach, maybe the odd young girls selling their braided belts or bracelets, but you just say "No Thank you" and they continue on their way. The grounds are well kept and the paths are marked very well finding your way around. The pool is kept clean, there are hammocks, a child's play structure to also enjoy. The night entertainment was not that good this last time we stayed, but mind you after walking, site seeing, shopping and being on the beach all day, we only stayed maybe 1/2 hour to watch as you couldn't wait to wake up again and pinch yourself and start another great day. You are situated at the start of the famous 5th Ave Shopping Promenade. The Real is a great location because you are very close to the public buses, Cozumel Ferry, restaurants, bars, shops. You are far away enough from the hussle and bussle of 5th Ave and close enough if you need something. Very safe area, the police constantly patrol, day and night and there are always security guards on the beach and around the entrances to the hotel. If you are looking for a quaint, very friendly, clean and fun place to stay with great food, choose Real Playa Del Carmen.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed Our Stay !”
Reviews.Author: strassomatic2
Reviews.Content: We have traveled many times to Mexico .....it ranged from backpacking to 5 star all inclusive. Our stay at Real Playa del Carmen was very enjoyable....the staff and service was the best we have experienced out of all our trips. From check in to check out we thought the staff was what made this stay enjoyable......my only complaint was lack of face towels....even after asking for some to be delivered to room at front desk ? Rodrigo, Bersian, Sonjia and Carlos and Johnny (on the Playa)....all became friends and made us feel welcome and appreciated. When we ever end up back in PDC we may not stay here again....but only because we like to stay at different places each trip.....but this will be the first time I will ever go back to visit the staff .....and I think that says something. Thanks again to the staff......you made our stay and trip very enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Staff”
Reviews.Author: DebbieCowley
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay, your staff bent over backwards for us, they were so helpful in all aspects,especially Sonia in the restaurant ,she was so helpful,treated us like Royalty! And Jhonny the bartender @ the beach and at our hotel was super,he never let our drinks run dry!!! Your staff really make your hotel great! The pillows in the room is the only downfall,they are too hard! The snack bar is my other and last complaint (it was terrible) cold wieners & moldy tomatoes,the next day we checked it out and the moldy tomatoes were still there!!! Other than that we had a great time,at your hotel and I would recommend your place to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Best Personal Service in a tight location”
Reviews.Author: Passed50
Reviews.Content: We liked the hotel and their personal service. No other hotel in Mexico, was I recognized and greeted by name We would however recommend 3 things to the Management of the hotel: 1. Cut down more trees and palms. - The atmosphere is a little too dark and tight - Your garden area need more air 2. Your rooms are too dark. - Paint the rooms in more bright colors - Cutting some trees and palms outside windows will also give more light in the rooms 3. Your Snack Bar should be place in a more central location. - It's secluded location makes it a little gloomy All-in all we enjoyed our stay at Real Playa del Carmen.

Reviews.Title: “Relax and quite”
Reviews.Author: comforty
Reviews.Content: Warmly welcomed from the moment we checked in, food was excellent compared to other All Inclusive Hotels we have explored, the decor is very mexican, everyone was friendly and helpful. We will not hesitate to come back

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service”
Reviews.Author: greatloc
Reviews.Content: We had a great time, all employees were so helpful and I do not remember all names but Rodrigo,Raul,Jesuss,Sonie were great, sorry that I dont remember all names but we will come back, again and again

Reviews.Title: “The best attention ever for a small prize”
Reviews.Author: CamarenaLourdes
Reviews.Content: The best vacation ever taken the food was delicius in the all inlcusive plan...the personel was hard working and did really good its job. the room was nice cleaned and pretty good decorated dayly by the maids. the beverage list was large and delicius..in the ninghts the organized funny activities..the location is excellent its nearby the fifth avenue and the mamitas beach and also the beach club that is confortable and friendly you can go walking or maybe in a bike those ones are in service at the hotel..the snacks bar is short but is a normal bar night snack size..i can´t undestand the rest of opinions the hotel is cheap and you receive more what you are paying for..Excelent team i will come back with my complete family and friends

Reviews.Title: “The bad reviews are accurate - we should have insisted on hotel change before travel”
Reviews.Author: NeatsNotts
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel after reviewing tripadvisor and Cosmos brochure details with our local Co-op Travel rep. We wanted to go home and do our own reviewing but what we were shown on Tripadvisor in the store looked above average to great reviews and we trusted what we were shown...... We took my stepson and his girlfriend away for a luxury all incl holiday and it was v important to us that all was good if not great about the hotel and location & Co-Op Travel knew this. A few weeks before travel, we checked Tripadvisor again ourselves and were 100% shocked to read some of the reviews. Spoke to Co-Op Travel store manager and she said they had not had a complaint from previous travellers apart from one about a tree blocking the sea view (more on this later..). She suggested we stick with our booking, all would be fine and if it wasn't we could contact local rep to discuss. We arrived at the hotel, we were shown room after room after room - all were dark, dingy, disgusting (broken fitments, shabby decor, filthy old bathrooms, dead cockroaches, dead flies and other critters ON THE PILLOW in one room...and so on). Even the upgrade rooms were disgusting. The staff were very kind and tried their best to help (subject always to some kind of upgrade fee of course) but they only had terrible rooms to work with......... Sorry to say but, even though I am a 40 year old level-headed (non snobby) woman, I stood at reception and cried - it was just so so horrible - and we had spent a lot of money on this trip which was supposed to be a trip of a lifetime for my stepson & co. We saw other people who had checked in same time as us - checking straight out - also horrified like we were. We called the Best Day local rep who was there in 10 minutes. He was great and sorted us out a transfer to another hotel (Sandos Caracol) which was just fantastic and exactly what we were hoping for. He was not suprised at how upset we all were about the poor quality and state of the hotel and indicated that he frequently had to move people (particulalry European travellers whose perception of 3.5 star (Cosmos brochure at time of booking) or "The best 4 star hotel in Playa Del Carmen" (hotel website) was way out of kilter with the reality of the hotel. Unfortunately we had no option but to stay one night while the rep sorted out our move, so we tried to be positive and make use of some of the facilities; the snack bar food was disgusting and was clearly open to the elements (including flies/critters) so that was a no-go; the restaurant food was dubious but we tried our best, however two of us started with poorly tummies almost immediately (mine lasted almost 4 weeks after returning and I am convinced it was because of having to stay that one night). Did not sleep a wink & stayed fully clothed all night without using bed covers (it really was that bad!)....We moved the following afternoon and boy were we glad we did. The Sandos Caracol is only half a star rating more than the Real Playa but there was a MASSIVE difference in quality in all parts of the hotel, room, facilities, bars, restaurants, choice, attractions etc. All I can say to poeple is to check that the reviews they are reading are put against the correct hotel - the 'Real' group have several hotels and we are totally convinced that some poeple must have put their review (for the Royal or the Porto) onto this hotel because this hotel is ramshackled and dirty, its not close to the beach and does NOT have a sea view (what was the Co-Op Travel manager talking about?!??!) and it does not have the range of restaurants as advertised (this refers to restaurants in sister hotels which you can only get for expensive upgrade). So, sorry, Real Playa Del Carmen, we won't be coming to stay with you again. We'll also not be booking a Cosmos holiday again because we don't trust their description / star ratings (3.5*) - this hotel is (European standards) at best a 1.5* hostel type accomodation. We'll never use our local Co-Op Travel again either because we feel we were totally stitched up by them in their pre-sales information and they were not at all interested in saving us the trauma by sorting out a change in hotel BEFORE we travelled.

Reviews.Title: “different”
Reviews.Author: differrent
Reviews.Content: I was surprised with service and location, also my family, only complain about hard beds, beside this situation, had a wonderful time

Reviews.Title: “Looking Forward To Our Stay”
Reviews.Author: winniems
Reviews.Content: I can't belive that no has posted any reviews since July. My husband and I are going in Oct. I'm looking for pic's of the master suite if any one has any. We have stayed at four other Real Resorts and can't posibley think this is as bad as some say. Thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Bring your own mosquito net”
Reviews.Author: MosquitoMan01
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel says that it is a 4 star resort, I would give it a 2 star or less. The only redeeming quality of the place is the friendly staff. The rooms need a major renovation. Most rooms have two very small single beds. The official website says that the rooms have "flat screen" televisions, but flat screens in Mexico are not Plasmas or LDS, but the 10 year old Sony Vega TVs that everyone had in their living room. Don't dare attempt to turn on the TV late in the evening because it can only be turned on at full volume. The bathrooms were another concern. It has the smallest bathroom I have ever seen. There was an open window in the bathroom by the shower and the sink barely flowed with cold water. The refrigerator in the room could not keep items cold enough it was as if it wasn't even plugged in. There resort was not by the beach and there was only a small swimming pool. If you want to use wifi, you would have to sit in the open lobby that felt like a sauna because there were no ceiling fans to generate a breeze. The worst thing was the mosquitoes in the room. I had to spray myself with bug spray before going to bed each night so that I would not be bitten all night.

Reviews.Title: “Seriuosly - the hotel isnt that bad!”
Reviews.Author: dully81
Reviews.Content: We stayed in May 2010 and the hotel was only 30% occupied so in a way it was nice that it wasnt busy. The staff are all really friendly and will offer to bring drinks to you and serve you even at the pool side. Well I have been to a few hotels and noramally you have to get the drinks yourself. The rooms are basic but if you re looking for a place to put your head down this is fine. You have hot water and a TV .The TV shows movies all day if you wanted to sit in. The location is on 5th Avenue. You can walk to the beach in 5 minutes or you can walk to the beach club in about 8 minutes. 5th Avenue has hundres of restaurants, shops, bars etc and goes on for ages. There is so much to do. We booked to go to Cozumel Island to swim with the dolphins..and it took about 15 minutes to walk to the port to catch th 30 minute ferry crossing. Excellent fun. We also booked the Selvatica zip lines ...again amazing experience. So seriously the hotel is in a really good location! Basis and nice! The maid came everyday and left really nice presentaions of swans, dolls, birds nests etc ...was really sweet. ... so again cant really go wrong its really not that bad!. The food, we thought was great ..freshly cooked everyday!! and great range!

Reviews.Title: “very bad hotel”
Reviews.Author: JIMBOB76
Reviews.Content: pleas do not book this hotel you will regret it food bad hotel dirty mold on taps in your room you have were to hang your clothes in room dirty toilets next to restrant stef just great it is not there fault they try to make thebest of a bad place when you get there they ask you when you are moving

Reviews.Title: “The worst "all-inclusive" I have ever been to.”
Reviews.Author: Holmes182
Reviews.Content: I read reviews prior to coming to this hotel so me and my buddies knew what we were getting into. The place is very small. The restaurants that they say they have were closed because not enough people were there. All we could eat from was the regular buffet each night. The pool is very small with only 6 chairs to lounge in around there. The 24 snack bar was just some fruit and lunch meat that sat out all day and night. The room we stayed in had a couch that flipped out so 2 people would fit on it if they were snuggling and a king size bed (both felt like bricks). Our balcony had the view of a big palm tree in front of it. Upon arriving we were told that we didn't have the rights to their sister resort called the Gran Porto Real resort (couldn't walk around that resort or eat there) and could only visit the beach club there, even though we upgraded to have the option to walk around the whole Gran Porto Real resort. We argued with them and provided them with a copy of our itinerary and finally got our upgraded bracelets. We went out that night and came back later and our cards didn't work for our room. They locked us out of our room because they said we had the wrong bracelets on. Who locks their customers out of their room? After arguing with them till 3 am, we were finally allowed back to our room. That was enough for us. We upgraded to the Gran Porto Real resort (which I highly recommend) for 30 dollars US per person per night. The resort prides itself on being right on 5th ave but is actually about a 20 minute walk till you get to any of the shops. The beach club is about a 20 minute walk down also. If you don't have the upgraded bracelets and try to walk onto the Gran Porto Real resort, you will be kicked out quickly. Save yourself a headache and stay at Gran Porto Real resort. Ricardo from the front desk is awesome and will help show you where the shops are located at. This place is terrible.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Vacation!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: winter/travelleredm
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay at the Real Playa Del Carmen. The staff were great people, the buffet food service was always enjoyed, the breakfast omelettes were the favor most morning"s. Another hit for sure was the lunchtime Hamburger"s .

Reviews.Title: “No Frills, Average Food, Mosquitoes, but great price”
Reviews.Author: MiamiFusion
Reviews.Content: While friends in Mexico told me that Playa del Carmen was Bohemian style casual, our hotel fell below expectations. It was a little less pleasing in aesthetics than we had hoped but our rate was good--$117.00 per night ALL INCLUSIVE for two people. The purpose of our trip was to attend a wedding late Friday afternoon. Originally we were suppose to stay at the sister hotel Gran Porto Real which was double the rate (also all inclusive) but far more luxurious. But the Gran Porto was entirely booked two months in advance. First, upon checking-in, we were welcomed by mosqitoes in the room. I soon discovered that they leave the windows in bathroom open which has no screen. As I literally attract mosquitoes like bees to honey, I called front desk. But the closet with the repellant was locked for evening and no one had the key. The next day the housekeeper did spray the room. But the damage was done, I was attacked and was sporting red bites which didn't quite compliment my dress for the wedding next evening. The A/C was also noisy but since we were tired most night I only woke half a dozen times. One nice surprise is when the housekeeper arranged our fresh towels in beautiful shapes of flowers or a swan and adorned them with red hibiscus flower. I much prefer this to a chocolate mint on my pillow. Nice touch and I tipped the housekeeper at end of stay. The food is average. This is not upscale dining by any means or a tremendous buffet but the variety was plenty and fulfilled my hunger pangs. I'm a hungry eater and the all-inclusive was satisfactory. The waiters are absolutely delightful and I personally tipped them separately at end of my stay. Unfortunately the reception people were not as helpful as waiters or housekeeping. Several times I asked for the closest church and the times of masses. I got a different answer and when we arrived at the church it was the wrong time. Mass was an hour later. When I asked reception to please call and double check, they made zero effort. One person checked their binder of cheat sheets. Instead of updating it, he closed the book and said "I'm sure it's 7pm". Very disappointing. One nice perk is that the hotel has a "beach club" several blocks away where you can order unlimited drinks and cocktails. Also they have bicycles you can take out--no charge. This was nice to get a little exercise and work off the food. This hotel is good if you are on strict budget and looking for all-inclusive and just want a bed to sleep in.

Reviews.Title: “The Real Resort”
Reviews.Author: Gena7752
Reviews.Content: I was disappointed in this resort. I did research on the internet before booking my vacation package. The information I recieved was misleading... I thought I was going to a 4 star resort from the pictures and ratings I recieved from the internet and expedia. However, the resort was more like a 2 1/2 stars. There was bugs crawling around in the rooms, and the rooms were not kept up to standards. So, if you stay here....make sure to bring some RAID to spray your room. On the bright side, the garden area was nice with the trees surrounding the resort.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: boksie
Reviews.Content: Staff tries hard but unfortunatly doesnt have much to work with... Choose this hotel for its location on quinta avenida. Small,quiet and clean. No nightlife to speak of at the hotel but a 5 minutes walk down the street will provide anything you need. Perfect for the budget traveller who wishes to discover Playa del Carmen. The buffet and one "a la carte" restaurants are very basic.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the money, but get your worth from it.”
Reviews.Author: channell69
Reviews.Content: We got what still seems like a really good deal on this hotel, just under a grand, all inclusive. Just got back and even though we had some troubles we thought it gave us good value for our money. Although, the bed in our standard room for the first few nights was very bad (we got it switched and slept great after that), and the air conditioner was too loud, but needed, we managed to make due well enough with the sleeping arangements. Service was always fast and with a smile, even if the older hotel was not standing up. The food was good at breakfast and ok for lunch and supper but we wanted to try other places near by too. The drinks are NOT watered down and they are tasty, we both had many off of the drink menu (all of which were part of the all-inclusive except nicer wine I think). Its a short 10min or so walk to the beach, but its a nice walk. The beach bar also had very good service and was in a decent spot. All in all, it would have been a bad stay if not for switching rooms for a better bed, but for the money it turned out great.

Reviews.Title: “This was almost a bait and switch!”
Reviews.Author: MELODYEVANS5370
Reviews.Content: Had a reservation at another resort, when we arrived they were overbooked, so we said we would move (we were only there for one night.) They showed us pictures, and it looked okay, but when we arrived, we realized why they did not show us a room. The room layout is horrible! Third floor, no elevator, long hall with a tiny sitting area, shower only, and when you take a shower the water won't stay in the basin, ends up all over the bathroom floor. The bed was so hard I had to sllep on the little couch! They gave us a free breakfast, and the buffet was very good, all the employees were very nice and friendly, but I would never stay here, or recommend this to any one! They have another property on the beach that is much nicer, and this is just old, badly designed, and low budget!

Reviews.Title: “disappointed”
Reviews.Author: staciez
Reviews.Content: Things we liked: location- though not on the beach, not a far walk, and great if you have a large group with different ages and interests. staff-very friendly cleanliness-was very good price - cheap for the area beach - gorgeous things we did not like: food - the website claims to have vegetarian meals....good luck with that. We mostly ate out. drinks - sweet syrupy drinks with a splash of booze. I got tipsy off of one beer purchased at a convenience store, but not from the resort....and the cups and glasses tasted like soap. By day 5 we were barely drinking anything from the resort at all. beach snack bar- non-existent. you feel like you're putting them out by asking for a snack...and it isn't whatever you like, it's chips and salsa, and even if your are a large group (we were 9 people with 5 rooms) we could only get 2 plates of chips. BOO activities - you want a kayak or your free scuba intro...yeah right...dream on. bed- our bed in room 616A was ROCK HARD! the night time noise level is high. take ear plugs of you need silence to sleep a/c - so loud you can't even stand to have it on...unless you want to drown out the street noise to sleep shower - NO water pressure stay here if you are budget-minded and eat meat. just make sure to ask for doubles at the bar and maybe bring your own travel mug. We had a great time, just were disappointed with what the "Real Playa Del Carmen" website offers, and what is REAL.

Reviews.Title: “great experience for a 3 1/2 star”
Reviews.Author: MikeJoanne0
Reviews.Content: My fiancee and I booked our vacation for Real Playa Del Carmen through our agent Chantal at Selloff Vacations(clacroix@selloffvacations.com). Having traveled before, between the two of us at various All Inclusive Resorts in the past, we were well aware this resort was not a “5 Star” location which Chantal advised us of from the start. At the same time, being in our early fifties, we knew what we wanted in a resort and its surroundings and those are; clean accommodations, good service, reasonable good food as well as calm and relaxing atmosphere. Other than the flight being delayed at departure, everything went extremely well right through to our check-in around 3am the following morning. We were escorted to our Upgraded Master Suite which we had pre-arranged with Chantal. That was our first nice surprise as the suite was actually “a suite” with a roomy foyer, a sofa off to one side and a king size bed on a lower level leading off to double patio doors exposing a huge terrace with table and chairs, a hammock and all of this overlooking the garden and pool area. Being late, we retired for some much needed rest from the day’s travel. The next day, we explored the grounds. Knowing full well this was not a 5 Star, our expectations were not “up there” but at the same time we’re hoping to discover what I previously mentioned, and we were not disappointed. This is not a new resort and it is showing its age, however we were pleased to see it had what we at least expected and with a few pleasant surprises as the week went by. This is not a huge resort so the staff becomes more familiar with their guests and we liked that compared to a much larger 5 Star resorts where you get lost amongst the hundreds of other guests. There is the main buffet “The Albatross” and one restaurant adjacent to it for A La Carte dining. Our “upgrade” provided us with access to the sister and newer 5 star Grand Porto Real’s amenities ( this I highlz recommend). Just a pleasant 15 minute walk along 5th Avenue and a block down Constituentes Ave. and you are there overlooking the beautiful sand and water and a view of Cozumel Island. Overall, a good place to stay, clean, friendly and afordable.

Reviews.Title: “Central and good value”
Reviews.Author: KnowAboutTravel
Reviews.Content: Mixed reviews here at Trip Advisor! Not for everyone, this hotel is a bit light on the "resort" side. It doesn't have all the trappings of the big guys but if its cozy and friendly you're looking for you'll find it here. The grounds are neat, and the rooms are clean. Be sure to upgrade to a master suite once you get there. Though some paid an extra 20$US a night to upgrade, they offered it to us for $10. The food is adequate but with all the money you'll save you can hit the restaurants on 5th ave.. and there are a lot of them! The hotel is located at the quiet end of the strip, which for us was a god send as we tired quickly of the endless shops, barkers and pushers of trinkets. The best part was the staff. We've always preferred the small hotels over the big resorts for that very reason. You get to know the servers and everyone has a smile and an "Hola" on passing. If you're young and looking to meet the opposite sex, probably not the hotel for you. If you're a seasoned traveler and enjoy a spot to work from and explore, its a perfect setting.

Reviews.Title: “A place to sleep. the end.”
Reviews.Author: jturensky
Reviews.Content: The Real in Playa del Carmen is a 2 star hotel. Don't expect too much. It was clean, the grounds were nice but the rooms were very small and the AC wasn't the best. We didn't do the All-Inclusive package. Thank god. The atmosphere in that place was D.E.A.D and we would have been obligated to stay there just to use our all-inclusive plan. But we didnt get that plan so we were able to use the hotel as our "base" for exploring Playa. And for that it was fine. You can use the beach club at the Porto Real(which is an awesome resort by the way) for no fee but do NOT try to walk into or anywhere near the resort as security will jump you. If you know your way around and want to go cheap, cheap, stay here. otherwise find something else.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible all-inclusive- don't go!!”
Reviews.Author: albertaclipper4
