Reviews.Content: This hotel although located on 5th avenue is way down at the other end, not close to the bars, restaurants and shops. My friend and I checked in rather late took a quick look around and weren't overly impressed. The room wasn't overly clean. On the first night we had to call someone to fix the hot water because we had none, a later had to get the toilet fixed as well. As we were taking a look around we drank the two bottles of water that were in the bar fridge in the room, we headed to the front desk to ask for more and were told that you only get two in your fridge per day and to drink out of the cooler on the unatteded bar!!!! That doesn't sound very all-inclusive to me!! A little day light didn't help the situation!! It's an old hotel with staff that really aren't to interested in helping you. When we decided that this just wasn't where we wanted to spend our vacation we turned to the lobby staff to ask for some assistance in upgrading to The Royal, a sister hotel. They first ignored us after asking what they could help and helped 2 other people before turning their attention back to us. They called down to The Royal and checked to see if there was anything available, they said no, despite the fact that we had already walked down and asked them ourselves and were told yes in 3 days some rooms were available. Back to The Royal we went where they changed our booking for us. So we spent 3 LONG days atthe Real...The food wasn't great and it seemed that what was leftover from the lunch/ dinner buffet then got put on the snack bar buffet. Which is just a little counter set up with some ice and whatever random leftovers they had. Let me say this when you are hungry after checking in late and all there is to eat is open faced tuna salad sandwhich, suddenly you just aren't very hungry anymore!! Service at the buffet was good but the drinks aren't made very well and there is no selction as to having some international liqour available. As for the Private Beach Club...there is no such thing. There is a bar and servers but generally the servers were hanging out talking amonst themselves in the shade. There is no snack bar at the beach and so if you want somethng to eat you need to buy from somewhere else or walk back to the resort as it is not on the beach. The beach location is good but small, with only a few chairs. The water was great with plenty of space to swim and thes sand is soft. Entertainment staff is minimal and there were no beach activites in the 3 days we were there. The theme nights consisted of kareoke 2 out of 3 nights, however the guys that were doing it were funny and genuinley nice. Overall our stay at The Real was terrible and we spent most of our time dreaming of our upgrade at the Royal, which was great in the end.

Reviews.Title: “Never go back there, worst food and crappy room!!”
Reviews.Author: dragonlady56
Reviews.Content: Would never go back there again, we were there for a week and the maid never showed up in our room. I have been to an all-inclusive before and the food was great but the food here was just plain awful. If you just need a place to crash then go here but if you want a place to remember fondly then this is not a place for you.

Reviews.Title: “A nice surprise for us!”
Reviews.Author: WICorgis
Reviews.Content: We originally booked at El Tukan (see separate review), however were moved to the Real PDC due to a leaking water pipe in our room and a full El Tukan. We had a suite near the lobby, and really enjoyed the room. The property is "middle aged" as resorts go, but has been maintained very well. My only complaint was the room A/C that roared like a small plane...we were able to sleep through it however. The ENTIRE staff goes out of their way to make you feel welcome. The location is at the far northern end of the tourist area on 5th avenue. It's a 5 minute walk to the beach club (Kool Beach Club- end of Calle 28). Overall a positive experience, & I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “the best value for our buck”
Reviews.Author: Roberta-Guido
Reviews.Content: This was our first ever vacation to Mexico and the caribbean. We liked the description and pictures of this resort. When we read the trip advisor we realized that people have had different experiences in this hotel, but the reviews for the last 2 years where ok. We chose this resort because it is a true Mexican place. We booked a 2 week all inclusive and upgraded our room to a master suite, which was a good idea. When we arrived the staff was very friendly. Our suite was dated like the rest of the resort but very inviting. and clean. The only problem we had during our stay was an empty fridge which the reception corrected as soon as we asked them to. We loved the location of the resort. It is approximately 5-7 min from the beach. My wife and I both enjoy walking, which we did a lot in Playa. The hotel has no elevators, so you may consider getting a room or suite on the lower level. We absolutely enjoyed both restaurants. The Albatros, which is the all mexican buffet restaurant is open 7 days a week from 7am to 11am, 1pm to 4pm and 7pm to 11pm. Maria's is the ala cart (mexican food) and is open Sunday to Friday 7pm to 11pm. Reservations are needed. They say they have a dress code at Maria's, but all it is is a button shirt for the men. The food in both restaurants is excellent. All of the staff at the resort where extremely friendly and it was them that made our stay in Mexico a great experience and gave us lifetime memories. To name a few there is Fabian the bell boy, |srael our bartender in the lobby bar, Isabel our maid and pretty much everybody at the Albatros/pool bar, Ricardo at the reception. Our advise is to treat these people the way you want them to treat you. That's what we did and it worked for us. We really liked all the staff and it was easy for us to fall in love with our little resort. We had the opportunity to visit the Gran Royal as well as the Mayan Palace. There is no way that we would have wanted to live in those big americanized resorts. Our REAL was the perfect home for our stay. The only dislike for us was the pool. It was small and not inviting at all. But we are beach people, we did not want to spend time at the pool anyways. Unfortunately for the guests in January of 2010 the Mexican federal government closed the public beach for renovating and upgrading. We hope that this review is going to be helpful for you and if you decide to stay at the REAL have a pleasant stay as we did.

Reviews.Title: “WOW!”
Reviews.Author: brarew
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful trip. I felt like a princess, the staff and accommodations were wonderful. The food was fabulous and view incredible. I would Highly recommend this vacation to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “my kind of place”
Reviews.Author: playa450
Reviews.Content: Just returned from this great little hotel and just can't understand negative reviews, i notice that the negative ones all come from the same country so i guess this hotel is best suited for Canadians and Europeans as we all had a fantastic time together, also people do not mention the price paid so if you want marble and a hot tub in your room well then pay $2500pps elsewhere and you will get it, but if you want a fantastic place to stay with the best staff in PDC for under a $1000 well the real playa del carmen will not disappoint you, this is the first time in many many trips that i have received this kind of service (and i have been to the royal pdc) from the reception to the grounds people there is not a single person who does not like their job and it shows, with it's fantastic location just a block from where the action starts i would much prefer spending that extra $1500 on 5th then on marble and hot tubs ( love what they have done on the north side of 5th av) Rooms and buildings are more then OK and the food was fantastic, always plenty to chose from and like i said before i do not like to stay on a resort ALL THE TIME so this place gives you the freedom to wander as you please and still pay much less then staying at a 400 room plus resort, i would give the hotel a solid 3.5 stars with 10 star service We did 5th av every day, toured Cozumel in a brand new jeep and fished for hours with Capt Momi (he's located two blocks south of the grand porto on the beach) definitely the kind of captain you want to go out with and still all this cost less then half of our 1 week at the Royal PDC so for me the choice is easy if you like to travel as we do then the real playa del carmen is for you, if not pay the price or stay home in your perfect little world Roberto y Lisette

Reviews.Title: “Basic Clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jakesbackdoor
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in a Master One Bedroom Suite on the EP plan so we can't comment on the food or drink. The location is great at the end of 5th ave and an easy walk to some great restuarants and the shops. The rooms are basic at best and while clean they are very tired looking and the A/C seemed to struggle everyday. The staff at the front desk were friendly and we had some great towel art by the maids, who we tipped every day. Across the street is the Cafe Coffee and the Sushi Restaurant, we visited both, recommend them and they had internet access. We would probably only stay here again if we got some reasonably priced package deal as there is nothing special about this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and chilled out”
Reviews.Author: Diver_Dave_8
Reviews.Content: This was a really nice Hotel, not the swankiest I've ever stayed in but pleasant enough. The staff and location are the key attributes that make this a great place to stay. Located at the top of 5th Avenue (the busiest Avenue in Playa), it is perfectly located to be close enough to the action to walk, yet far enough away when you just want to chill out and be lazy. Check out Coffe Cafe just across the road if you want some lovely cheesecake, cold beer and free internet access, whilst listening to chilled out ambient music.

Reviews.Title: “It's too bad they label this resort as an ADULTS ONLY Hotel”
Reviews.Author: flogal67
Reviews.Content: I thought I was going to an all adults only get away- I found myself in an Old age home theory, where there was no night life and no exciting daytime activities(I think the old age home my grandmother is in is more lively) . Even during the day at the pool there wasn't any music to speak of, we were told they have a policy to keep it so low that if you were 10ft away from the itty bitty speaker you could not hear it(and like magic at around 2pm they would shut it off completely). The evening shows were not anything to speak of as well-when the show was over you would think they would keep the music on and allow people to dance -NOT- The only good thing at this resort was the food and the emloyees they have-they are all friendly and very pleasant- especially Fernando and Rosario the daytime activities coordinators...even their hands were tide as to what they can provide

Reviews.Title: “The BEST place if you want to see "Playa"”
Reviews.Author: Snafu822
Reviews.Content: If you want luxury go to a 5 star hotel...if you want to see Playa and "Real" people and be down to earth about it stay here. All of the staff were extremely helpful and exceded my expectations every day. My room was clean, the grounds were well kept, and there was always some who could answer any questions about the hotel, Playa del Carmen, any tours, local sights, etc. The food was fantastic and though I'm not really a drinker I can't say enough about the bartender "Jamie" at the Palapa on the beach...hehehehe Norma at the tour desk was GREAT at helping me decide which tours I wanted to take and which got me the best bang for my buck. I'm already planning on returning in 2010 only staying longer next time to see and do more.

Reviews.Title: “Truely horrible and filthy be careful of the bait and switch!”
Reviews.Author: jonniefl
Reviews.Content: We went to check in to the Real playa del carmen on Oct 1. I just want to tell you how awful this place is. Upon arriving we went to our upgraded king suite room. The room was about 110 degrees and although large it had an air conditioner that would take you back in time. The king size bed with it's polyester bed spread had a huge sway through the middle and the room was very dirty. The air conditioner hung from a window and was incapable of cooling the space. I went to the front desk and told the gentlemen (I'm using that term loosely) of the condition of our room. I told him that the internet had stated that it was a 3 star hotel. He chuckled and said it was a one star. He offered to switch us to the Grand Real on the beach for an extra $100 per night. We refused and asked for our money back. After an hour on our cell phone the Real finally agreed to refund us two of our three nights even though we never stayed there. They were rude and unacceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Wow what a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: em_maparsons
Reviews.Content: On the way to this hotel we dropped some people off at these amazing resorts that are set on their own with grand entrances so in comparison this is not so breathtaking on arrival but what you have to remember is that those people are stuck in their resorts in the people of a dual carriageway with nowhere to walk to. The Real Playa Del Carmen is right at the top of 5th avenue, right in the heart of the shops, bars and restaurants (but at the quiet end!). Ok so first impressions I wasn't sure because the man on reception wasn't over friendly, the porter takes you to your room and waits at the door for a tip, then within minutes you get a phonecall from someone in reception who wants to welcome you and sort out any issues. Actually she doesn't care about your queries and just tries to promote the sister hotel to you and ask you to go for breakfast there so that you might consider that hotel next time. So then after unpacking, I go down to a bar to get a drink and can't see any other guests let alone a barman! Right so its quiet. But wow... After the first night you realise just how lucky you are to be staying in this quiet hotel with at least one member of staff to every guest whilst others are staying at the busy sister hotel. The staff are willing to bend over backwards to help you. We had the whole pool to ourselves every single day with a waiter constantly topping up our drinks whilst we swam. There are hammocks and sunloungers, cats and lizards, even a raccoon! And hundreds of gorgeous trees. The food was brilliant. Breakfast buffett with things like pancakes, fruit, pastries, toast, sausages and a chef in the middle waiting to cook you eggs just how you like them! Lunch was different every day, always a good choice of meat, fish and vegetables often with rice or pasta or salad. And dinner was similar then every other night we had Maria's which is the A La Carte Menu. Great choice of lobster, fish, chicken, veal, tacos (wow the tacos are great!). The main bar is open til 11 then you can drink in the lobby til 1am and then after that the 24hr snack bar has beer, juice and soft drinks on tap aswell as a bottle of red wine and tea/coffee. There is food (a small selection of whatever was for lunch and dinner) and this is constantly checked on, replenished and ice changed throughout the night. The hotel is clean throughout. The only difference I imagine is that the sister hotel is newer so modernised. Ok this hotel may need a lick of paint here and there but is definitely clean and well run. We may have been lucky by going in September. Would definitely recommend this month if you want to be treated like royalty and have the whole place to yourself. To sum up: Great food, great cocktails, great 24hr drinking, great service and great location (oh yeah they even drive you to the private part of the beach where your drinks are all included there too!) The only down side is that the air con in your room is a bit noisy, they'd be better off installing ceiling fans. And if your snobby and expect things to be perfect and home from home, then maybe don't go.... and just stay at home!

Reviews.Title: “dont bother”
Reviews.Author: UkSamlee
Reviews.Content: we had to move from this hotel as this was dirty and just a bad experience. when speaking to the hotel rep, he said that in most cases most people move due to not liking the hotel, like this was a good thing!!! when taking our shoes off in the bedroom, our feet were black from dirt. the 24 hour bar consisted of a beer pump, a coke pump and some stale sarnies, oh and the pool table with half the balls missing which they would not replace. do not waste your time in this hole, ive stayed in better 18-30 resorts when i was younger in places like magaluf!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A disappointing hotel in a beautiful city”
Reviews.Author: drtreleaven
Reviews.Content: We arrived late one night, and the check-in process was smooth enough. The air conditioning in the room wasn't turned on before we got there, and was unplugged during the day so every time we went to the room it was extremely hot and humid inside. We were to receive free water in bottles each day - and they would say they were 'out of bottled water' until you complained enough - and I thought it was supposed to be all-inclusive? The food options were very limited and the cooking was terrible, although the staff was prompt and friendly otherwise. The hotel is not located on the beach, and their beachfront loungers they do have at their sister hotel are limited and at a bad part of the beach. It's not really worth the walk. The water is gorgeous, but you need to walk to a different part of the beach to find a sandy place to enter the water and go swimming. We were asked to go on a 'vacation package sales tour' of their new neighboring hotel - which was nice and fancy, and obviously the new hotel (the Royal) received all the love and investment at the expense of this hotel. I decided to negotiate on price for the 'vacation package' for pure fun and enjoyment - they started at $30,000 for 150 weeks of vacation + All Inclusive Per-Person/Per-Day fees (AI fees); then went to $15,000 for 200 weeks + AI fees; then went to 5,000 for 120 weeks + AI fees. It was utterly nuts, and after 7 people we decided we were done for the day and left. This was a disappointing hotel, in an otherwise beautiful city with too many other hotel options to mention. Find a hotel on the beach that is not part of the "Real" brand.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay”
Reviews.Author: LSmithUnitedKingdom
Reviews.Content: I can't believe some of the bad reviews I have read of this hotel. I loved all 14 days of my stay here. The staff are so friendly and helpful, the entire hotel is relaxed and chilled-out, the food was amazing, the location is great. The room was cleaned immacutely every day. Basically could not rate it high enough & would go back in a heat beat!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean, small hotel, incredible value.”
Reviews.Author: ccline38
Reviews.Content: We booked this trip through Fare Deals Ltd. We were a little skeptical about the place cause the price was so good. Our expectations were: clean, bug free room, decent food, working A/C, plenty of hot water. We got all that, plus an excellent, friendly staff and a great location one block from the North end of "Quinta", Playa del Carmen's pedestrian-only shopping, dining and bar district. The room, a standard room, was quite small, and there wasn't much space left after squeezing in the king size bed. The room did have a balcony with one chair, but the A/C unit was mounted there so it discharged hot air from the room onto the balcony, rendering it unusable for pretty much anything but drying clothes and towels. It didn't matter, because we were there for the beach and to experience the town, not to hang out on the balcony. The other flaws in the room - the shower was small and the bathroom floor would get wet when we used the shower (again not a problem because we just wiped up the floor with the bath rug, which was changed every day) and the promised in room frig was not there. Again, we didn't care, because there was a water cooler with fresh, pure water right outside the door, and because we weren't planning on hanging out in the room anyway. The maids kept the room clean, the A/C kept the room wonderfully cool, and there were no bugs in the room at all. The food at the hotel was very good, and the dining room staff was wonderful. All meals included plenty of food, and there was always abundant fresh fruit at breakfast, and of course eggs, etc. any way you want, and lots of other breakfast entrees and meats. Dinner was buffet a few times and ala carte a few times. Occupancy was down so the ala carte menu was not offered every night. The food was still good enough to keep us from dining on Quinta except for one dinner. We went out for a special meal on our anniversary, and had one lunch on tenth avenue from a local, tiny taco stand called "Rush". The hotel is not on the beach but you can walk or take a shuttle to the beach in front of the sister hotels, Gran Porto Real and the Royal. There is a little cabana bar there that serves beer, frozen drinks and nachos. Again, plenty of it and very friendly guys working there. They also have kayaks, snorkels, masks and fins for you to use. The snorkeling off the beach is not bad, especially next to the pier. The fish get bigger the further out you swim. Follow the pier out and you'll have a good time. The bottom there is a little rocky so buy some cheap water shoes to wear in the water. The water is very clear, waves are tiny and you can wade out a long way and still stand easily. Walk is only 10 minutes from the Real Playa del Carmen. The pool at the hotel is nice - one pool about waist deep and two other shallow pools for sitting or for kiddies. Hotel grounds are really pretty and we enjoyed watching the "Mapache", a larger version of the raccoon, prowl the grounds for food. This creature is cool to look at and won't bother you, but I would not recommend trying to pet this thing. This hotel is one block north of the upper end of the shopping district. It was great to walk out of the hotel and be right there. We strolled Quinta every evening and enjoyed it very much. We liked being in town much more than being stuck miles away at an isolated all-inclusive. The town is lovely and not to be missed. We paid next to nothing for this trip and didn't expect much. Room is not like you'd get at one of those huge all-inclusives, but neither is the price. So - good food, clean place, good A/C, great location, tiny room. Go for it. It exceeded our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: aussie1811
Reviews.Content: My sister and I booked Real Playa del Carmen & Beach Club to have a 4 day rest from hostels throughout South and Central America. I regret to say that we were treated horribly by the staff. The bell-boys were at the front desk and couldn´t answer any of our questions, we were told our room would have a bar-fridge (it didn´t) and when we asked for it they gave us a hard time, the room was dark and not very clean, the bedspread was stained, and we got kicked out of the "Beach Club" by one of the security guards at Real Porto Grand (where the "Beach Club" is located) which was utterly humiliating. I wished we´d stayed in a hostel - we would have had a much more enjoyable stay in Playa del Carmen. Do not stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good All Inclusive experience”
Reviews.Author: joedaboss
Reviews.Content: The Good: Like many of the travelers say, the real estate is very nice, theres a big pool, nice relaxing area with hammocks and beach chairs, a nice sized dining area. Thats the best I can say for this hotel. The Bad: THE ROOM: We booked a standard room. Dont let the pictures fool you, the rooms are tiny, you walk in, you've got a bed, which takes up 90 percent of the room, bathroom, and a small patio that squeezes in 2. We didn't spend a lot of room in there anyway, but it definetly looks a lot smaller than the pictures indicate. FOOD: The food was atrocious. Basically some type of meat, in a bad sauce, every night. No variety to speak of. The food wasn't particularly Mexican, which you would hope you'd be able to try being on vacation and all. For what you pay, you may as well book a standard hotel, and just eat out every night. Trust me, the food outside this hotel is excellent. DRINKS: There was very little in the way of service, the bartenders arent exactly glad to offer you a drink (unless you want a beer, those come relatively fast) and the "unlimited drinks" was 1 keg of dos equis beer, that also ran out eventually. The guys at the beach club are pretty cool, of course if you drop them a few bucks, theyre a little better with getting you drinks. If you prefer an all inclusive, I definetly recommend stepping up what you would like to spend, because as always, you get what you pay for. But if you want to go budget and get all inclusive, totally not worth it, just go for a standard hotel, and eat and drink at the at restaurants and bars of Playa. Food and drink is cheap in Playa, and way better than anything you could get at this mess of a "resort"!

Reviews.Title: “We really liked the location”
Reviews.Author: MNhasSnow
Reviews.Content: I'm a researcher when it comes to vacation, so I know what I'm getting into (usually). The Real was pretty much what I expected. Your basic Mexican style hotel. We had the standard room. A little crowded layout for the room, but it worked. Nice king size bed with an added foam thing under a mattress pad, so the bed was really not bad. Decent water pressure and hot water. Shampoo and soap. Small balcony, which actually made for a nice little drying area for any wet clothes or saturated coolers. The air conditioner blew HOT air so things dried in a couple of hours. No fridge, which I actually thought was going to be included, but we had brought a collapsible insulated cooler, so that worked. The first night the remote didn't work for the TV and since we didn't want to be known as complainers we just decided we would stand on the bed every time we wanted to change the channel (TV was mounted on wall up by ceiling) Well, the housekeeper must have wanted to watch TV while she did our room because the next day it was replaced with a new remote. Yay! Tipped $5.00 a day for housekeeping and got towel art the 4th day on. I know it seems silly, but we really look forward to a little towel art. My only real complaint was the front desk didn't really seem to care one way or another about us. No returned smiles ever. We did not go all-inclusive here, so maybe that was a factor? Our return transportation was supposed to call us the second day to set up a return time and of course didn't (worryfreevacations) and the front desk had no idea (or care) about how to get a hold of them. Checked each day for a message at the front desk and finally got the customer service guy to call them the day before departure. Next time I won't worry about it until the end of the trip. The Real is located at the north end of 5th Ave and we really liked it down there. Also a BIG bonus is the use of the Gran Porto Real beach area (one smaller area) so you had lounge chairs to use free of charge. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The most relaxing and fulfilling holiday ever.”
Reviews.Author: PJS1469
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Real Playa del Carmen from February 14,2009 to March 7th,2009. Because the Elfaro Condo , where we were supposed to stay , was not completed in time. We had to make alternate arrangements at the last minute. Our criteria was that we be in downtown Playa del Carmen and have all the amenities of its beautiful beach. We got all of that by booking the Real Playa del Carmen Master suite with upgrade which gave us the unlimited use of its sister hotel " The Gran Porto " whose location is right on the beach and within a short walk from the Real Playa del Carmen. The accomodations were clean, comfortable and satisfactory. The service , food and beverages were exceptional. The staff went out of their way to meet our every need. Even though we have access to condos in the area, we plan to repeat this holiday at the Real Playa del Carmen as soon as possible. These are" the Real" staff that made it so great for us. Mr. Alejandro Gonzalez, General Manager Mr. Omar Perez, Food & Beverage Manager Mr. Manuel Zumarraga, Dining Room Captain Mr.Raul, Restaurant Captain Thank you from Peter & Jeannine, Hamilton, Ontario, Canada

Reviews.Title: “unbelieavable place to stay”
Reviews.Author: SaskatchewanHappy
Reviews.Content: I booked this 2 week vacation for a party of 8. After I booked I went to trip advisor and was very nervous for there was some not so good reviews. Well there was nothing I could do but hope the reviews were wrong. When we arrived to the resort the hotel staff were super friendly. For the 4 rooms that they gave us, they all were super clean, well equipped for whatever we needed. The staff was always taking care of you, carrying your drinks, food, always asking if they could get you something. The food was excellent, a good variety,and very tasty. The hotel was in a great location right on 5th for great shopping, not to far from the ocean, were they also have a beach bar( great service) . My husband and I have stayed in 4 & 5 star resorts and haven't got near the service we got at this resort . I would book this hotel again in a heart beat. Super Super Place

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time”
Reviews.Author: Ripley99
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel with a package through Westjet vacations. We travelled with 2 small children and 4 grandparents. We checked all reviews before booking and knew we were going to a 3 star at best but felt that if we truly hated the place we could pay to upgrade to the sister hotels. Upon arrival we were assigned a room too small for our family. After much room checking and negotiating we paid $100 U.S and had a fantastic ground floor master 'suite' with patio. We loved it. The grandparents also upgraded their rooms to avoid stairs etc. Baby got a crib, our 5 year old had the pull out couch and we had the king bed. We had space to stretch out and our only complaint would be that the bathroom had no tub. Our baby didn't like the shower at all. We can't say enough about the staff at this place. They were all SO accomodating and So nice. I even tipped the lady cleaning the grounds and pool area because she worked SO hard and it made such a diffrence. The food was great, not awesome but always something at the buffet for everyone. We ate almost EVERY meal here and no one got sick or tired of the fare. Once or twice the kids were hungry when there was no lunch out so we asked and they made something for us. This was before we found the snack bar. The swing bar had the BEST bartender so drink there. We were disappointed with the beach club and after a couple of days of getting palapas on the back row and surrounded by smokers we prefered to beach explore and find shade elsewhere. If you are a family with young children take your own beach umbrella. Shade is scarce and having the option to go away from all the smokers is a plus. Don't try to buy one there, not even the walmart had any for sale and we looked everywhere. Also we found that walking to the beach club was easier than waiting for the shuttle. Although it seemed that if you saw teh shuttle on the street he would take you at any time not just what the schedule said. Even with carrying a 25lb baby it was easy enough to walk. Overall we were VERY happy with the Real. We even got into the budget evening entertainment of karaoke and trivia nights. The Real is older but spotless and the staff exceptional. Food was good and location was awesome. We used the pool (cold water) and the kids and grandparents had a great time. Our 5 year old cried for 1/2 hour when we were leaving because he didn't want to go home. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Never stay here!!”
Reviews.Author: hshelton
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I arrived for a few days of rest during her college spring break. It was a NIHGHTMARE!!! The room was filthy! The drawers were hanging out of the dresser. The bedspead was nasty and the sheets were stained! The bathroom was not clean and the commode did not flush! Our view was an alleyway. The paint was peeling off the buildings. We went to the front desk to ask for an upgrade. While waiting for an upgrade, we tried the buffet, The pasta was rubbery and the sauce was like water. The fruit had been out for a long while because it was drying out on the edges. We were afraid to drink a soda because the glasses were dirty. Finally a manager was able to move us to The Royal. Of course it cost much more, At this point, cost did not matter. This was a 3 star hotel, recommended by AAA. The travel agent said it was safe and clean.NOT!!!!! The pool was the size of a postage stamp and your walk to the beach was at least 15 minutes through not so good surroundings. Never would I ever go back or even take my dogs!

Reviews.Title: “excellent location and better food than expected”
Reviews.Author: canadianangela
Reviews.Content: Prior to our trip, I read the reviews of this hotel and then became confused: some loved it / some hated it. We arrived on February 22, 2009 and fell in love with the place. Reasons to like it are: 1. Small and comfortable 2. Food at the buffet is much better than we had expected 3. Very pleasant staff 4. Excellent location - very close to the festivities further down 5th Ave. Reasons to pass on it: 1. Pool is small 2. A few blocks from the beach club at Grand Puerto Real 3. We had difficulties with our safe 4. No refrigerator in room 5. The washrooms by the pool/bar were not maintained (no running water in women's room, toilet seat missing in one stall) In general, we loved this hotel because it was small and charming. We've stayed at giant resorts in the past and we won't do it again. Here you got to associate with the same travellers day after day, and the hotel is very quiet at night. Final thought - I would not hesitate to rebook at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible place!!!”
Reviews.Author: KenzieChicago
Reviews.Content: We had never been to Mexico and we were traveling there for a wedding. We picked the Real Hotel due in part to it's location being close to where the wedding was and to 5th Avenue, which has alot of night life. When we arrived at The Real we were told they had NO ROOMS because they had OVER-BOOKED!! There were at least 10 of us without rooms. While waiting for them to straighten this out , we took a walk around the grounds , which did not appear very clean. The hotel they finally sent us to was awful and not an all-inclusive as we had paid for. I WOULD NEVER recommend this place to ANYONE - it was a MISERABLE experience for us.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location, Great Quiet Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jeneldobko
Reviews.Content: I seriously don't understand the bad reviews on this place. My husband and I stayed for a week and really enjoyed our holiday. Here's our overview: ROOMS: We stayed in 611-A which was a smaller room, no fridge, king size bed, electronic safe, little balcony. The room was very clean, bathroom was clean and nothing was falling apart. The hotel/room itself is very "Mexican" so if you are expecting marble floors you won't get that here. No elevators so if you have a problem with stairs this might not be the place for you. STAFF: Staff is great, bar staff and restaurant staff really do a great job & everyone is very friendly. The day we got there our safe wasn't working so I went down to front desk and someone came to fix it within 5 minutes. We arrived at midnight and there was even someone to take our luggage & show us to our room. BEACH CLUB: The beach club is a few blocks away. We always walked b/c everything in Playa is walkable (in our minds) and it wasn't far away. The chairs were set up just right of the pier. We didn't have problems finding a chair. At 5pm you can watch the hotel workers play soccer right infront so that was entertaining! Snack bar was good with nachos/cheese/salsa/peanuts. Didn't have too many drinks but they do come around and ask you b/c they go back into the hotel bar to get them. FOOD: Breakfast was the best, omlettes, toast, pancakes, etc. Sometimes lunch & dinner were hit & miss. I think there were 2 times I wasn't impressed. Every night they would grill a different type of meat, have the regular bread, salads, veggies etc. Just sometimes if the meat was cooked a while ago and sitting on the grill it would cool off. But luckily with Playa if you don't like the food there's tons of other places to eat. We did go to Pizza Banana (around the corner by the stadium) a couple of times and it was awesome. There is a 24hr snack bar with drinks, nachos, maybe a different dessert, sandwiches, ice cream machine. We ate the ice cream a few times and it was awesome. Weren't too interested in some of the other things sitting there for a while though.. But I guess that's 24 hr food..There's little coffee machines at the bars where you can get cappucinos, hot water for tea, regular coffee, hot milk so those were handy. Didn't have to wait for someone to make you a drink. Otherwise, for the location & price we would definately stay here again. If you are expecting a 5 star, you are going to the wrong place. But if you are laid back looking for a modest holiday with clean, safe accomodations this might just be your place!

Reviews.Title: “Just loved it”
Reviews.Author: stonyflats
Reviews.Content: It was our first trip to the kind of resort so I cant compare with others but we cant wait to return. Our room on the ground floor was older but very clean and very comfortable. The staff went beyond to make us comfortable and happy. We do not speak any Spanish but htat didn't matter. Cant wait to return and for sure we would staff at the Real. The location to the shops and the beach was perfect. Had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Same time next year, we are coming back!”
Reviews.Author: sonnia
Reviews.Content: We has a great time there, it was all we expected it to be for a true mexican hotel! The front desk was helpful and when we were to have the other twin too, our agent got right on it. If we wanted Canadian, we would of went to the Express Hotel (they flush there) and clog the lines). All the staff where truely kind and helpful. It was clean and kept clean. The food was great. The entertanment was fun and it was close to the beach and right down town! Love and miss you guys (Lillilia, Jose, himmie, Dannie, Carlose, Monkey! Thank You all, excpecially Vidall! See you next year! all! Your Friends Always! Cecil and Michelle Foley

Reviews.Title: “2-Star Facilities...But 5-Star Staff!!”
Reviews.Author: Erycool
Reviews.Content: This 4 star resort is located directly on the "Quinta Avenida" which means that is a 5 minutes walking form the centre and the "mexican movida"...I think I couldn't get any better position!! I stayed at Real Playa for 8 nights and I have to say that I would surely come back again and recommend this resort, though I have to admit there were some things I didn't like. First of all: my room. I booked a double single usage...and that was a single double usage...but It was so old, not clean and very very poorly furnished!lines and towels smelled mouldy...they told me I could have used my "all inclusive" at the room mininbar..but there was no mini bar at all!!Concerning the other facilities: the swimming pool was pretty dirty, because of surrounding trees (though there was always someone there ready to clean it!), restaurants didn't have a lot of choice (basically rice and vegetabls), much better the breakfast buffet with delicious hot tortillas, omelettes and a good choice of croissants and cakes. The 24hrs bar was pretty disappointing: do not expect to go and feed up yourslf after a wild night, because all you can get there is..nachos!!!(You'd better go to Senor Tacombi...I'll talk about this on a review on Playa del Carmen!) BUT I have to say and (I really want to say it that), Real Playa is not that bad as you may image: there I found the best staff I have ever met in my life (I work in a hotel chain and I do mean what I'm writing!). There is a regular and free of charge "shuttle service" which takes guests from Real Playa to the beach (by the same hotel's chain 5 star resort) and here you can have free towels, sunbeds and of course drinks and snacks on the beach. The service on the beach was impeccable (well..apart the omnipresent "nachos"!!), Elizabeth is such a nice waitress, so kind...Be prepared to wait for a while if you ordered a beer or any alcoholic cocktail on the beach: because they only have soft drinks at the bar on the beach, so they have to go inside the resort to make them! The bar staff is so nice, they make very good cocktails: if you have the "all inclusive" try them all! There are so many chambermaids, waitresses, bartenders always kind and smiling. The maintenance, security service and porterage is really efficient: I got my safe blocked at 2.00 am in the morning, I called the reception and right after 2 minutes the maintenace guy was there ready to repair my safe!! At any time of day and night, you fill find security everywhere: in the lobby, on the beach..which means a lot to a single woman as I were! Porterage guy, Vidal, was so kind and efficient: he helped me with my 30 kg luggages, bringing them from the 3rd floor to the reception!And he was so funny and it's been such a pleasure to met him. I really could write so many GOOD things about the personnel because they really made the difference. Though I really didn't like my room at all, I never complained because they gave me so many good reasons to make my stay unforgettable. I would definatly recommend this resort for its great location, its good value of money and it's the right place to be if you like to enjoy Mexico and Playa del Carmen and not just depending on those stupid entertaiment holidays resorts usually offer...Well here you won't risk to get this, because the enterntaiment is mostly inexistent, and this gives you the desire to go out and discover the wonderful world and awesome nightlife of Mexico!

Reviews.Title: “Better than I expected”
Reviews.Author: mayanryan2007
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Real Playa Del Carmen from Jan.17 to Jan 24th before meeting friends in Cancun at another resort which I will also review on trip advisor. I was very nervous about the reviews so my expectations were not very high. We arrived very late so check in was smooth because no one else was around at 1am. We paid $105 for the upgrade to a suite and took the second suite that was shown to us. It was on the third floor so we did not have any problems with bugs or anything. Maid service was spotty. (cleaned 4 days of the 7 we were there) Pool area very small but clean. pretty quiet on most days which we did not mind. Ate breakfast there most days but did not eat lunch or supper there as we were right on 5th ave and the little bit of food we had at lunch from the hotel was pretty nasty. Beach Club is okay with self serve nachos and drinks. Beach itself was great. The location of this hotel is great. Coffeee Kafe across the street with really good coffee and free internet was a bonus. All in all we enjoyed our stay there but I know many people probably would not have. If you are expecting a active resort with lots of people and activities and you like to stay around your resort a lot, this hotel is not for you. If you just want the location to 5th ave and dont mind spending the money to eat on 5th ave then it may be worth a shot.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: mccoyver
Reviews.Content: I have never taken the time to do something like this, but I feel like it would be a crime against humanity for me not to write this review! We checked out the hotels website, and assumed all would be well...boy were we wrong! Where do I begin? Well, the rooms are awful! I am pretty sure the floor in my house is more comfortable then that rock hard mattress. Actually I think it was just a box spring. Being 25 weeks pregnant, it was a nightmare to try to sleep on. My back, neck, shoulders, hips, ached in the morning. No exaggeration, it felt like cement. There was no dresser for our clothes, and we could only open 1/2 of our closet due to the furniture arrangement. There was a stain on our blanket, and the room just seemed dirty overall. There were little black bugs on the nightstand! Also there were bugs in the shower. You are not allowed to flush toilet paper down the toilet! So after you wipe your butt, you have to put it in the garbage can! Disgusting! Oh, did I mention that the room smelled like a sewer! Soon I figured out why. Our friends room had a clogged toilet the whole time, even though they complained about it right when we got there! They had to use the toilet in the lobby. The rooms smelled like backed up sewage. The shower was disgusting, I wore my shoes! They give you one bottle of shampoo and no conditioner. It took a few minutes of ice cold water to figure out that the hot and cold nozzles were mixed up. There is no bottled water. The mirror is a rusty mess. Our friends t.v. didn't work, and no one fixed it for 2 days. Now for the food....horrible! We could hardly even choke it down. First we got turned down for the restaurant because we didn't have reservations, even though it wasn't even half full! The buffet and snack areas are a joke. It really seemed like the food had been left out for hours or days. Nothing seemed fresh. Even the fruit was awful. I ordered a salad one night, and to my surprise the dressing was actually toothpaste! No joke, it tasted just like toothpaste...bizarre! The only entertainment we saw was a drunk man making other people drink shots for a free tee-shirt...fun huh! Needless to say we could only take 2 days at this place before we moved. We upgraded to the Royal Hotel for quite a bit more money. We had talked to both hotels about it and had it all worked out. But when we went to check out of the Real, the jerk at the front desk told us we couldn't do that. Then finally he told us to come back in an hour for a "letter" to move hotels. After an hour, he still had written the "letter" and we had to wait while he did who knows what for another 20 to 30 minutes. We honestly felt so scammed or cheated...I guess its our fault for not reading the reviews. I do not have one positive thing to say about this hotel. To say it was the worst place I have ever been is an understatement!

Reviews.Title: “Should be only a 3 star”
Reviews.Author: Wannagobackthere
Reviews.Content: The brochure we had was quite deceiving. It rated this hotel as a 31/2 star but the resort rates itself (slightly biased I think) a 4 star. NOT a 4 that's for sure. A three is more accurate. We decided on this resort because our family was going (2 adults and 2 teens) so it made it an affordable vacation package during Xmas week when prices are crazy. We were told before we booked that it didn't have it's own beach and that you would share the beach of one of the sister resorts which you had to walk about 2 blocks to. The pictures of the beach looked good in the brochure. When we got there we had a hard time finding someone that could actually tell us exactly which resort we were to share the beach with so we had to do a lot of footwork and asking before we finally found someone to tell us where we were to be. More like 5 blocks away. It was not a bad walk by any means for able people, down 5th Ave or you could walk down the beach to get to it too. We sat on the beach of the sister resort -Porto Real where we were supposed to be and we recognized it from the pics in the brocure. Then were then told by the staff that because we were staying at the Real we had to sit on the "other" part of the beach. We felt like we were low class or something. Pretty small part of the beach with very few chairs, hard white plastic ones mostly. The only thing we got all week at the snack bar we were allowed to eat at was nachos. That part was a little disappointing but the beaches at Playa in general are pretty hard to be too disappointed about naturally so it wasn't that bad. This part of the beach was behind the snack hut from the sun so for our part of the beach the sun set at about 3pm and we were in the shade for the rest of the afternoon. Service on the beach was good though if you tipped a couple american dollars first thing and then a buck here or there. The drinks were good and came quickly after that. The rooms were ,well what we expected for a 3 star but ours was very clean. Toilet wouldn't flush well. Food was OK but that's about it. 1 ala carte resturant but no one ever ate at it so that in itself will tell you food quality right there. We ala carte once and it was OK. Buffet was limited but okay. They had a rib and Chicken night and it was excellent. Breakfasts were GREAT here. Location is excellent especially when you have teens with you. Right on 5th Ave - always something to do. The staff we found very helpful for most things (except for telling you where the beach is). I think they water down their alcohol because we could consume a ton of dacquries and still be quite sober - which was ok with me. It was one way of getting the water you needed because the only other thing is that they would only allow 1 -450ml bottle of water per person per day (to brush your teeth with and keep hydrated in 28 degrees plus? Get real!!!!). Water shouldn't be something that is rationed and you shouldn't have to stock pile which we found ourselves doing with our partial bottles. It is an okay place to stay if you plan to do a lot of things off the resort and don't spend a lot of time in your room or around a pool (pool is small- would be great for small kids). You don't feel so bad eating off the resort if you aren't paying 5 star prices and there are definitely a TON of fantastic eating places along 5th Ave which is right out the front door. Try the Blue Lobster resturant for a lobster feast - GREAT!!! I would stay at one of the sister resorts next time but this place served its purpose for our trip with the kids and everyone did not suffer by any means and we had a vacation we will all remember. If you want the comforts of home then stay at home, if you want the luxuries of a 5 star resort then stay at a 5 star. If you want simple accomodations at a 3 star level this is the place. Hope you have a great vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again!! Not Worth It - Even If It's A Bargain!”
Reviews.Author: MexicoloverCalgary
Reviews.Content: My friend and I both in our early 20's booked this resort last year.. We unfortunately were mislead by one of the websites which actually had pictures from a sister resort posted under the Real Playa.. We paid nearly $2000.00 for an all inclusive trip from Cananda! When we arrived the resot itself, looked desserted.. There was No staff other than people working the buffett. This resort is very simillar to a motel style.. No elevators - so you have to carry your luggage up several flights of stairs. The food was terrible and limited in selection, even in the al le carte resturant. I ordered a salad and it came with a blue dressing that tasted simillar to toothpaste and water. The only entertainment during our entire duration was at dinner one night - and it was a staff member carrying a jar of marbels and we had to guess how many marbels were inside.. Exciting eh?? I think not.. The pool was very small, and therefore noone really used it. The only bar on site is in the hotel lobby, and is also quite limited - and has a couple muted TV's but no music. The room was dirty and the shower curtain and bed sheets had blood stains on them. There were bugs all over the room including between the sheets of the bed. We had to leave our room on the second day to have it exterminated.. There were limited towels in the room - and the water in the shower was always cold. For two days our toilette wouldn't flush (and all we were eating in the buffett was fruit - you can imagine what the room smelt like!) Finally by day 3 someone came with a plunger and unclogged it.. However they left the reamins of what was in the toillette all over the floor. The staff the worked the front desk were extremely rude and unhelpful.. One of the days we were in need of a first aid kit, as my friend had cut her foot open - and they had us told we would have to walk 4 blocks and buy a kit or some bandaids.. I thought this was outragious.. Towards the end of our duration we complained to the staff several times and eventually recieved an upgrade to the sister resort.. This was my first time visiting Mexico - and I can honestly say thay I will never stay at a 3 star resort again! Especially not this one!

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay At Real Playa Del Carmen, Stay at there other resorts”
Reviews.Author: OregonTexasColorado
Reviews.Content: This was my 2nd time to Playa Del Carmen. The Real was horrible compared to the last resort which was the Reef Club. The Reef Club in my opinion was a top notch resort compared to the Real Playa Del Carmen. You couldn't get more bottled water after they gave you the 2 day limit, which is supposed to be all inclusive. We drink a lot of water to stay dehydrated. Sometimes the personnel that they had at the bar did not speak English so they did not know what kind of drink you were ordering. They advertise that you have your own private beach, but when you get to the beach you only get chips and salsa and drinks. Order two at a time because the service is horrible. The other Real Resorts get much more. They get fruit and guacomole just to name a few. If you went to the other Real resorts they would not honor your wristband. I felt like we were low class and did not get the ammenties of the upper class resorts. I will never stay at this resort again. You are better off staying at the Reef Club. The people are great and very friendly. Make reservations in advance at the Italian restuarant at the Reef Club. At the Real if you decide to stay there, make reservations every night at the restuarant, as the buffett is not that good.

Reviews.Title: “Will never return to the Real in Mexico.”
Reviews.Author: HarleyColorado
Reviews.Content: From the moment we checked into the resort there was a real lack of customer service. The facility lacks in management overall. The restaurant for the buffet had bland and unappealing food. The quality of meat and fruit were less than desirable. The restaurant for special seating was very average but better than the buffet. The rooms needed to be upgraded with new beds and linens. Our room had no dresser for our clothing and only 1/2 of the closet was accessible due to the furniture arrangement . Each room was to have a refrigerator with beverages and most of all bottled water but our refrigerator set empty in the outside hallway. Glasses,linens and trash set out in the stairways and hallways for hours while the rooms were being cleaned. Some items remained for 2 days. The plumbing in the entire facility was sub standard from some rooms having no water to some rooms having only cold water. The desk staff was never available for your concerns. Only 1 person worked the front desk at most times and would take your concern but nothing ever happened. The front bar was only staffed 1/2 the time. For an all inclusive resort the drinks were not available when you wanted them. They rarely had bottled water available so that you could take with you for your walk or to your room for the evening. We brought a group of 45 and we felt very taken advantage.

Reviews.Title: “The worst place ever!”
Reviews.Author: MariposaUSA
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the worst hotel that someone could imagine. Fist of all the customer service representative Luis David is the a lair, manipulative, and terrible. He sells one thing and then does another one. The rooms are filled with ticks, roaches, and other insects. The rooms are also super dirty, floors, bathroom, sheets, towels, etc. The key to enter to the room never works, the prices are super high and the hotel is not worth it. There is no hot water in the room, the toilet is a mess there is always pluged and it takes forever for someone to come and help you. Every amenity of this so called hotel is dirty and full of insects. This is the worst hotel I have ever been in my life. Is ridiculous!

Reviews.Title: “Deceiving”
Reviews.Author: Frenchgal
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through Cancun.com, thinking I would have less trouble with my reservations (if any) since they're based in Mexico. The room advertised was not what we got (haha!), and the hotel staff was not going to resolve this. But they were very prompt to send us to the so-called travel agent sitting in their lobby, who obviously couldn't do anything for us! Since I had to sleep on the sofa (just sofa, not sofa bed) - after they assured us it was a room for 3 people - it took another 2 reminders (note that the phone in the room didn't work) that we needed someone to put some sheets on the cushions to make it look like a bed, for me to finally go to sleep. Also, FYI, the bathroom had not been cleaned before us, but really that's just a point of detail. As we insisted to know why the misinformation about their room types, they became stiff and arrogant, when I can guarantee you it must happen all the time. Here in Mexico, the customer service can be summed up in "suck it up and move".

Reviews.Title: “holiday from hell”
Reviews.Author: littleboboChaguanas
Reviews.Content: I am currently staying at the Real del Carmen mexico and it is a horrible experience. When we first checked in we were given a room that smelt really horrible and no room to even turn around. The toilets were not flushing and the noise from the road and the lobby area. We were moved on request and was given an even worse room. There are no elevators and for a 73 year old person to climb 2 flights of stairs was no fun. We had problems with noise, space and toilets. We paid for all inclusive and when we asked for a bottle of water we were told that our agent should explain that there are limitations to the all inclusive. This meant that we were allowed only one bottle of 500 mls of water and one can of coke per person per day. We were also told that if we are not there to have lunch that we cannot have a picnic to take out. I had to even ask the bar manager if I am expected to come down in my night dress for a cup of water or should I call room service during the night. Our holiday was ruined and it was difficult to have fun after that. We also had one hand towel to be shared for 2 persons. The hotel is 20 minutes walk from the sea so if you are an older person do not expect to be near the beach. For the British traveller my advise is never to book with This is travel because they are a rip off, combined with if the holiday is with first choice travel. The holiday started with a horrible hotel that was given to us. We were forced to upgrade and was sent to a 2 star hotel for 289 english pounds more plus 77 pounds for transport. We then received a letter informing us that we had to pay 25 pounds per person for exit tax. The holiday was doomed for disaster from the start. In all we paid nearly 850 pounds for a 2 star for 2 weeks compliments This is travel so be very careful folks. Will I recommend this hotel? Not even to my worst enemy. I will never recommend Real DeL Carmen to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “About as expected”
Reviews.Author: Raeleeb
Reviews.Content: I know that the Real Playa del Carmen is a 2 star hotel, I knew this when I booked it and I won't forget it now that I'm gone. It wasn't terrible and it wasn't great. It was just as I expected it to be. We had a 1 Bedroom Suite - I have to say that I thought that all of the rooms were supposed to have hammocks, but I was wrong. Bummer. Our room was large for this type of hotel, it was spotless when we arrived, I was more than pleased with this. The fridge was fully stocked with soda, beer, water, and even malt beverages (this is something I have never seen in a mini-bar before). The air was cold, the toilets flushed perfectly (even though I kept accidentally putting my toiled paper inside). So, nothing bad to say really. It was sort of funny though. The night we arrived the power went out for a few hours and we fell fast asleep from our long day of traveling. When we woke up is when we realized that the power was out. We laughed it off a bit and went to dinner in the dark. The Mexican food night was actually not too bad, I was a bit worried though at first because I couldn't see what I was eating. The power eventually did come back on. We went to a great place called Alux after dinner for some drinks. You have to check that place out!! It was a fantastic restaurant/bar in a cave underground. It was just amazing. Don't forget to go there. You'll probably need to take a cab to get there. Don't let the drivers try to rip you off though, the rates are pre-established. Don't pay more than 35 pesos to go to Alux or tell the driver you will find another. Always ask before you get in what the rate is or you could get ripped off. I've been to Mexico 5 times in the last year and even though I know better, I've let myself get ripped off twice. It's so annoying! Anyway, it's nice to have the 24 hour snack bar. I love that they have beer and wine in there along with soda and, well, of course the snacks. I did have a hot dog after a late night in Playa. I loaded it up with pico de gallo. I could go on and on, so long story short. It's a fine hotel. It's not fancy. Breakfast is actually pretty good. Other than the Mexican night the rest of the dinners and lunches were not so great. In fact I think it's the first time that I lost weight on vacation. If you want something cheap and you are fine with cheap you will probably like it. If you like the 4 or 5 star properties with lots of amenities and fancy bedding you probably won't like this hotel. The location is excellent, the pool is clean and cute, the rooms are clean, and that is the gist of it. I personally would pay a little more if I ever went there again and I would stay at the sister property on the beach, the Gran Porto Real. Have a great vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Charming little hole in the wall resort! Great times for simple tastes!”
Reviews.Author: ce7871
Reviews.Content: Ah, home again! No I am not referring to returning to Baltimore MD, rather my return to Real Playa Del Carmen. I love this tiny little resort for so many reasons. Now first off, if you are used to staying at the Grand Occidental, or the Riu Palace…stop reading right now…no seriously, stop now…ok everyone we are just going to have to wait for the Grand Occidental, or the Riu Palace people to follow directions…ok now that those snobs are gone lets talk about them…no seriously Real Playa Del Carmen or RPDC as I will refer to it from here on out, is not for the uber pampered. Its pool is tiny; there is no hot tub, its not on the beach, it has one buffet (with darn good food for an all-inclusive) and one reservation type restaurant (pretty good food for a make a reservation at an all inclusive) no elevators, no boats, no lights, no motorcars…ok there are boats at the beach club and there are of course motorcars…made from coconuts. Anyway, what does this place have then? First and foremost, location, location, location…it’s in a good location. It is right on 5th avenue and at the end where it is not too busy. You can take a shuttle to the beach club (which is a bit eroded…the beach…not the shuttle), it is at the other Real resort down 5th ave. or you can walk around the corner to a little stretch of the prettiest beach in all of Playa Del Carmen. It is close enough to the hustle and bustle to walk; but far enough away to be mellow. The standard room is spotless, and big, and kept up very nicely. Plenty of T.V. channels (why is that a concern for so many? Are we really that enslaved to the idiot’s lantern?). Great AC, and pretty good water pressure for the Yucatan. The other big selling point for RPDC would be what this resort has that other doesn’t or rather what it offers at no extra charge. The safe in the room is provided at no extra charge, the bars stay open until around 2 or 3 in the a.m. The best thing about the RPDC is the club house, you have movies, pool table, foosball, 24/7 soft drinks and beer (mmmmm beer) hotdogs (mmmmm hotdogs) and sandwiches (mmmm sandmitches), and free internet access (mmmm dirty pictures and star trek)!!! This little extra mile makes RPDC stand out, it is a pain to have to go to the gift shop to buy sodas or snacks, and it costs too. Here you have a little resort, with great staff that put out that ‘something extra’ that makes RPDC a very special tranquil hole in the wall resort. Never too busy, never too crowded…as a matter of fact maybe you should go stay at the Grand Occidental, or the Riu Palace. Yeah definitely, leave my little resort alone, you wouldn’t like it here…in the hammock, at 4a.m., drinking beer (mmmmm beer) and eating hotdogs (mmmmm hotdogs). I do have to say that RPDC has fallen into the one thing all Mexican resorts do …the time share scam…they bundle your resort tour with the timeshare salesperson. I am a no BS type of guy, so when I say no, you can pretty much tell I am not just being coy; but the chic selling at RPDC actually called my room to see if we had changed our minds…now I am not fluent in Spanish (like some of the pretentious gits on here that go on and on about not looking like a tourist…guess what you are in a foreign land, to look at things, have fun, buy things, take pictures, and go home…there is this thing called a dictionary, maybe these non-tourist people should use one) ok before I digressed on that last tangent, I am not fluent in Spanish…but I know enough to make sure she will never crossed my path again. These resorts need to get a really clear message; ‘I am on vacation and I do not want to be bothered by salespeople’ (it is bad enough they jump you downtown). Well this is where I get off; I hope you found this review helpful or at least entertaining!

Reviews.Title: “Great town centre location but get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Scotty15
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night during a three week trip in Mexico. It was the least favourite hotel we stayed in all holiday but it was the second cheapest as well. As we were only staying one night we did not use all the hotel facilities. However, going on the room alone, we were pleased to be leaving the hotel when we did. The room was tiny. The aircon didn't work and the room was full of moisquitos. We went out and bought some Raid which helped. The restaurant had limited choice of food for both the evening meal and breakfast. The hotel is located on the busiest street in Playa and was perfect for the buzz of the nightlife. Maybe we had been spoilt by the posh places we stayed in before this hotel. But the Holiday Inn in Merida was cheaper and ten times better. If we go back to this area we will definately be upping our budget so we can stay in a nicer hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible experience at the Real”
Reviews.Author: austinsnowbird
Reviews.Content: If you are wanting any kind of customer service, this hotel is not for you. My mother and I have been to Playa del Carmen 3 or 4 times before this trip, and we both agreed, this was by far, one of the worst experiences we have had in Playa. From the beginning at checking into the front desk, the staff was not very helpful with information about the hotel and provided us with only one piece of paper that was a faint copy of hours for the two restaurants (which one of them you had to make reservations for and some days it is open and some days it wasn't-although the sheet of paper never specified days it was closed". Our travel agent booked us a non-smoking room with 2 beds. When I asked if it was two beds, the front desk said no, it was a king but for $20 more a night, we could upgrade to a room with 2 beds. We said we would wait to see the room before making the decision. When we entered the room, it had an overwhelming smell of smoke and had ashtrays in it. We asked the bellboy about a non-smoking room and he said all of the rooms were smoking. There were not any non-smoking rooms. We asked him to call the front desk about getting us upgraded to the room with 2 beds and he said it wasn't ready yet and we would have to wait around 2-3 more hours if we wanted that room AND it would be $25 more per night (all of a sudden it went up another $5 a night). We decided to stay in the room we had and tried to make the best of it-even though it caused problems with our breathing. The bellboy said he would call someone to spray freshner in the room, but of course, that never came. Don't expect much from the room-there are no hairdryers, has little bathrooms, hard flat beds and our phone couldn't make any local calls and when we called the front desk or housekeeping, it was rare if we got someone to pick up the phone. I had someone from the states call me and it took him 3 times before he could get someone to answer at the hotel so that he could be connected to our room. It does have a small fridge which they stock on the first day with some sodas and water but they do not re-stock it each day you are there. Once we drank our bottled water, we couldn't get any more even though we were at an all-inclusive hotel. We had to buy bottled water if we wanted any after we drank the 2 bottles that were in our fridge in the room. The restaurants and bars only gave you water in little cups and did not carry bottled water. Another thing-the Real Resort website advertises that "Total Access to all Gran Porto Real facilities including its deluxe SPAREAL". When we asked about access to the Gran Porto, the front desk said we would have to pay $35 per person per day if we wanted access to that hotel. So don't fall for the false advertising on their website because ANYONE can buy a day-pass at those hotels. You don't have to be a guest at Real to get a day pass to Gran Porto. Other issues with the hotel: Later during our first night at the hotel, we asked if there were any non-smoking rooms and the front desk said they had some earlier but not any more. They were all full so basically the bellboy lied to us. You have to pay to use the computer to access the Internet, which is standard for most hotels, but several of the keys on the keyboard did not work such as the P, B, N and I am sure others but we got too frustrated to keep working on it, especially after we had to pay to use it. The food in the buffet was not great. It was edible but if you have stayed at other all-inclusive hotels in the Playa del Carmen area, it is very substandard to other hotels' food and their buffets. Their is a Latte machine next to the Cappucino machine, but it didn't work. I will say the Flan was excellent but that is about it. Many of the foods were odd concepts such as the brownish green small turkey legs with hard boiled eggs cut in half and mixed into the gravy, an unrecognizable fish dish, vienna type sausages mixed into eggs (which they called eggs and winnies!), and other items that if they did not have a sign, I would have had no idea what it was. And no champagne for Mimosas in the morning. The water did not work in the sinks in the public bathrooms available to guests at the hotel. One bathroom by the bar had water leaking out from the toilet and spilling all over the floor. Even after we let the front desk know that the water still wasn't working on the second day we were there, we just gave up on it ever working. The scary part is that both of these bathrooms are next to the restaurant and so all of these people are not washing their hands, including employees, and then going to eat at the buffet or serving the guests food. A very nasty environment to say the least. when we asked for change to use the Internet, the front desk was out of change. We asked how long to get to another hotel and they said 15 minutes and it actually took around 40 minutes with no traffic and our cab speeding past other cars. The "spa" is a small hut outside and we never saw anyone there or providing services there. Each night we were there, we had guests shouting in the halls around 3 am or 4 am with no security or hotel staff asking them to lower their voices. The staff at the front desk would consistently answer the phone first and finish that call before waiting on guests at the front desk so you would have to wait a long time if you had a question to ask them. To top it off, they have a computer by the front desk that ask for comments on the hotel. You are supposed to slide your room key to activate the survey. The card reader didn't work and not all the keys worked on the keyboard to type in a room number and therefore the survey couldn't ever start. Areas that were good: The flan was some of the best and there are some hammocks by the pool were very comfortable. The maids and the wait staff were very nice and the presentation of the food at dinner was nice in the Maria's restaurant (when it was open) and there is a 24 hour snack bar which was probably the best thing they had. I didn't think I would ever be so excited about chips and football stadium nacho cheese but after dealing with the food in the main restaurant, it was a wonderful snack to have!! Maybe some of the issues we had wouldn't bother you but compared to many of the other all-inclusive hotels we have stayed at, it was very disappointing. More than anything, the front desk staff was the worst and you just never felt like they ever "wanted" to be helpful. And it wasn't just us, each time I went up to the front desk, there was another guest complaining about something so during the time we were there, there were MANY unhappy guests.

Reviews.Title: “Budget Minded? This is a great location!”
Reviews.Author: chucky57
Reviews.Content: February 2008 - My husband and I both loved this smaller type resort! The location is fabulous. It is definitely not anywhere near a 4 star. We would rate it a 3. But then we didn't pay for a 4 or a 5 star - so who can complain. You have a place to stay, drink, eat and swim. Rooms definitely could use some upgrading. Definitely recommend that you bring some extra cash to go out on the town for dinners, etc. You will tire of the food quite quickly. The evening shows nothing to rave over that's for sure. Staff are very kind, clean and helpful. We loved our bartender in the lobby - he was excellent! I would recommend using this hotel as a base to go out and do some day trips, shopping, snorkelling, etc.... We were fortunate enough to get an upgrade to the Real Gran Caribe in Cancun at no extra cost to us. This happened on the 4th night of our stay. We have no idea why they upgraded us and several other couples. I have to say this was our silver lining in the clouds. We were so happy to go there - what a difference! The Gran Caribe is a 5 star and it definitely shows. They have one of the best lobby bars ever. If you go you'll know what we mean. Also, they have a wonderful Japanese Restaurant (Sushi style) by the pool in the evenings. It's a must for at least one night - the food and service were excellent. Also, another tip - during the day when lounging by the pool be sure to order some of their pizza's - excellent! Staff are 1st class, food is 1st class, rooms were 1st class. What more can we say - excellent all in all. And we didn't even pay for it! We were treated extremely well! Only disappointing part were the beaches. I guess because of the previous hurricane - no beaches - water is still lovely to look at but very difficult to swim in - which is something my husband and I love to do. The pool however made up for it. We always make the best of every situation and always manage to have the best time ever. Both hotels excellent!

Reviews.Title: “We'd love to return”
Reviews.Author: CaseyVancouver
Reviews.Content: Our preference was for a hotel that actually seems to be part of Mexico, not an isolated bit of North America sitting on the beach. We had a great time staying at the Real. The buffet food was excellent, the rooms were clean and pleasant, the staff were very friendly. It's close to the interesting stuff on 5th Avenue without being noisy, and just a short walk to the wonderful public beach. The lobby and beach club bars were great. Not everything was perfect (the fridge in our room didn't keep things very cold), but the positive features of the Real far outweigh any minor problems. We'd love to return next year... saving our pennies

Reviews.Title: “Wondeful little hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelinbetty75
Reviews.Content: My husband, teenaged son and I stayed for 7 days. We had a wondeful time and would recommend the hotel to those who are open to new experiences, and not set on luxury standards. The staff were very warm and friendly, and spoke adequate english, and worked hard to make sure our son had a great time. Our room was well airconditioned, safe worked well and bed was comfortable, shower and toilet worked fine. Pool was small but inviting, food was good, but not fantasitc. Concerns - fold out couch was not comfortable - but my son just slept on the couch itself. We sometimes had times getting enough clean towels for the three of us. But the positives greatly outweighed the negatives. The hotel is close to the public beach - which is amazing. The beach club was great. Grounds are beautiful. While we were at the hotel - the lounge bar switched from plastic cups to glassware. We'd definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “There's a reason for the cheap pricetag!”
Reviews.Author: lbabik
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I went to Mexico for a romantic getaway and found anything but that at Real Playa del Carmen. Upon check-in our room resembled a small dungeon--Small window,broken shower head,clogged toilet, ineffective air conditioner and the safe that was non-functional. A neighborhood dog howled all night. We voiced our complaint to the apathetic staff. They switched us to a new room which was much better. It was slightly bigger with more windows but the air cond still did not work that well!--which is terrible in 90 degree weather. We tried to upgrade to the Gran porto Real but it was full. Every morning,the housekeeping staff has their cleaning products strewn about the hall--which is a complete eyesore!!! One day,the housekeeping staff forgot to clean our room. When I called to merely get fresh towels--it took 5 phone calls and 1 hour to finally get pool,beach towels for our shower!!! Thank goodness we were leaving the next day!!! The food was awful! Not much variety and poor quality. The location on 5th Avenue was great --close to all the action of bars/restaurants. The beach club was very relaxing with a very nice barstaff and free lounge chairs. Beware: the hotel serves all of the drinks in plastic "dixie cups" that are basically 3 sips!!! The open air lobby bar was a fabulous way to take advantage of the warm mexican weather. we enjoyed having drinks there. The hotel pool wasquite gross with broken tiles and no room for lounge chairs around the pool. Bottom line: nice staff,bad hotel--spend a few more dollars to get a much better experience!!!! WE WILL NOT BE BACK!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Tropical Resort”
