Reviews.Author: juanvaldez
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here Feb 26-March 11 2008.We had e-mail the hotel in advance to let them know that it was our anniversary on the 29th and we had booked a standard room but was wondering if we could be upgraded to a 1st floor suite.They e-mail us back and said that this would not be a problem.upon arriving we had to wait till 3 to check in and then they put us in a standard room.when asking about the upgrade I was told we would have to wait for the next day and we could move around 3. I went to the front desk at 7am and the front desk clerk move us to a 1st floor suite immmediately.It was a beautiful room.Big and spacious with a nice patio.It was very close to the restaurant.A couple days we ate breakfast on on patio.It was great. we found the food and the drinks were very good here.This was the 2nd time we have been in mexico. The last time was 4 years agobut it was about 20 minutes away from Playa del Carmen. The margaritas were great.we found the buffet had better food than the a la carte .We ate at the a la carte twice.Beakfast had many choices,egg,bacon,sausages,pancakes,breads,smoothies,juices and even fafitas . Lunch at the beach bar was only nachos and another kind of snack.We would usually walk back to the hotel or take the shuttle to have lunch.Great hamburger a couple of days and many other chioces a well.salads were good. service was also good.I found breakfast and lunch had better food than supper .they also have a 24 hours snack bar.It was good also if you wanted nachos sometimes hotdogs ,soft serve ice cream was very good. 5th ave is great in the evening for looking around .This hotel is on the end of 5th ave.Very quiet at night.A 12 minute walk to the beach which we didn't mind .The night show were ok.I liked the mexican shows better than bingo or those silly shows that get guest to go up on stage.It was great having the show start by 9 :30 and right in the restaurant. The gardens at this hotel are beautiful.Sometimes if we got tired of the beach we would come back here to rest . Front desk staff very nice especially Edwardo. we also liked Alex at the beach bar.We liked the beach but wished they had more shades area and wished they would clean the public wasfrooms more often. We would like to return to this hotel again.We thought it was a great deal for the price we payed with Air canada in October.wonderful staff,very good food and drinks,,nice rooms and I didn't even mind that it wasn't on the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Last minute Surprize!”
Reviews.Author: Tantoes
Reviews.Content: The Real was a life saver. I was traveling with my two young children to meet friends in Playa. We had had reservations set and paid for through Cheapseats.com since August 2007 for a different resort in Playa. When we arrived, exhausted and just wanting our rooms, we found that Cheapseats had taken our money and then never paid the hotel for the rooms. So here we are, peak season, in Mexico and no rooms! My girlfriend jumped online and found us rooms at the Real. One of two resorts that had rooms. I was not sure what to expect when we pulled up but I was very pleasantly surprized. The staff was very friendly and went out of their way to carry our bags. The front desk staff spoke adequate english and so did most of the other staff who interacted with guests. But hey, we're the ones visiting Mexico - right? When I read the complaints about non-english speaking staff, I think, well maybe YOU should should learn some spanish!! The grounds were verypretty with alot of foliage, chairs and hammocks. My kids really enjoyed the pool and playing in the hammocks. The grounds are all enclosed and moderately sized so it didn't seem overwheming to let them walk around a bit just in my sight. They loved the snack bar. A kids dream - 24 hour soft-serve ice cream! I wasn't hugely impressed, but I did enjoy the nachos. The best piece for me was their on-call Dr. My 7-year-old ame down with a double ear infestion while we were there. It got pretty bad and I was nervous about clinics, Doctors, language and payment. I asked the front desk where the nearest clinic was and I found out they have their own doctor. Well that made me nervous. A room call? Can you imagine how much THAT would cost in the states? As if it would even happen! So I agree and wait in my room with my daughter. Within 45 minutes Dr. Gustavo Ambriz shows up. He was friendly and kind. Language wasn't a problem - he speaks 4 languages! So he looked in her ears, cleaned them, talked to me about treatment, gave me antibiotics, ear drops and advice about the next time we travel. All of this for $145 american dollars! That included his tip. I couldn't have been more appreciative. She felt better the next day and we have a wonderful time at Xcaret (HIGHLY recommend it). Food was fine. Some looked mysterious to me but I'm leary about meats. Loved the papaya and the coffee. This resort was very international. I think spanish was one of the least spoken languages! There were many travelers form Europe, it was cool to get a taste of so many languages, fashions, etc... Great location near 5th but not too close. great internet coffee shop across the street! Have Fun and don't sweat the small stuff!! PS WARNING: We have been back from our vacation for 3 weeks. We have not gotten any reparations from Cheapseats. Actually we have not even been able to effectively contact them. The 1-800 on the website? Gives you all sorts of options then when you get to customer service a recording says "sorry we're closed". We are getting some help from a travel advisor but we may have to go the the attorney general! Really stinks - who can afford to pay double for hotel rooms? I always thought cheapseats was reliable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation”
Reviews.Author: THEMEXICANTRAVELLERS
Reviews.Content: If your looking for a true mexican flare, then this would be the resort for you. My partner and I stayed at the Real Playa Del Carmen from January 27, 2008 until Febuary 3, 2008. We had a great time, the staff were super friendly. I would rate this hotel a 3 star at best. Our room was cleaned everyday by the maid and we always left a tip. Not because you are excepted too but we wanted to. Yes the room was not up to a 5 star standard, for example the toilet seat was broken so when you sat it would shift a bit, fridge keeped drinks slightly cool, and the beds were alittle on the hard side. The grounds were tropical, with huge palm trees and fresh coconuts that the landscape crew would chop up for you. Nothing like fresh coconut juice in the morning The food was great, no complaints if you love mexican food like I do. The pool was quit small but it did the job to cool you off and you pretty much have the pool to your self. Alittle walking distance to the beach club but shuttle bus is provided every half an hour. Beach Club was awsome with excellent service at the bar. The beach was spectacular, clear and warm with decent waves if you wish ride to them. and the best part of the beach, having a break wall for calm waters too. including the awesome sunsets. sun all day on this beach. lots of activities on the beach including volley ball, scoccer, step ercise, and cooking class, plus spanish lessons. best deal, best place to stay in playa del carmen. this was all included in the price, other parts of the main beach was a pay for a chair for the day, and no calm waters not that the waves were too much, red flag every day...no need for a red flag just saves them from liabilities. you want "real" mexican experience go to the "real playa del carmen" resort. .you want los vegas type hotel, go somewhere else, they have it there too. i recomend this place highly to the adventurous type of people who dont want to stay in the room all day and night, get out in the sun that is why you go isn't it? away from the snow. plus the resort had entertainment everynight, which was good considering the size of the resort. enjoy, we did. and stop being fussy, just enjoy life..

Reviews.Title: “I've had better!”
Reviews.Author: pussee
Reviews.Content: Since I had never been to Mexico before, I was going in easy and with an open mind, however, the Real is a very disappointing resort. While the rooms were nice and clean, and the food was decent, the entertainment, if it could even be called that, was lacking big time. There was no good place to sit and relax with friends; the 24 hour snack bar was pointless, unless you wanted hot dogs and nachos, there were no activities and the atmosphere was pretty dull. And to top it off, the staff barely spoke English, so even when you had an issue, you couldn't talk to anyone about it. There were times you could not even order drinks as the wait staff did not understand a word of English, and the front desk staff could not speak English beyond telling us what rooms we were in. As the only connection to that country, I expect our front desk to at least be able to answer our questions. While I had an awesome time with my friends, I would never stay at this hotel again, nor recommended it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Positives & negatives, but good for the money”
Reviews.Author: bobo383
Reviews.Content: SHORT SUMMARY: My wife and I planned this trip to be away from the resort all day exploring Mayan ruins and snorkeling, so all we really needed was a place to have some drinks, shower & crash at night, and have breakfast. I was looking to spend about half what we usually spend at our usual mega-swank resort north of Playa. Online, the Real appeared to suffice for that, and the price was reasonable -- about the same as alot of Playa's decent hotels without any inclusive package. I read alot of reviews on Trip Advisor & other web sites, and decided the complaints were things I could live with for the price. I also knew from the reviews that I could upgrade to the Gran Porto Real if I got there and was not happy. I knew it was not in the middle of the 5th avenue party zone, but it was several blocks north on 5th avenue, and quieter. So I booked it through Worry-Free Vacations and away we flew. Total booking price for my wife and I for four days, Sun-Thurs, was less than $900 including round-trip air from Texas (got lucky with the promotions & discounts) so clearly I was not going to be really picky about the accommodations. We wound up upgrading to the Gran Porto Real for a little extra money -- not entirely because of the Real Playa, see details below. The staff at both hotels were very accommodating regarding the change, and since we changed hotels about 10:30 at night, I was really amazed at how well things were handled on both ends DETAILS: We arrived about 11:00am and had to wait till 3:00pm for our room -- not the end of the world but our luggage (and everyone else's) stayed relatively unguarded & unwatched by the bar. We left and came back several hours later, and nothing was missing. There's a little mall-looking shopping center across the street with a coffee shop, but nothing else -- looks like it's still being finished. the beach is about a 5 minute walk, not bad at all. There's a free shuttle to take you to the Real's beach club near the Gran Porto Real, or anywhere else you want to go, but we didn't take it. The 24-hour snack bar was not well stocked -- some chips, dips, very little meat & bread, but the Corona keg tap and a soft drink machine seemed to flow well enough. We ate at the ala carte lunch restaurant (Albatross I think). It looked nice and the staff was attentive. The food looked great but was bland - no flavor at all. Even the hamburger I had was boring (but not unacceptable, I still ate it). The best piece of food was a little pecan pie looking thing that appeared to have praline gooey stuff inside and strawberries on top -- that was really good. When we got our room key cards, there were no bell boys around to tote the bags -- odd for Mexico, they must have been really busy or maybe they've become so Americanized they were in a value-added process improvement meeting - HA! So after waiting through my beer & wife's mixed drink from the excellent bartender we got our own bags and set out for the room. The grounds were really beautiful, well marked for finding things, and well kept. The pool was nice and clear, had a few leaves in it but not bad, and since there are trees all over the place this is to be expected. There's a nice spot with a bunch of hammocks (hammaccas?) by the pool. The grounds are completely walled/gated with people at the rear gate to let rent cars in but keep non-residents out. Bicycles were also available at that gate. First 3 hours is free, after that it was $1 USD per hour or $7 a day if I remember right. Overall the grounds and staff were excellent. We got in our room and were a little surprised at how small it really was. "Well, those reviews were right", I thought to myself, maybe I should have booked a suite instead. The standard room was about half the size of a Holiday Inn room in the US. There was one desk and nowhere else but the bed to open up another suitcase so with two suitcases, one of us would need to unpack & put things on a shelf. I did that but the bed was so close to the closet it was very difficult to open the doors and get in there. One surprise was the brand new safe -- no key to mess with, it had a digital keypad & reader for the room key card. you swipe the room key card and then enter a 4-digit code of your choosing to lock it, and that same swipe & code unlock it the next time. Easiest room safe I've ever used, and no dang key to mess with. The AC was not on when we arrived so the room was hot & stuffy. No big deal, I turned the AC on and the room was cool by the time I had unpacked and figured out the safe. I was fine by this time, but my wife killed two small gray spiders on the wall within 5 minutes of arrival, and looked through the sheets for anymore -- she found none. We took a little nap on the hard bed (fine by me, but wife didn't like it) and woke up being bitten by some mosquitos. I looked for where they were getting in, and the bathroom window was open. It wouldn't close all the way but it slowed the mosquitos down. The bathroom itself was OK, but not great. There was a musty smell and the towels felt damp. Shower curtain had some discoloration at the bottom but then again so does mine at my house, so I blew it off. Wife didn't like it in a hotel though. I checked out the fridge and it was typical for the Yucatan peninsula hotels I've stayed in -- cooler than the room, but not what we would call cold here in the US. Wife & I are used to that in Mexico, so no big deal. After all, it had beer in it, how bad can that be? We set out for supper but did not eat at the hotel since we are used to Playa and have our favorite spots we like to hit (especially La Parrilla). After a few hours of walking, my wife stepped wrong on her ankle somehow (NOT at the Real) and hurt it so bad we had to get her a cane to walk with (for the next couple days it tuned out). I want to be clear about this -- This was NOT the Real's fault at all, but that meant we would not be walking ruins all day like I had originally planned. All of a sudden I wanted a nicer place to stay and eat, mainly for my wife who was in pain, and we upgraded to GPR. We've had some questions from TripAdvisor readers on how the upgrade took place, so read on if you're detail oriented (or OCD like me). HERE'S HOW WE UPGRADED TO THE GPR: We walked (slowly) through the Gran Porto Real and the Royal, both owned by the same company as the Real Playa. The Royal seemed way swankier than we had the money for on this trip, so we asked the GPR check-in staff how to upgrade from the Real. They confirmed they had rooms available in standard, suite, and ocean view but told us we needed to start at the Real where we had originally booked the stay. At the Real Playa, I told the check in clerk I wanted to upgrade to the GPR. He asked if there was a problem, and we told him about the wife's ankle that was not his fault, the spiders, mosquitos, and the room size being smaller than we wanted. He called the GPR to confirm vacancy, and informed us the upgrade would be $60 USD total per night (not $60 each per night). Seemed reasonable to us. He gave us a Real Resorts voucher for what we had already spent booking the Real Playa, and called the GPR to tell them we were on the way. He even called for a cab and paid for it to take us to the GPR, which I was not expecting. This was 10-10:30 at night and I thought it was extremely good customer service. We chose a standard room at the GPR which was about the same size as a Holiday Inn room in the US but much nicer. We were happy and I later posted a separate review for the GPR if you want to know how that was. The Real staff also worked with Worry Free Vacations to let them know we changed hotels so the van to take us back to the airport would pick us up at GPR. I had a rental car coming to the Real, and they referred that to GPR as well. Again, I thought this was good customer service especially for somebody who obviously wanted to be in a nicer place. Would I go to the Real Playa again? By myself, yes, absolutely. With the wife, no. We'd stay at GPR or ElDorado Royale instead (our usual spot).

Reviews.Title: “Great for the Price!!”
Reviews.Author: Traveling1MN
Reviews.Content: My mom and I took a mother/daughter getaway to Playa Del Carmen last summer. We were hunting for sun and a bargain and landed on Real Playa Del Carmen. I didn't tell my mom that it was just a 2 star resort fearing that she may not be brave enough to try it with me. We were pleasantly surprised by what we encountered. We had a nice suite with our own hammock on the front porch. The location was really fun, it felt like we were more in the thick of things than Americans sitting amongst Americans.--The resort had many European, Mexican, and South American tourists as well.--It also was on the far end of the main walking strip, so it was nice and quite, but we could venture into Playa Del Carmen everyday if we wanted to. The walk to the beach was not a big deal, in fact it was kind of a nice way to start the day! Really the only thing we really didn't like about the resort was the food. We ended up just sticking with bread and fruit most of the week.

Reviews.Title: “Real "Awful" Playa Del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: jeff401k
Reviews.Content: We traveled with 4 other couples arriving at Real Playa on Jan 15. My wife and I had stayed at one other "all inclusive" just last year (Breezes Bahamas) which frowned on tipping. The people here are working for tips and seem to expect them. They had a tip cup on the lobby bar. My wife and I had to get directions for our return trip and were a little later than the others getting to our room. Our bags were down the hall so we got them and brought them on into our room. The bell boy arrived at our door to make sure everything was okay, but it was clear he was wanting a tip. Others in our group had similar experiences. Our room was very small. We had to move a chair to open the door to the very small balcony. Others in our group had trouble with the toilets getting stopped up. There we signs indicating no paper in the toilets. It was not a good situation. No hair dryers in room. You have to get them at the front desk and return within 3 hours. The food was average. For the most part the staff was friendly. The pool was small and not very inviting. One of the best parts of the trip was walking up and down 5th Avenue and checking out the shops. To visit the beach takes a 5 minute shuttle ride (get your tip money ready :-) The staff at the beach club were great. We had a great time on a rather overcast and rainy day making our own sunshine at the bar. The real good news was that we only stayed at Real Playa 2 nights. We were all offered an upgrade for an additional $10 per person per day to the Real Gran Caribe in Cancun. They transported up there on Jan 17. There difference was as night and day. We had a blast at the Real Gran Caribe.

Reviews.Title: “If you want to be disappointed this is perfect”
Reviews.Author: jeppeonthemountain
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a place where the food is terrible, has no working shower and a staff that steals your money this is where you shall stay. I really can’t understand the people who say this hotel is good, if you only stay for a few days it may be possible that you don’t have time to get the same experience as me and my wife had. This is my story: Me and my wife went to Playa del Carmen for two weeks of honey moon. And we really liked Playa del Carmen and Mexico. Unfortunately we spent 2 weeks at Real Playa del Carmen. The first room we spent the first days in had almost no pressure in the shower after telling the people in the reception two times to fix it I grabbed some kind of janitor who fixed the pressure, but the next day there where no pressure again. I went down to the reception to complain again this time the girl gave us a new room, I got the impression that this was not the first time this happened. The food at Real Playa del Carmen was the same food for 2 weeks, breakfast, lunch and dinner. Of course the where some difference of instance one day there was peas in the rise another it was corn or even small pieces of sausage… After 3 days we started thinking if all-inclusive at Real Playa del Carmen was a good idea. After 5 days we were certain that is wasn’t. From now we only ate breakfast here and spent our money at some great restaurants at Fifth Avenue. We never ate at the a-la carte since you had to make a reservation in the morning to get a table in the maximum half full restaurant. The beach club, a quite nice beach, a bar with snacks, nachos, nuts and some kind of hard fluffy things, quite ok. But just next to the beach for Real playa del Carmen was the beach and bar for Gran Porto Real. This place had much better food at the beach, the hotel was built next to the beach and it is not that much more expensive. The food was good according to some of our co-travelers. One thing that happened was that we went out to eat one night, as every night the last week, when we came back to our room someone had made the bed for the second time that day and the safety box was locked. We had forgotten to lock it when we left, we called for security to open the box. Fortunate all our stuff where still there passports, i-pod, phone, wedding rings, but the only cash we had, a 50$ bill, was missing. Loosing a50$ isn’t really a big deal but the thing about this is the reaction we got from the reception when we spoke to her about it. The girl sad something like, this was not right but it happened and there was nothing to do. No one really cared. I really hope that the tip-money that got stolen were stolen by the cleaning lady who would have gotten it anyway. A few other things that we experienced, a TV that stopped working a few times, ants in the toilet and a freezing pool. My advice for people who are thinking about going to Playa del Carmen add some extra money and get a better hotel than this or get a cheaper hotel and buy your food in some of the restaurants. Regards, Jesper from Sweden

Reviews.Title: “not quite a xmas swindle, but no way is this hotel a 3 or 4 star”
Reviews.Author: Griswoldsonvacation
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Real on Dec 22, meeting up with the rest of our group who arrived earlier that day. The appearance and landscaping of the hotel was fine, but the rooms featured incredibly small, uncomfortable beds and manky bathrooms (with towels that did not smell or feel fresh). Upon booking our vacation, we were told that we were entitled to lunch and facilities at the Gran Porto Real. When we wandered in to the hotel to take advantage of some lunch, we were told that these privileges did NOT exist, and were unceremoniously directed to the extensively crappy offerings at the other end of the beach club, consisting of taco chips, salsa, and melted processed cheese (read: cheez whiz). Not great if you have a hungry 5 year old and haven't planned to return to the Real for lunch. For Xmas dinner, we were required to pay an extra $10 and also for wine (so much for all-inclusive). The staff were by and large very pleasant. The quality of the buffet was definitely 1 - 2 star, with many of the usual suspects making their appearance in different forms in subsequent meals. The bars often ran out of perennial favourites like white rum and Bailey's,and the "snack bar" was stocked meagrely and with little other than chips and salsa.

Reviews.Title: “f-ANT-astic...”
Reviews.Author: Janandron
Reviews.Content: When we booked our vacation package, we were originally planning to spend all 7 nights at the Gran Porto Real. When we arrived at the Porto Real, they offered us a "promotion". If we gave up our room at the Gran Porto Real, they would offer us 5 nights at The Royal across the street, on the condition that we spent 2 nights at the 3 star sister hotel Real. However, we would get the Royal bracelets for all 7 days so we basically only had to sleep at the Real, but we could spend the day using the facilities at The Royal. We were thrilled to be able to stay at The Royal because it was our original choice hotel, so we jumped at the chance to take this promotion. Some other couples whom we were travelling with didn't even get their room at the Gran Porto Real, as only we were offered this "promotion". At the time, we thought we were pretty lucky. However, once we arrived at the Real Playa del Carmen, reality hit us hard. The service was excellent, the concierge and the bell boys were friendly. When we got to our deluxe suite (the best room they had in the whole place), the first thing we noticed was how hot it was. The air conditioning machine wasn't very good... thus we spent our nights in bed sweaty and uncomfortable. The worst part of the stay was sleeping with ants and other bugs. There was never a lonely moment because the little critters were literally everywhere: on the bathroom table, on our dresser, on the floor, in our clothes, even on our bed! We asked for a room change, which they accommodated, but there wasn't much improvement (there were still bugs and it was hot). They offered us a terminator, but we figured since we were only staying 2 nights, we wouldn't hassle them. We hated our bathroom and shower. It felt like we were showering in prison. The windows were barred up and it was very dirty. During my shower on my second night, I had an enchanting encounter with a gigantic moth. Overall, we will commend the service (especially the man who worked at the excursion desk in the lobby! hope you made it to canada!) but the cleanliness factor needs some improvement. Thankfully, we were only here for 2 nights!

Reviews.Title: “woo hoo”
Reviews.Author: Xenoglossia
Reviews.Content: My friend and I (20 somethings)stayed here and we had a fantastic time. Room: GREAT, clean,large, cozy, balcony, overlooking the restaurant/gift shop. Food: Good. Its all inclusive - of course its going to get a little repetitive. Beach: Despite taking a shuttle, it was great. I think the shuttle is good because they pickk your drunk ass up at the beach and drop you off in the lobby. How can you go wrong? Location: Safe and perfect

Reviews.Title: “what a superb hotel”
Reviews.Author: mangotangoMontreal
Reviews.Content: this hotel is too much....the food was incredible,the staff was very nice and polite.everybody is attentif to your needs and the hotel s grounds are beautiful the location too is good walking distance from 5 th ave. where all the shops are.the only negative side there was no clubs on site had to go out for nightly entertainment.but it is a small price to pay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Real”
Reviews.Author: mark_and_bev
Reviews.Content: My wife and I returned for our 4th visit to this hotel. We think it is an economical hotel located on 5th avenue that has all the amenities of the larger sister hotels without the hassles of the larger hotels. The staff is very helpful and friendly. We were at this hotel in May and the staff remembered us almost like family. The hotel is clean and the camaristas keep the rooms spotless. We like to ride bikes but found the bikes in a poor state of repair. I would like to see the hotel purchase newere bikes even if they were to charge a fee for their use. The Real is an ecomical hotel that we will visit again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Backpacker Quality”
Reviews.Author: ineedaholiday_net
Reviews.Content: If you do not expect anything more than a backpacker inn quality, then this is the place for you. The Rooms: (1bdrm master suite) were quaint, although the beds are extremely uncomfortable and the shower offers only a slow flow of water. Housekeeping was inconsistent....one day you had face towels, the next you didn't. They start showing up at 8am and chances are they might not return later if it is inconvenient for you at the time. The Buffet: Sub-standard fare with breakfast being the best meal of the day. The Restaurant: If you have a party larger than 2, Good luck getting a reservation for this one unless you can get yourself up at 8am the day you want to reserve for as they only take 12 people every 45 minutes. Food Quality: Disappointing, but a little better than the buffet. Snack Bar: Don't go there! We found moldy food in the selection and who knows how long those weiners have been on the grill as there is no attendant! The Game Room: The pool table was missing a couple of balls, so a proper game is not possible and we could not locate the Ping Pong equipment and of course, no attendant to help us out. The Pool: Small pool with a volleyball net, wading pool for small children and a shallow pool for relaxing. No poolside service or organized activities. The Entertainment: The highlight of our stay here! Great shows and games for the audience to participate in afterwards. Beach Club: Great drinks and service....lots of activities...snack bar very limited so don't go if you're hungry. Staff: Friendly and helpful when they understand what you need. Definitely brush up on your Spanish as it is not always possible to find someone with a good understanding of English. Bottom Line: I would not recommend this hotel unless your expectations are very low.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL VACATION”
Reviews.Author: missbigfish
Reviews.Content: Let me first start by saying we are a couple in our late forties, traveling with no children. We found a great deal on the internet for 9 days 8 nights for less than $700 each including airfare, so we decided to book it. Knowing this hotel was not going to be the Ritz, our expectations were already in check. After reading some the reviews on this site, it seemed like it was exactly what we were looking for. Yes, this hotel is not on the beach and it is a bit of walk to the beach club, but a shuttle service is provided, so we did walk and took the shuttle when it was available, which worked out just fine. Some people on this site complained, saying the beach club was not in a nice part of the beach, but we found it to be just fine, do pack water shoes, since there were some rocks on the ocean floor. (we arrived a day after hurricane Dean, so that may have been the reason for so many rocks).......There were plenty of beach chairs and palapas available on the beach, there is a great beach bar, and Valentino who serves the drinks to you on the beach was the BEST......... always checking to see if you needed anything........ The food at the buffet was fine, breakfast had a large variety, we only ate lunch twice in our nine day stay and that also was fine. The only thing available at the beach club for lunch, was chips and salsa, so if you are a lunch person, you have to go back to the resort, honestly we ate enough at breakfast, that we did not have to eat lunch. We ate dinner 3 nights at the buffet and that too was ok, remember we are not at the Ritz, so don’t expect FANCY......... We did make reservations at the ala carte restaurant called Maria’s on the property, having no trouble making a reservation 5 nights, we tried almost everything on the menu and found the food there to be excellent, for an extra $15.00 you can order lobster, and that too was well worth the $30.00 extra for dinner one night. We are firm believers in still TIPPING even though it is not required, and honestly did not see much tipping going on by other guests, what a shame, since the service in the whole resort was EXCELLENT....... Playa del Carmen Is a great town to walk around and sightsee and shop, or just take a walk after dinner, this hotel was right on Fifth Avenue and truly has location going for it.......... The week we were there, we clearly were the minority, since the hotel was mostly occupied with Italians.......... I think some people cut there vacations short since Dean was due to hit and some people cancelled there vacations altogether, which made the resort not crowded. There is a pool at the resort, with lounge chairs and a hammock garden, in case you are not a beach person. The gardens around the hotel were beautiful and nicely kept. We had the one-bedroom suite which was very nice and our room was kept very clean and always done by the time we arrived back from the beach. Let me end by saying once again if you are looking for very fancy, do not book this hotel, but if you are looking for a reasonable vacation and a place with a wonderful location this is the place for you....

Reviews.Title: “OK for the Money”
Reviews.Author: jwintoronto
Reviews.Content: Real Playa del Carmen is a budget hotel. It was clean, the food was adequate (your standard low-budget buffet offerings), and the rooms were... OK. The beds left some to be desired as they were pretty uncomfortable, but it WAS a king size as advertised. We never did catch the shuttle to the beach, opting instead to just walk the couple of blocks, but we saw it and it seems to run on schedule. It's really not that far a walk. However, you're right on 5th Avenue in Playa del Carmen where restaurants and nightlife abound, so when the buffet got tiresome, we ventured out for cheap eats and drinks. Overall, I'd recommend the hotel to those who would rather spend their money on attractions than fancy hotel trappings.

Reviews.Title: “Worth it-I would come back”
Reviews.Author: ctaylor44
Reviews.Content: My teenage daughter and I stayed there for the week of March 17th-24th. I don't know where all the negative reviews came from, it was fine. In fact, it was more than fine. It was a quiet, peaceful and tranquil place to stay. Yes, there was construction next door, but I hardly noticed it, and niether did most of the other guests. The buffet was good, plentiful,maybe a bit repetitive at times, but they did make the effort to introduce some variety every few days. The ala cart restaurant was booked solid but I never actually saw too many people eating in there for some reason. The hotel was not as bad as what has been stated by others. Yes, the beds were hard, but I heard they were hard all over town, no matter where you stayed. We still got a restful night's sleep. I found the staff to be very ,very hardworking and accomodating. They were the best! The dance performances at night were very atheletic and flexible and never the same routine twice. It was impressive! We booked through Nolotours and the only criticism I have is that we were mislead about a tour that was overbooked and just plain awful! It was to Xel-Ha and I will never, ever go there again! I felt like a sardine packed into the bus(which was 45 minutes late) taking us there and there was no time or room for individual questions. We were shuttled quickly into what is a huge, albeit beautiful ,natural, tourist trap, where no English is spoken and there is little staff to help you anyway. If you don't snorkle, there is nothing to do except wander for miles on a trail that goes nowhere. We got bored silly in short order and went back to the hotel , disillusioned and poorer. I did not get my refund from the Nolitours rep even though we didn't go the second half-the Tulum tour. We wouldv'e had to kill two more hours there bored and hot. The Coba Village Tour was in stark contrast wonderful. The guide showed up on time, was extremely knowledgable, spoke English and knew all the people in the village. We toured the Mayan ruins in the jungle as well as saw how a typical Mayan family lived. All our questions were answered, we climbed the largest ruin (which was an accomplishment for all of us I think (and we were all ages and all levels of fitness), treated to a tasty lunch, and not blindly rushed through the place as was the experience with the Xel-Ha tour. The guide was exceptional. His name was Jeraldo (Jerry) and the driver was Juan. We also went to Delphinus which was smaller than Xel-Ha but only dealt with Dolphins. Xel-Ha did too but it was confusing to get to them. Delphinus treated people more personally (and in small groups)and the dolphins were wonderful, entertaining and obviously very well treated . When I go back to Cancun, I will go there again for sure! As for the hotel, we stopped in at the sister hotels (Gran Porto and Royal) and found them larger and more opulent but also very impersonal. I would go back to Real Playa Del Carmen anyday.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible experience”
Reviews.Author: labhard
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night and upgraded to the Grand Porto, Real Playa hotel immediately. We got an all inclusive deal for 4 nights and were terribly disappointed at the size, quality and ammenities of the room. The shower hardly had pressure. The room was large enough for one bed. The food was embarrasing for someone who purchased all inclusive. Pizza, lasagna and bread were offered on our first night at the buffet. Maria's restaurant offered a la carte, but you needed to make a reservation. If you didn't call early enough in the morning, it was booked already (a true sign of the horrible buffet food). If you're looking for very moderate ammenities, all the drinks and horrible food you want, go here. Just don't pay more than $60 a night! Stay at the Grand Porto if you're looking for a better beach, pool, and nice room. It's only $40 more to upgrade.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel”
Reviews.Author: sanfrancisco_2007
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked at the Real at the last minute, but thought the hotel would be OK based on some reviews we read. We were extremely disappointed. Our room was just off of a busy street with construction and the room was divided by two large columns and an old dresser that made it difficult to walk around. Additionally, the toilet and the television were both broken and there was no hot water. Although we requested to change rooms, the front desk was unable to accommodate us. The front desk also failed to supply us with our all inclusive package upon arrival and did not notify us about the package until our last day. Finally, the food included in the cost was very poor quality. We paid over $200 per night for the room and finally moved down the street to a $100/night hotel that was much cleaner and with more character. The front lobby looks like it's been renovated, but the hotel rooms and grounds need a lot of work. We would not stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Basic accomodations”
Reviews.Author: Tennesse Traveler
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Real Feb. 16-18. This is definitely the bottom tier of the Real Resorts. The Real Resort chain needs to do major renovations or take this one out of their lineup. The grounds are well kept and the open air lobby fronts on the new section of the famous 5th Ave. The standard rooms are worn, dated and shabby while the Suites are larger but not in any better condition. The beds are like concrete to match the pillows that are like bricks. The bathrooms are tiny and dated with limited hot water. The pool area is less than desireable and considering the resort is not ocean front they need to at least up date the pool. Your allowed to use the beach club at the Gran Puerto Real but they will not allow you to eat lunch at the pool bar although they will serve you free drinks and use their beach chairs. The dining and bar areas are limited with the waiting staff less than enthusiastic. We tipped extremely well and this didn't seem to matter. We booked there at the last minute because the two other Real Resorts in Playa were over booked as usual and we thought being in the Real chain it would be acceptable, NOT. We ended up moving to a Real property in Cancun which was infinitely better but not in the location were we wanted to be but at least my wife was happier. Oh well, live and learn, two stars means two stars even if it has the Real name.

Reviews.Title: “good price/quality”
Reviews.Author: girl_77
Reviews.Content: If you don't want more than a clean room, with a decent bed and warm shower, then Real Playa is perfect. The all inclusive service is great, the people very friendly and the beach is beautiful (although they are still rebuilding it since the storm Wilma). The rooms are small so don't expect more then that but we enjoyed our stay. The disadvantage of this hotel during our stay were the italians. They flock together and don't bother speaking with others, while I speak 5 different languages so we should be able to find some common ground. We got upgraded for free for the last 3 days of our stay to the Gran Porto Real which was absolutely fabulous!

Reviews.Title: “enjoyed the resort”
Reviews.Author: Anniey
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here in October and had a very nice time. Even though it was rated as a 3 1/2 star by the tour provider I was very pleased. We had a nice sized suite. There was a king size bed in the "bedroom" and a futon bed in the sitting area. My friend slept on the futon and found it quite comfortable. However the window above the shower allowed folks up one level to watch you bath so I had to request a curtain be hung. The buffet was small but the food was always hot and tasty. Staff was very friendly and accomodating. This cosy resort was spotless. The pool was a nice size and very clean. It was not located on the beach but a few blocks down the road there was a beautiful beach. The beach club for the resort was about a 15 minute walk or shorter shuttle ride (ran on mexican time). It was located on the beach by the more posh Real resorts (terrible beach) and shoved off in a corner. My only complaint was we felt like we were treated like second class citizens at this beach bar because we were wearing the wrong colored wrist band. They would feed the other folks real food at lunch time and we only got snacks. If we wanted lunch we had to return to our resort, and strangly enought we got fed the same food they were preparing on the beach. We walked into downtown Playa Del Carmen daily. Travelled on the local collectivo. Felt very safe since we were 2 women travelling together. I would definetly stay at this resort again. Last year I spent a week further down the Mayan Riviera at the 5 star B......... My son got food poisoning twice, the dining area was always a mess. I would never go back there. Don't be fooled by the number of stars a resort has, It doesn't necessarily mean it's better. Read the reviews and see what the other people have to say. If you want total luxury then don't stay here, but if you are content with a simple relaxing vacation this is the place to be. I also find the visitors at the smaller resorts are much friendlier that at the big ones.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CozCouple
Reviews.Content: We booked at the Real Playa del Carmen knowing that it was not a 4 star resort. We chose this hotel mainly for the price. The food was ok, nothing fancy, but edible. We really liked the breakfast, they had omlettes, bacon, toast, potatoes, and fruit. The lunch and dinner were ok, there wasn't a big selection, but enough to get full. We ordered room service and it was really good and fast. We had no problem getting strong drinks and they were very good both at the beach and the hotel. The beach club was nice, it shares the beach with the Grand Porto Real and the Royal Porto Real. However, the only food available to us was chips and salsa and some little snacky crackers. Definitely not enough to get a full lunch. If you wanted a real lunch you had to go back to the hotel. We ended up going to a couple restaurants further down the beach. We were always able to get a towel and a beach chair without problem. The water was wavy on the beach and it was a blast jumping the waves. The shuttle to the beach was on time every morning and afternoon. We did walk a couple times and it wasn't bad. The rooms were ok. They were very clean and quiet. The only complaint is that they are small and could use a remodeling. The air conditioning and tv worked really well. Overall we had fun and it was worth the price we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Not terrible but pretty close”
Reviews.Author: Carzook
Reviews.Content: When we first checked in we were welcomed with frozen drinks which I thought was a great way to start off a vacation, sadly though, everything went downhill from there. Let me just start off by saying this is not a terrible hotel but when you go on vacation you expect a little better. Our room was a little on the small side with a bed that was just as hard as the floor. Our toilet did not flush properly and we also had to go to the front desk for a hairdryer. Our electronic lock on the door stopped working after the first day and they had to install new batteries. I saved the best for last, I thought the food was terrible. We only ate at Maria's and we couldn't be more displeased. On the plus side, the bartender (forget his name) at the lobby bar was a great bartender continually supplying us with drinks our first night. And I also thought the hotel staff in general were nice. Now read this next part very carefully---You can upgrade to the Gran Porto Real for only $20 p/p per night! I found out about this by reading a review on this very website. What a great tip!! We only spent one night at the Playa Del Carmen and spent the remaining three nights at the Gran Porto and it totally saved our vacation! We literally felt like we were in another country. The difference between the two hotels is just ridiculous. I read on here that staying at the Gran Porto is like staying at a Four Seasons compared to the Real Playa Del Carmen and it couldn't be more true! Again, the Real Playa del Carmen is not a terrible hotel but if you can stay at the Gran Porto for only $20 p/p per night more and feel like royalty, why wouldn't you?

Reviews.Title: “not exactly a vacation resort”
Reviews.Author: batrip0
Reviews.Content: If you're an American tourist expecting a lavish resort, this is not it. It is part of the Real hotel chain, but is not up to par with their other hotels. This is more of a business traveler or local traveler destination if you don't want all the amenities. Cons: Not located on beach - 2 block walk/ride to the beach club. The beach club was actually part of the Real Grand Porto beach club Sketchy food, by american standards. Actually I have a pretty high tolerance for most food but came away disappointed Small room Pros: cheap price nice staff all-inclusive, but lots of bad food isn't desirable You CAN upgrade to the Gran Porto, or like we did, to the Royal Porto, if space is available. The Gran is a 4 star place, Royal porto a 5 star. All newly built with lavish accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “a 2 star hotel masquerading as a 4 star resort”
Reviews.Author: phishtraveler
Reviews.Content: The key thing to remember here....This hotel used to be called "Club Bananas", this was not built or designed by REAL which makes the contrast really stand out against their other real resorts in the area. They have done a slight remodel, and moved the lobby to the 5th ave side, then converted the old lobby into a "24 hour snack bar" which was usually out of food and beer. The air conditioning in the rooms is Samsung window units with remotes....not bad, but when the power went out in the area, the air clicked off and we came home to a stifling room. Again, this was not the hotel's fault. There is one restaurant here.... but they have it setup with dividers to make it appear to be three, but don't be fooled, its realy only one ; ) The food is average, but you eat outdoors in a beach style hut by the pool so keep this in mind...its hot. The last AI we stayed at had AC rooms with large buffets...not so here. The liquor selection is also very poor here.....the only name brand liquor carried was bacardi. After two days, we were able to obtain an upgrade to the Gran Porto Real for only $20 per day extra. The differences between these two places cannot be described. It's like a 40 year old motel 6 vs. the 4 seasons ! I'm serious. Ask if they have availability and upgrade right away. Keep asking, evn if you just get the last day its's worth $20. The Gran Porto Real was awesome. Food was amazing, restaurants were good. Central air in the rooms....oustanding. Also its a beautifaul, new property as opposed to the Real PDC. Many bars to choose from as well. Real doesnt' seem to care about the Real PDC property...they spent a few $$ remodelign it and that's that. Upgrade right away of you can. I recommend it ! Real PDC is not a terrible place, but it just doesn't measure up to Real's other properties...and the "beach club" is only open until 5pm...its erally just a beach hut (singular) and the rest of the real beach club is off limits to you if you are not staying at the Gran Porto or Royal Porto resorts. Most of us wer just getting started at the beach hut by 5pm so this was a cruel and unusual joke before we upgraded. I hope this information helps ! I sure would have loved to read it ! Cheers !

Reviews.Title: “Old hotel, good service, horrible Beach Club”
Reviews.Author: Paul_Allen
Reviews.Content: OVERALL: I booked the resort (not really a resort actually, more of a hotel)) after carefully reading the reviews here. They were more postive then, comparing to now. Here are my honest and fair observations on this place. I hope it helps to you all. Good luck.. The Good: Well, honestly, it is not a bad hotel to stay (too sleep and eat only). Clean rooms, AC worked well. Room service was on time Local cuisine in buffet restaurant is awesome. The Bad: Terrible a la carte restaurant. Overcooked lobster for those who may not have eaten lobster before. (avoid it while you can my fellow Americans, you have had better the mall) Too far from the Beach Club. Very small pool And the Ugly: Beach Club, beach club and beach club.. FOOD: Food was not bad at all: Buffet restaurant was great with many choices. Morning fesh fruit juice bar is simply awesome. A la carte restaurant however was horrible with over-cooked lobster for $20. They know how to cook Mexican in both restaurants but don't try Italian or French dishes. DRINKS: Bad drinks, with 98% juice. Even extra doubles did not make much difference. I wonder these type of resorts use some sort of low-alcohol content drinks. So, stick with Beer if you can, or get your own booze from the town (very cheap) ads onto your drink. The HOTEL: It was old (very old), but clean and well maintained. Staff was helpful. BEACH Club of the Resort: Beach club was located in the worst possible location in Playa De Carmen and good 20 minutes walk through the shortest cut. Yes, there is a shuttle, but if you like to schedule your movements in vacation for a shuttle then try it. When you arrive to the Beach Club, which is no bigger than a volleyball court, you will be horrified with the beach itself. Left, side of the beach area is blocked with a large pier that was started to be constructed and left unfinished; a concrete nightmare (see the photo I uploaded). Right side has a little cove, with full of muddy material which I think some sort of natural occurrence ( I hope!). The beach was also protected from erosion by many sandbags that had become black and dirty. Beach club staff was nice though. So, if you want nicer and sandier beach, you will have to try other parts of the beach strip available to many other nice(r) hotels. But, if you get thirsty, then you will have to walk back to resort's Beach Club. It is very annoying and time consuming. I must tell you about the Bulldozer experience at the beach: Evidently in the middle of the day some smart individual from neighboring resort decided to teach his fellow employees how to load and unload sand with a small bulldozer. Consequently, he decided to use the Beach Club area for driving, loading and unloading the machine with sand right about 2 feet away from sunbathing resort residents, with full of gas fumes, loud sound of the machine and possibility of running over us. Eventually, after few protests from customers, he was told to go-away. What a beach experience; dirty, muddy beach, surrounded by concrete and people who may run you over with a bulldozer. ADVICE: If you are into a beach vacation, this is not your hotel. Pay extra get one of the beach resorts. Distance from the beach really spoils the whole vacation experience. YOU GET WHAT YOU PAY FOR........

Reviews.Title: “Nope nope nope...never again”
Reviews.Author: ImSlayer
Reviews.Content: I should have known this was too good to be true. Let's start with the bad: AC sucked. It's true. It's crap. i had them come the first day we were there....it was cooler in the hallway then in the room. I talked to Fransisco Zapata 2 days later, hoping that it was either going to get cooler or stay the same...imagine my surprise when I walked in and it was turned off. The rooms are small, bathroom got way too hot. Mosquitos everywhere. Their so called 24 hour activities area was low on food, on soda, they wanted you to pay for air hockey and their pool table was missing some of the balls. The walk to the beach was nice, 5th avenue has a lot of shops but could not find any public restrooms. The left side of the beach, not the side where the "Real" people stayed was awesome. Did I mentioned the huge dead roach in the room? Never again will I stay at any "Real" resorts.

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I have just returned from a 7 night stay at the Real Playa Del Carmen. We had a great time and enjoyed the Real. It is primarily a good value. We got a great price for an all inclusive property, but you must realize this is not a luxury property. It's not on the beach and the food is only so-so. There is one resturaunt that they call two. You need a reservation for the ala carte side of the resturaunt but it's really not worth the effort. Neither side is air conditioned. The staff is great, the grounds are well kept, the rooms are clean and the drinks are good and allways available. The beach club is on a poor section of the beach and quite a ways from the hotel. The best beach is found by going left on fifth avenue from the lobby for a block then right straight to the beach. It's one of the nicest stretches of beach you'll ever see. If your on a budget but want to see the sights, avoid the tours and take the bus. The bus station is down fifth ave. about 10 blocks or so and you can go to Chichen Itza for about $3.00 rount trip. admission is only $3 or $4. The tour from the hotel is about $60.00 per person. Same thing goes for Tulum and Xel Ha. A warning, Dont use Worry Free Vacations to mexico! When we arrived at the airport there was no transportation to the hotel. we had to wait 2 1/2 hours for our bus. Adventure tours, funjet and all the others were there waiting for them. worry Free is not! We never saw or heard from a representative in the time we were there. On the last night, thanks to a dest clerk who was persistent we were able to talk to someone about a ride to the airport the next morning. Our only option was to be picked up at 5:40 am for our 10 am flight. The hotel staff is well aware of the poor performance of worry free. I would reccomend the Real for a budget minded traveler who is willing to walk to the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the money!”
Reviews.Author: cgl7
Reviews.Content: Second time to Mexico,first all inclusive.In spite of not being on the beach,this very quaint and spotlessly clean place delivered! The staff was extremely attentive,the pool clean,and there was always someone doing gardening, painting or anything else that needed doing. Although we had read reviews prior to going that criticized the buffets as being repeititious,we did not find this at all.Sure there was some stuff the same offered every day,but every dinner seemed to offer something different. If there was anything negative to say about our whole stay,it would be that the beach bar only had nachos with cheese for the food selection,but then again who goes to a beach bar to eat! Also the location of the beach club,is not in the best section of the beach for swimming,however if you walk a short distance up the beach,on the other side of the pier there are plenty of spots to go.One day just for a change of pace we went to Mamitas Beach Club,which is actually only a short walk from the hotel. A definite plus is the short walk to fifth avenue,where everything happens! For you thai food lovers,try Babes Restaurant located just off of fifth on tenth,I BELIEVE. All in all a great stay,and wouldn't hesitate to reccomend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Real Playa del Carmen for 7 days at the end of May to beg of June. Enjoyed it very much. All staff are very friendly and kept on offering us drinks :) The beach at the sister hotel is decent too! For anyone who is going to stay there, and loves to party, DO go on a “disco” experience to Coco Bongo! It was so much fun! Also, there are so much going on every single night down 5th ave! Don’t stay in and watch tv! Sites you must check out: Coco Bongo, Blue Parrot, and the rest of the crazy night life on 5th avenue. The parties start around midnight and some go till 7AM! Also, when you go to the beach, you MUST walk to the left hand side of the beach where you are suppose to stay! It’s MUCH nicer! Anyways, enough talk, enjoy your stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Good place on a budget”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We went to Playa and stayed 6 nights at the Real Playa del Carmen. We got a pretty good deal, and the Trip Advisor reviews were positive, so we thought we would give it a try. The hotel itself is nice enough. The staff are all extremely friendly and VERY hard working. I espically liked being offered a beverage while we were checking in! The room was fine. On the small side, but not a problem at all. Our particular room had issues with the toilet flushing (even after we notified the front desk). Also, the cable in the hotel went on the fritz. But those were all of the problems that we had. The mini fridge was stocked with beer, water and soda daily. The food at the buffet was fine. There were plenty of veggies and fruits. The fish entrees were especially tasty. We really liked the a la cart place, too. We ate there 3 times. At the suggestion of other reviewers, we had the lobster. It really was good! The walk to the beach wasn't bad for us (we are both in mid 30s), but it is so hot in the middle of the afternoon. Since the hotel doesn't have a fitness room, we never took the shuttle so as not to feel so bad about what all we consumed! The walk is about 8 minutes. There were a couple of issues that we had though with the beach club. 1). There is no food there. Just tortilla chips and cheese sauce. Now that is yummy, but not exactly lunch material. So, just plan on either walking back to the hotel, or finding a place to eat, or having pina coladas for lunch! 2.) The club stops serving drinks at 5 p.m. A little on the early side to us! On the positive side, the beach bar was never busy and there were plenty of palapas and chairs. Perfect for us! We can't comment on any tours or excursions, as all we did was lie at the beach and relax. Overall, we had a nice time here. It's one of those cases where you get what you pay for. But we didn't pay a lot, but I think the place is nice enough and the food and drinks were good. What more can you really ask?

Reviews.Title: “Awsome hotel!”
Reviews.Author: NashvilleReunion
Reviews.Content: What an awsome place! My husband and I just returned last night from a trip with 3 high school graduates. We had booked 2 doubles and a single. When we checked in, they offered to upgrade us to a double and a 2 bedroom/2 bathroom suite with a living/dining area, a small kitchen and 2 balconies. at no extra charge. That was 518, and the double was 314-A. The gardens are so pretty, I didn't miss a view of the beach. The hotel is older, but you can see the improvements being made all the time. The rooms are not huge, but certainly large enough, with great use of space. No bathtubs, just showers, but that was fine with us. Every room has a little refrigerator stocked once a day with water, Dos Equis beer and soft drinks. Plenty of shampoo. conditioner and lotions are left each day. Our towel art included 2 swans with flower petals and a wishing well with a flower in it. The food was great! If you can make 3 teenagers from Alabama and 2 somewhat more sophisticated adults happy, you're doing it right. I wished for more fresh vegies, but there was always some. We ate 2 nights at Maria's (reservation only) and it was great. The grilled lobster ($15 extra/person) was absolutely out of this world. The kids had room service for lunch a couple of times and said it was really good. At breakfast and lunch there were always one or 2 grill stations for omelets, burgers, chicken, etc. Good variety and good food. The drinks were plentiful and as strong as you want them. The cup size was good. We didn't get out the cups we brought. There was no need. The house wine (Palacio del Carmen from Spain) was very nice. Red and white were both good and both were available all day and in the international room. This is a departure from most all-inclusives we've stayed in. The international room had table tennis, pool table, TV and a poker table. There were several types of liquor and mixers, beer and wine and deli style sandwiches, salads and desserts available 24 hours. And, also, the same type of coffee machine as in the lobby and the restaurant. Great cappucino, espresso and good, strong coffee. The beach (ask at the desk and they will tell you how to go the back way to the beach, then you can walk down to the beach club in the sand instead of the street) is great. A little rocky right in front of the bar, but you have plenty of it to choose from. The bar swings are fun and there is lounge chair service if you can't be bothered to walk 20 feet. There are kayaks to use there. We never used the shuttle, because the walk was very pleasant. We all wished the beach bar was open longer. It would be nice to watch the sunset on the beach with a glass of wine. Everyone working at the resort was freindly and helpful. Most of them spoke at least a little English, but we tried to speak Spanish at least some. We didn't have a single problem. Clean towels were always available. Big, heavy towels for the beach and the room! The location is wonderful. A small distance from the shopping and bars and all, but not in the noise and crowds. We walked into town every day. We had massages at Spa Itza (I would definitely recommend that!) One day, my husband and I walked to WalMart to get some extra beach shoes. It was about 8 blocks (big blocks!) from the hotel. It really wasn't a bad walk. The WalMart itself is worth seeing, with it's underground parking lot and liquor department. The shows were entertaining and early enough to watch and still go out in the evening. They are not professional, but they are amusing. You will recognize your favorite bartender on stage, maybe a waitress or 2. They work very hard at everything they do. We did find liquor to be as cheap at the airport as anywhere. It's easier to buy it there and add it to your carry-on rather than shlep it from the hotel. We never heard anything disruptive from our room. We couldn't even tell we had neighbors. We were on a Vacation Express package, and I can tell you it was perfect. The planes were on time, the transportation from the airport in Cancun to the hotel was on a large, comfortable bus with a bathroom and a cooler of Corona. It was all awsome. All 5 of us can't wait to go back and do it all again!

Reviews.Title: “Personnal and Inviting”
Reviews.Author: Seychelle1
Reviews.Content: We arrived for our two week vacation on May 6th in the evening from Ontario, Canada. Our luggage was immediately collected by the Bell Boy and we were taken to the reception desk to check into our room. We recieved a refreshing drink immediately. My husband asked for an upgraded room and we were given one immediately without any extra charges. We were wisked off to our one bedroom suite where we dropped off our luggage and wipped down to the beach. I was a little dissapointed that the hotel wasn't beach front but after a day or two the quick walk was no longer an issue. After all a little excersice doesn't hurt anyone. The very next day we familiarized ourselves with our new surroundings. We found out that alot of vacationers weren't travelling to the area due to the Hurricaine. We never even gave it any thought. For the first week we sunbathed at the pool, which to me was a dissapointment as it was so small and the deck surrounding the pool wasn't large enough to accommodate many lounge chairs. In addition, it only had one entry and exit set of pool ladder. We ate at the buffet, which we found an extremely wide variety and tasty morsels. The drinks were endless and the service was excellent. Wait staff would clear your eating area immediately of empty plates, gasses etc. We were very impressed that you could book an A-la-Cart dinner every day by noon at the reception desk. We ate A-la-Cart 3 times during our stay. Room service was offered on a once daily basis and of course we took advantage of that as well (draw back to ordering by phone is limited knowledge of english at the receivers end). We walked to WalMart (I was shocked to see a regular store) for more summer clothes. We galavanted down to 5th Avenue, which is the main shopping strip. The only negative comment I can make is that the shop keepers would try to haggle you into their stores (real pain in the your know what). After a while we stopped walking down 5th Avenue or make up an excuse that we were leaving that afternoon so they would stop bothering us. We took a tour of the Royal Porto Real Playa del Carmen. The suite shown was georgous!! But I honestly found the facility too large for my liking. The foyer was really too large and you couldn't have a private conversation. Perhaps that's why it was pretty empty. I loved the 24 hour service room. It was air conditioned and set up pretty nicely. The pool area was very nice. And the Real Bazar was better than the other two facility Bazars and this is where we spent our $50.00 USD gift certificates for taking the tour. But this large facility just didn't have that personnal touch like the smaller one. Our tour laster longer than the scheduled 90 minutes and we went through 4 sales men and finally made it bluntly clear that we didn't make hasty decisions when making large investment purchases. During our second week we rented a small car for 3 days @ $35.00 USD per day through Americana and visited Xel-Ha. What can we say...you have to visit and make an entire day of it. It's truly Natures Wonder! We snorkelled and then tubed down the river. After which we walked the entire park and took video and photo's. We were one of the last couples to leave the park. Tulum was also quite remarkable. Xcaret should be an all day adventure don't forget to include the dinner theatre. This was a amazing and colourful show. Over 300 actors telling a story from past to present in costume, music and singing. We will be visiting alot more places next year. The town of Playa-del-Carmen is definately a safe place to walk. We've seen single people both male and female on vacation walking safely through the streets. There is alot of Police riding through the town and on the beach. The beach by the way is so clean and the water so clear. It was fun acting like a kid for a change playing in the waves as they sometimes swept you towards shore. Other days it was more calm and you could float on your back enjoying the sounds around you. Since it was a public beach, there was so much space for everyone. No over crowding what so ever. When we returned home on May 20th we've told our kids that we are going to return to Playa-del-Carmen next year for our 10th Wedding Anniversary and we'll be taking them along too. I personally love Mexico and both my husband and I really and truly loved Playa-del-Carmen and our hotel amenities. We timed our vacation well because on the Friday before we left to come home a bus full of about 20 boys had just arrived. Thanks for such a relaxing time and wonderful weather. PS/ I wish we could have had a late check out or an air conditioned waiting room as we sat in the lobby for hours until our bus arrived at 5:05 p.m.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time at the Real Playa Del Carmen”
Reviews.Author: MsJung
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Real Playa Del Carmen, May 8-12, 2006. Upon first arriving it was a bit disappointing, I had never been to Mexico before so did not know what to expect, however I did my research(thank you Trip Advisor members) and quickly my disappointment turned to sheer joy. The staff was friendly and accomodating. Lupita keep our room clean, the bed turn down each night, clean towels and freash soap and shampoo's left each day. She even made towel animals and left them on the bed. The room was nice, only one complaint the bed was hard. The food was good, however it could have been keep warmer. Gina sits in the lobby and was always eager to help. We did do a time share presentation(we did not get it)however we were to recieve 1500 pescos, we did not. When we went to set up our horse backing riding outing the gy at Best day tours asked if we had recieved the pescos, when we told him "no", he told Gina who came in on her off day(which was also ther Mother's Day) to take us to get our pescos. Now that is customer service. Each day we got up and went down to the beach club and each evening we walked down 5th street and came back to sit in the lobby which is under a tikki hut this was very relaxing after a long day at the beach. This hotel is far enough from everything to enjoy peace and quiet and close enough to get to do other things. I would recommend this hotel and we would go back and stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Thumbs Up!!”
Reviews.Author: northern-nomad
Reviews.Content: Stayed here April 9-16/06. Fiancee and I couldn't have had a better holiday. Hotel is located at the quieter north end of the busy 5th Avenue in PDC. Approximately a 10 minute walk to the beach, or you can take the shuttle (we never did). Room was big and clean with a/c, TV in the bedroom, minibar, balcony and a safe. Maids left towel sculptures each day. Food at the buffet was always tasty and plentiful. We ate at the a la carte one night and it was ok, but nothing super special. Service at the restaurants is exceptional - as soon as you finish a drink the waitresses are there to ask if you want another. Pool is small but good for a quick dip if you need it. The hotel grounds are lush and very well kept. Beach club was great as well - usually no problem getting a beach chair, and the bartenders keep the drinks flowing. The shore itself is a bit rocky right there, but we wore surf shoes and had no problems in the water. If you want, you can just walk 3 minutes up the beach (on the other side of the pier) and the shore is much nicer. This hotel isn't fancy, but it's not a budget hotel either. After travelling around the mayan riviera for a week, we were glad we chose this hotel because it's nice to be able to go for a stroll at night after you've had dinner and a couple drinks. Many stores on 5th Ave stay open until about 10 p.m., and there is an abundance of streetside cafes, bars, etc. Seems like it would be a hassle to go into town in the evening from one of the all-inclusives outside of PDC, as you'd always be paying taxi fares. The town itself is very safe, and there are cops all over the place. Real Playa del Carmen was awesome - we'd go back tomorrow if we could.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Real Playa Del Carmen was a great place to stay. The food was excellent, there was always a wide variety of choices. The staff was very pleasant and the rooms very clean. The room I stayed in was spacious and nicely decorated. The pool is small, but I was there for the ocean. If you are looking for a huge pool and resort this is not the place for you. But if you are looking for a nice, clean, small hotel, it is a great place to stay. It is not beach front but I found the walk to the beach a great way to get a little exercise. The beach club was nice, with a bar and lots of beach chairs. We went on a last minute deal and got a great price. No complaints here!

Reviews.Title: “Don't be fooled by some reviews- it's a great little hideway!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have read some negative reviews regarding this slightly out of the way oasis and could not disagree more. The food very tasty- lots of authentic mexican cuisine - excellent fish was 4 1/2 out of 5. The pool quiet and relaxing and all to yourself lots of the time. The staff - absolutely fantastic.. The rooms very spacious, clean and comfortable. Did I mentionthe staff? Genuine smiles and always trying to keep you happy. They even restock your fridge every day with beer and, water and pop. Downside..well..not any real consistent bar service to the pool area... but then, the bar is only 30 ft away, no elevators so the 4th floor is a bit of a climb at times and not for older folks , the after hours area ...kinda cheesy and best not to visit there...I am sure they will improve it. Upside...Fifth Avenue is fantastic and at your doorstep , the free shuttle to their all inclusive beach club a great option if you do not want to walk off some lbs. and view the shopping [no hassle sellers by the way] The lobster in the ala carte - very worth it..Huge Lobster Tails The service all around..Excellent. The entertainment in the evenings is fun and the singers and dancers are professional plus ...the stage is right in the dining area and very pleasant while dining. Enough said....give it a try it's not a 5 star or even 4 star but a definite 3 1/2 star PLUS..at a very reasonable price. Don't forget to say Hello to Alex the Supreme bartender at the lobby bar...

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Loved everything about it!!!”
Reviews.Author: Amyottawacanada
Reviews.Content: Me, 16 and my mother in her urly 40's decided to take a trip...our agent told us their was constuction witch when we got there dint even notice it.We where there between feb 4 to feb 11 2006. I am verry picky with my food but their big selection witch makes easy for every one...their is all keinds of Pastas...salads...pizza...French fries...and oviusly mexican...The staff is verry nice espacialy the intertainers...witch me and my mother always made it to the hotel for the shows their are pretty special... The beach is about a ten minute walk down a street full of shops so if youre a shopper like me, make it 60 minutes!!! the open bar is right on the beach...Day time intertainers are always doing something ... valley ball, darts, yoga, bracelets, spanish lessons...fun fun fun...We totaly recomend this hotel...maids do a beautiful job and are very friendly...Dont think twice!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very relaxing & friendly place”
Reviews.Author: katga
Reviews.Content: We were here Feb. 25th through March 8th and had a wonderful time. The atmosphere was very relaxed, the staff was wonderful and their Beach Club was the best. We had the guests from the Royal Porto Real coming over to our beach club with the swings because they said it was much more fun than their's, our bartender's, Sergio, Jimmy, and Marcos were the best and the Sports and Entertainment staff, Oscar, Bernie, Eve and Luis kept everyone laughing. They also did a great job of making the trip a great time for my 17 year old son who otherwise might have been a little bored being there with his mom. The walk to the beach wasn't bad and you could always wait for the shuttle if you didn't feel like walking. I actually kind of enjoyed the walk in the morning and it gave me some much needed exercise with all the food and drinks I seemed to consume everyday. The selection of food was a little smaller than at some of the larger AI's I've stayed at but it turned over much faster so it was almost always fresh/hot. Even my son managed to find something he liked at every meal. The only complaint we had was with some of the other guests being rather rude/overbearing (no not Americans) at times but this had nothing to do with the resort. I feel for the cost of this place it is one of the better deals you'll find in PDC and well worth it. It was also a great place to bring older teenagers. There was plenty to keep them occupied between the 24 hour club that had a pool table and dart game as well as the pool itself and the ping pong table. I would definetly go back to this resort again.

Reviews.Title: “Would not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: LoomisDrywall
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights before moving on to Akumal. We only ate at the buffet and found the food pretty good, although a bit on the cool side. The service was great - drinks came quickly. Our main complaint was the room. It was very small and cramped, the bed was rock hard and the noise was horrible. The noise is no fault of the hotel, it came from traffic, pigeons, barking dogs, construction work and the maids banging around at 7:30 am. The pool area is very small so we did not use it. The beach club was very nice, but some distance from the hotel and crowded. We would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good little place with no screaming kids”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is an honest review of this hotel. My girlfriend and I went to this hotel feb 1-5 looking for a quite place to get away and get out of the cold Michigan winter and did not want to spend alot of money. I am 37 and my girlfriend turned 32 while we were there. The place is pretty clean and the staff is wonderful. We never had to ask for anything including drinks with our meals, after about a day they remebered you and brought you another as soon as they saw you were low. The food was good with mostly buffet and there is a ala carte that serves dinner starting at 7, make a reservation at the front desk in the am. The beech club at the sister property was nice to have and was just a short walk, 3 blocks or so, or you could take the shuttle than ran on the 1/2 hour. They opened at 10am and all your drinks are included there also. We were on the third floor and there are no elevators on this property. I think there were 4 floors all together in each building.
