I am not complaining about the stairs I just want people that have a tough time with stairs that you may have to walk a few. Pool was OK with limited seating around it. Lots of nice people when we were there from everywhere. A lot from Europe and Canada and a few from the US. Mostly adults in the late 20's to 60's and I only saw kids in strollers not one older than 2 or 3. Shopping starts one block away and goes for miles and miles. We felt safe and had no problems. Police every few blooks or so were nice to see, they were friendly. Beach was nice and had some waves while we were there. Some people say all the beds are hard as rocks in Mexico but I would call ours firm. We had 6 pillows and slept like babies. The weather was in the 80's and the room has an airconditioner which is the window kind. It kept up ok during the hot afternoon if you kept the bathroom door closed but if it were over 90 I think you may have a problem keeping your room cool. For the money I would do it again without even thinking about. "Best beach bartender was Jimmy"

Reviews.Title: “Just what we were looking for!”
Reviews.Author: katiekinsmom
Reviews.Content: We loved our week stay at the Real. The food was great and you could eat at the A La Carte every evening if you wished (reserve in a.m.), we liked the buffet. Fresh omelettes or eggs any style were made at the buffet every morning. Due to the low price of the vacation, we ate a number of meals out to experience the local restaurants - we could walk to them all (venture onto 10th and find more "local" fare). We didn't like the coffee, however. Yes, there is construction going on but there appears to be that everywhere. It never woke us up. We loved our room (317B) and could see the ocean and Cozumel (had to climb 3 flights - didn't bother us). A/C worked and room was fresh and comfortable. Mini bar was always restocked. Towel animals left daily by the maids! There is a shuttle to the beach but we liked the 10 minute walk along the shops. Nice beach club, lots of chairs and shade. You can get drinks but only basic snacks. Entertainment guys were a lot of fun organizing volleyball, horseshoes, salsa dancing at the beach. Pool was nice - usually quiet. This is a small hotel. It's more like a "boutique" hotel but with more free food and drinks. It's not a 5 star but I would rather stay here than out in "resortland". Fun entertainment shows every night. I would recommend this resort if you like to venture out from the resort to experience the area. Due to the savings, we felt we had the freedom to eat out, but we enjoyed our meals in. Our tour company was Nolitours and their rep, Genevieve was very helpful at the resort. I would go back - however, I wouldn't take my kids. Not many young kids there, no kids program. They just opened the New Lobby and they make drinks right there while you check in or wait for your bus to leave. **While we were they, they offered to move us to the Gran Costa Real in Cancun for 3 or 4 nights if we wished - all at their cost. They are trying to get people back there since Wilma. If this interests you, ask. Enjoy your vacation - we did!

Reviews.Title: “I love Mexico but NOT this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mayaventurer
Reviews.Content: I have been to Mexico many times and decided to take my mom to Playa del carmen. I booked the trip and the hotel expecting a pretty resort by the pictures and things I had heard about the hotel.When we pulled up to the hotel I felt embarassed to let my mom stay here.It was rundown and there were no beautiful views to be seen.When we got to our room it was hotter inside than the 110 degree weather outside.It had a very musty smell and the photos in the ads did it no justice. This is definitly not the place to stay if you want to hang out at the beach.The shuttle only comes so often and on a schedule so you have to plan your excursions and meals around the shuttle or take a chance to pay for a cab to the beach club.You can walk as we did however it takes awile to get there (keep in mind the heat)so wear good shoes.There was NO relief from the heat at this hotel as far as the restaurants which are in open air.The pool was okay but nothing great.The biggest luxory at this hotel was the Hammock garden.Shopping is off 5th Ave., which is a far walk from the hotel(I recomend going at night)There is absolutly nothing by this hotel except other run down buildings(which is fine if you are expecting it).Don't get me wrong the shopping and resturants off 5th Ave. were awesome but Mexico has much more to offer.Don't stay in at this resort but go see the country and it's wonderful people.Tulum was breath taking,like nothing I have ever seen but don't go on the tour.Go yourself.If you take the hotel sponsered tour you will end up with 20 min to see everything and take plenty of water and a good hat.Xcaret is a must (2 days needed here)and opt for the dinner show ,it makes you feel like part of the culture!Pay a little more and PLEASE stay somewhere else .The other Real hotels were on the beach by shopping so that would have been perfect.If you are just looking for a bed this hotel is perfect.On another note go to Mexico to see Mexico.Have a great time and do and see something you can't anywhere else in the world!I love Mexico just not this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice...”
Reviews.Author: Jprinz
Reviews.Content: I was there for 2 days before Wilma struck... but I have to say it was very clean; food was acceptable; and the atmosphere was nice.. I am a single male american and speak only english. I would go back if I was a couple but not as a single as there were not many singles there and those that were spoke German.. which made socializing difficult. There are many Germans and Swedish that frequent this place.. so if you speak you might have more fun. The only thing that irritated me was when Wilma was coming they didn't talk to us at all.. they just started putting all the equipment away and preparing... I guess they don't give a rats -- about their "clients"..

Reviews.Title: “Real Playa has the best food in Playa”
Reviews.Author: grammaterry
Reviews.Content: This was certainly a hotel that far exceed my expectations. I paid $750 including airfare for this AI for the week of October 14-22. Sure, we had to leave early because of Hurricane wilma but it was great while it lasted. The master suite was a series of 4 rooms. A sitting area next to the walkout balcony had a nice coffee table and two comfortable chairs. On the balcony were two sturdy wrought iron chairs and it overlooked lush landscaped lawns . We could see the pool and the restaurant from our room. As you walked thru the hallway of our room, there was a mini fridge stocked with beer, water, v8 juice, coke & sprite. Then you entered a living area with a sleeper sofa and a closet with a safe. The bathroom was adequate with a shower on one side of the living area and on the other side was a bedroom that held a king size bed with very firm mattress (I'd say Hard) with lots of pillows. No dresser or closet but a built in vanity and a television set. No clocks and no hairdryers in this room. The food was outstanding. I had stayed at the reef coco beach in January and had been very disappointed with the AI concept. The food had been so food service oriented and was the same buffet daily. The service was so so but no one ever offered you a drink or extras. What a change in this hotel. I had planned to blow off the food because the price was so cheap but to my amazement...I was timing the meals so I'd be back to check them out. The breakfasts had a great grill with custom omelettes or eggs, pancakes, french toast...you name it plus quiches, casseroles, cereals & fruits along with breakfast meats gallore. Lunches were always different. One day, hamburgers & french fries from the grill with salads and ohter entrees...always fresh fruit & desserts...Dinners were super with beef, chicken, fish, & pork every day fixed differently. Theme nights of Mexican, Italian, German, etc. The waitresses tried so hard to please always keeping the water glasses filled and asking to bring bar drinks. We left $1 tip every meal and you could see great appreciation . The hotel did have a 24 hour coffee bar but that part I wasn't impressed by. The room seemed a little dirty and the snacks seemed to be left overs. But each morning when I would get up at 5am and go down to the restaurant, they always welcomed me to come get fresh coffee in the restaruent and drink it out by the pool. Even though this resort is rated as a 2 star...I'd give the food a 4 star. The buffets were always well decorated with fruits and vegetable carvings and the chefs wore chef hats and the place was immaculate. They aimed to please. I went to the sister hotels beach club "Porta Real" and they were very accommodating. We had a margarita on the beach there. They were very nice to us and were playing bingo in the afternoon. The Real Playa had great entertainment too although, I go to bed early and rise early so entertainment wasn't on my menu too often. Give this place a try. Its off the beach so the hurricane probably didn't hurt it too much. In fact they were evacuating the Porto Playa and Royal Playa to the Real Playa so that tells you about its safety factor. Email me if you have more questions.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for sure”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I don't agree one single bit with the writer of the previous review. As i just have returned from Mexico my experience is still very fresh. First of all, funny thing is that most of the real playa reviews come from americans,which i haven't seen many of on the hotelgrounds. Most of the guests are italian and dutch. It is that we have such low standards in our european countries that we are so easily pleased? Don't think so.. Real Playa is a member of the Real group and have connections with member hotels in Playa,such as the Porto Real hotel (where i have been a few times visiting friends who stayed there during my vacation). Although Real Playa may have a star less, it is not so noticeable. For example the food. I had dinner with my friends in their Porto Real hotel and if i compare the 2 kitchens i see little difference. Real Playa has a buffet which offers enough choice. Everyday 2 of 3 kinds of pasta, potatoes in different kinds and rice. A choice of meat,chicken and fish, a fresh saladbar and 5 sorts of cakes and pies as well as fresh fruit for dessert. My room,a junion suite was spacious enough,kept well clean by the ladies of the housekeeping and had enough towels. Safety deposit box in the walk-in closet, minibar is filled every day and the tv has 40 channels to pick from, including HBO, Cinemax and Hallmark. And all the junior suites have a terrace with a private hammock which was highly appreciated. Although the pool was small (which didn't bother me at all as i went to the beach),it was clean and the water was clear. Enough seats around the pool for sunbathing and drinks are served upon request. The only thing which bothered me a bit was that the most of the staffmembers (especially the restaurantstaff) had little knowledge of english. As my spanish is not that good, to say the least, it might be handy for the management to have their staff taking english lessons so guests can have more conversation with the staff than only drinkorders. Overal, good hotel in this price range. Recommandable!

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Mimmers
Reviews.Content: Just returned from this hotel. Thank goodness it was only for one night except the real disappointment was that it was on our last night of our vacation! We had originally stayed at the RIU resorts (RIU Tequila) then decided that we wanted to extend our trip one more night but unfortunately RIU was sold out so we decided to give this one a try! HUGE MISTAKE! TALK ABOUT NIGHT AND DAY!!!!!!!! We liked the RIU TEQUILA quite a bit but didn't realize just how much we appreciated it until we arrived at this hotel! Luckily I/we have experienced different A/I throughout Cancun, Jamaica and in the carribean but sad enough to say that this was the worst!!!! I would feel so bad for people trying out A/I for the first time at this hotel and therefore I'm writing this review to spare future vacationers from making a huge mistake!!! Playa Del Carmen has a wide range to offer different types of travelers whether they are seeking a cute boutique hotel where they can make their own choices for dining on 5th St. to those who prefer to be pampered and go all inclusive on their vacations. If one is seeking all inclusive for the first time, please don't ruin it by experiencing it here regardless of how much they are on a budget! It would be so much better to just go EP in a cute hotel and pay for food then have to eat /drink here just for value! THE FOOD IS HORRIBLE!!!!!!! NO CHOICES, Not fresh, just plain YUCK!!!!! Much better value to pay for your own food and not go inclusive! Sorry to have to mention this again but for just a little more, if anyone wants to experience A/I, GO TO THE RIU properties!!!!!!!! You stay in one hotel and have access to 4 other properties where food is plentiful in variety, good service where guests are #1, and grounds, facilities, pools, room are so much more enjoyable!!!! One's idea of A/I would be ruined at this property!!!! In another words : Sure you get what you pay for but PAY a BIT MORE and stay away from this place!!!! Small rooms, Nasty food, just plain YUCK should I say more??? GO RIU!!!!!!!!!! I'd return to RIU properties any day of the week and wouldn't recommend this place to my worst enemy meaning if I was offered a free week here, I'd stay home!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay on a budget”
Reviews.Author: becciroo
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at the Real from 6/22-6/28/2005. We had a blast. I believe the way to a good time is not looking for all of the things that are wrong, or not up to American standards, but to loosen up and enjoy where you are and make the best of it. You're in MEXICO!!! This IS a budget hotel.... the food is just ok....drinks were just drinkable.....BUT The staff is VERY friendly (Hi Allen and Juan!) the rooms are clean (small), maids were great (please tip)the grounds were beautiful and the evening entertainment triplets (two Italian girls and their Mexican MC) knew how to get the party started every eve! I won a bottle of tequila and a t-shirt!!! ;0) We were like the only Americans there. Most of the guests were from Italy. The hotel is about three blocks to the beach, and a shuttle is provided. Walking takes about 10- minutes.They allow you to use a small section of their facilities (Real Beach Club) on the beach, which has beach chairs, massages, drinks. 5th ave starts next street over and is about a 30-45 minute walk to get to the other end by the pier to Cozumel and Senior Frogs. In the evening, the walk provides lively entertainment, good food, and great people watching. Saty at this hotel and spend your money on the sites. Be warned......if someone acts like they want to help you, it's a trick.....they want you to see their time share. Listen if you like, we did and got many trips next to nothing. (Chitchen Itza, Tulum/Xel-ha, X-caret) for $120 a piece including transportation by luxury buses, meals, and drinks. We took a ferry over to Cozumel one day, and spent the afternoon snorkling in beautiful clear water. snorkle was $25 and can be purchased before or after you get on the ferry. Ferry was $9.00 each way. All in all, we had a great trip and wouldn't change anything for the world. We will come back again and again. Be glad you are staying in Playa, we took a city bus ($4.00) to Cancun and the difference was night and day. Playa is much closer to all of the fun stuff and at a fraction of the cost. btw.... our hotel was $120 a night all inclusive for two people! (YOu will spend more than that in a day in meals alone). With proces that cheap....it doesn't bother you to eat out or be gone at meal times. Email me if you have any other questions.

Reviews.Title: “Great Beach Club”
Reviews.Author: cheery97
Reviews.Content: The Real Playa del Carmen was everything that we expected and then some. The rooms were nice and spacious. Although I do have to say that we were not fond of the maid, she turned off the air everyday, when you come in from the beach or a day trip the room would be so hot and it would take forever to cool down. Granted my husband and I love cold rooms so this may not be a problem for you. The beach club was fantastic never crowded and the beach is perfect. I would comment as well that if you like your cocktails strong tell them to make it strong, if you do not ask them the drinks just ends up sweet tasting. The food was ok there was not that much to choice from all and all not bad Maria's restuarant is really good. I think that this place is great if you are on a budget and really just want to relax on the beach this is a great place. One beware for american tourist who are not use to this there are a lot of topless european women on the beach, I am not being offensive at all, but when you are not use to it in the US it is a little eye opening at first, but you get use to it. I hope this review helps.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: VeronicaV
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Real Playa del Carmen for one week last March, and found it pleasant and relatively inexpensive. The place is spotless, rooms have adjustable air conditioning, tv set and radio. Master rooms have a small porch with a hammock in addition, ideal for jet-lagged early mornings. Yet there are no safety boxes, and using the lockers at the reception is a bit complicated (you need to sign in, and sometimes queue up a little), but still manageable. The pool is small but relaxing (see photo), and good for cooling down when the sun becomes too hot. Food and water are safe. There’s a large and nice buffet restaurant serving international cooking, including Mexican dishes, which I found really good, far better than the small à la carte restaurant (you can give it a try, but keep your expectations low and remember and you need to reserve seats). There's also a 24-hours snack place, which is very convenient in case you happen to miss lunch or dinner time for some reason. The staff is truly friendly and helpful. We happened to leave a handbag behind at the restaurant one night, and they found it and kept it safe in the office for us to claim it. The hotel is quite far from the beach club, so you need to take the free shuttle or walk for about fifteen minutes. You can also use free bikes. Remember that the day becomes really hot around noon, so make sure you have proper transport, or be prepared for a walk under the sun. The Quinta Avenida is definitely close, as the brochure says, just a small walk. Once again, the quinta avenida is a long road, and you may want to use a bike, or take the shuttle to reach the center, or be prepared for a walk under the sun. Avoid the Internet cafes on the Quinta, unless you want a crowded and expensive experience (which you may actually want, in fact), there's a cheap and air-conditioned Internet cafe near the hotel, just next block on the same road (1 and a half dollar for one hour). The beach club is a bit crowded, and there aren't many umbrellas, but the atmosphere is still nice. There's a toilet, a shower, a bar with drinks and small refreshments, and the staff provides free body-boards and kayaks. I've heard the beach club used to include also the beach on the left side of the pier, but as they're building a new hotel right behind there, they've closed that part of the strand until the new hotel is ready. Anyway, the beach has white sand, the sea has nice waves of intense turquoise, so in general I do not share the complaints I’ve happened to hear or read. To sum up, I've enjoyed my stay at the Real Playa, in particular the relaxed atmosphere, nice staff and really good cooking. The only flaw, music. A maddening sequence of nearly-unrecognizable classics played on some sort of piano-organ, apart from the night we arrived, they had original Elvis then!

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't go back......”
Reviews.Author: Chloegirl02
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Real Playa in November for 1 week. I would not recommend this hotel. No complaints about the staff, they are very nice. We had problems with our room (too small) and they were very helpful and found us a better room (a suite - on the main floor with a small balcony w/ hamock) at no extra charge. The food is terrible. There is only 1 resteraunt so your SOL. We ended up eating out most nights on 5th Avenue. The pool is small and nothing goes on there as far as water sports or music. There is only one bar with a small patio area if you want to have a few drinks before going out for the evening. There is also a 24 hr snack bar which was a joke. I highly recommend the Blue Parrot, it's the HOT spot. You can dance, watch a great fire shoe - we were there almost every night. It's fabulous...... Do not book any tours thru the hotel, it's a scam. Just get a cab and go on your own - it's cheaper and you don't have to be on someone elses schedule. The Beach is nice, we took the bus a few times but walking was okay too! The one draw back is that they don't serve any food, so if you plan on going for the day - bring lunch or be prepared to leave the beach and go find a cafe. We also spent the day at the "sister" hotel the Porto Real which is down the beach and it's a beautiful hotel. I would stay there next time for sure. It would be well worth spending the $$$.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: As stated in a previous review: great value. Get the "boutique" hotel experience, w/ the All Inclusive amenities. Animation team is great: Jorge and Arodi. Actually, Jorge was at Gran Porto Real last year, and has swapped resorts. They are great. Room: a little below average, but we don't spend much time there anyway. Window unit air conditioner was adequate w/ use of ceiling fan on super-high. Water pressure left something to be desired. Service: Restaurant was good, though servers' english is limited. No bother to me, since I wasn't in the US. It was I that should be speaking Spanish, and I made the effort. In return, they help out where they can and try their best to understand. Service, itself, was great. Room service was prompt and food was good. Facilities: Nice. AI section in upstairs lobby always had cold beer, sandwiches, fresh fruit, liquor. Very clean. Pool seemed to be nice, but we are beach people. I can go to a pool at home. Food: Average to above average. Nothing special, but not terrible by any means. Beach and Beach Club: Good. Beach is shared w/ Gran Porto Real. Service at beach bar is good. Beer is cold and good variety of mixed drinks. OVERALL: Good value and we were very satisfied. Location is not bad if you're okay w/ walking about 10 minutes to beach and to town. If not, taxis are only 20 pesos anywhere in town. We were very happy, and would return to this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Much Better than I thought”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from PDC where we stayed at Real Playa (Club Bananas). If you're looking for the all-inclusive (AI) super-prison-style-clandestined resort experience don't go here. We initially looked at boutique hotels and decided you couldn't beat the price of this place since it's AI. If you're looking at lower end boutique with free stuff tacked on then stay here. This was our 4th stay in playa and I've never had any problems with our hotel stays, but then again I confirm our reservations 2 weeks in advance and then again several days before our departure. Check-in went smoothly as well as our entire stay. The only time we got hassled was when we sat on the Real Luxury beach one day and a security needed to affirm his place in life by telling us that the location was reserved for the luxury guests. We came back the next day to the same beach and no one seemed to mind. here's some specifics: Rooms: hot. we're from houston tx. and it was still hot for us. Only one window AC unit unit to cool the entire suite. After the first day we got accustomed to it so no big deal. Clean. Ample towels. Tip your housekeeper and get extra stuff. Our housekeeper was a very nice lady frm chiapas. With the glitzy facade on 5th Ave, we all seem to forget the poverty. SO TIP!!!! Food: Restaurant is really great. waiters kinda ---- but the food was excellent. The buffet was aweful unless you get the cook to make something for you. My advice go back to your room and order room service if you didn't make the reservations for the restaurant. Pool: small but will cool you off if you're really hot. watch out for the nasty suntan oil floating at the surface. Why are you at the pool anyways...go to the beach. Beach: closest beach access is 4 blocks from hotel but is a pay bar. the next closest beach is farther down the road. shuttles run from the real playa hotel to this beach spot every 30min. but why not walk...it takes like 5min. and you get to walk on 5th. beach is nice, drinks are ample and more importantly free. Service: Front desk people are a little strange. Hit or miss sorta thing. If you'r enice they're nice. The waitstaff in buffet and room service were great but the guys in the restaurant aren't the best. Far better service at gran porto or some of the larger resorts. but whatever I'm not there to get my --- kissed.

Reviews.Title: “Have visited three times!”
Reviews.Author: cabojan
Reviews.Content: I've been to Real Playa Carmen three times, once since changing from Club Banana's to Real. Enjoyed it very much all three times. The resort may not be directly on the beach but the beach club is a short walk or a bumpy bus ride away. The beach is gorgeous and the water is clear and warm. In December 04 there was construction of a new resort next door which will likely go on for some time yet, causing some disruption. Another thing we missed from the first two visits were the grass palapa's on the beach, they were blown out by the hurricane season in 04 and have been replaced with umbrellas which aren't quite as nice. Although the resort is not perfect there are many advantages to staying here, which is why I've been three times. First, you can walk out of the hotel at any time you choose to visit the town of Playa which by far beats the resorts that are set off by themselves. I don't like having to rely on shuttles just get off the grounds of these resorts! Secondly, there are no strict dress codes for dinner which I enjoy as I dress up for work and do not necessarily want to do so while on vacation! The food at the resort is very good, but not first class. You would get tired of the selections if you are going for more than one week. Lucikly there are many good and reasonably priced restaurants within walking distance. The staff, especially the "animation team" are extremely good, especially Niss who speaks at least seven languages. The night entertainment is a bit cheesy but can be fun if you participate. The rooms are clean but the beds and pillows are hard. Also, don't get caught up in taking tours out of the hotel lobby, too expensive and you spend alot of time picking up other people from different hotels. On Ave 5 in the town of Playa, walking distance, you can get a bus that will take you anywhere you want to go, Cancun, Xel-Ha, Tulum, etc. for approximately $4.00 US. The public buses are like greyhounds complete with washrooms and tv's and are extremely reasonable in comparison to tours. I have taken the buses, walked from the town of Playa to and from the hotel at all hours of the night and day, and even rode a bicycle into the poor neighbourhoods without any problem. The people are extremely friendly and I often felt safer there than at home! I would highly recommend Real Playa for everyone, other than those people that insist on everything being first class. PS be aware, there are alot of Italians visiting the resort and they can be very loud!!!

Reviews.Title: “I love it!!!”
Reviews.Author: binky
Reviews.Content: We are going the end of march for the fifht time to this hotel and we loved it! It's all we want, frindly people, good food, nice entertainment, clean, nice beach-club. We come from Holland and we have to flyfor 11 ours, but it's well worth it. Hope to see you there!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely small quaint clean resort with fantastic beach!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Real Playa del Carmen (formerly Club Bananas) from Jan 2-Jan 9/05. I will set some context for the review, as reviews are subjective. We are from Edmonton, Alberta, Canada Ages 45 and 42) and this was our first all-inclusive vacation. We are middle income folks who both work full time. We understand that we are going to a different country and that it belongs to them, not us! Our expectations at this resort were most certainly met and were exceeded. We had a ground floor with a lovely patio door leading to our private patio including a bistro set and hammock for two. I thought the room was large, and it had a living room area with a couch. There are lovely well-groomed grounds offering foliage, trees, and the pool area. The pool was a bit small, and no swim up bar. The pool was often vacant. The rooms were very clean (a bit old, but not a problem) typically there was turn-down service and the cleaning staff made different animals daily out of towels, which created a pleasant atmosphere. The beds were a bit hard but we both slept well. We left a $1.00US tip for the cleaning staff, and one needs to remember that even a $1.00 goes a long way in Mexico. We occasionally tipped the bar tender and waitress, although they most certainly do not make you feel like they are expecting a tip. Tipping is optional. The location was prime, close to 5th avenue and although there was a shuttle to the beach we only took it once because we preferred to walk. It is true there is construction at the beach and a bit of jackhammering but the beach in front of the Gran Porto Real is rocky. If you venture further past the Gran Porto Real the beach gets more rocky and has a marina. We rather enjoyed the buffet and there was always a good selection of Italian, Mexican, European food which was well stocked. We ate once at the a la carte restaurant and found it to have similar flavors to the buffet with added ambiance. We ventured out on 5th ave and ate at a Mayan restaurant which was very good. I read on tripadvisor that the bar to go to was the Blue Parrot, and that is true. There was fire juggling, and music which played well into the night. Not a significant amount of English speaking people, but this was not a problem as we managed to meet several English speaking couples that we spent some time with. We were told that 50% of the resort is occupied by Canadians however, there is an international flavor here, which in my opinion only adds to the ambience. Hooray to the Animation Team including Ness (who speaks at least 7 languages!!), Auridi, and George who got guests involved. One night we went to the bar at the Real Playa del Carmen and they were playing bingo too cheesy for us, so we simply went to 5th Ave not a problem. We did have one night with some very loud/rude Italians however, Ness was able to control them and involve everyone without incident!! We took one tour which was a catamaran and went snorkeling. The tour was to last half a day and lasted three-quaters of our day but again not a problem because I was on vacation, no need to stress! Just a note, a Mexican minute is equivalent to approximately one hour. Mexicans do not have the hop-to-it ideology that North Americans have, and I can appreciate this on vacation. We had no problems at all. At first we were concerned about the water but all resorts have purified water, and we frequently filled our water bottles and had no Mexican poopies due to water or food. There were very few children under 10 but some teenagers. I cannot speak to the young children activities but the over 10 yr crowd had fun playing volleyball and enjoying the beach. I took a spanish dancing lesson, and enjoyed volleyball. There are a few topless women on the beach but I understand it is not legal but the police did not enforce this during our stay. This is a great place to come for a week to relax, enjoy the beach, the beach club (they make fantastic banana mamas and pina colodas!). One improvement would be to offer hamburgers/hot dogs at the beach club but we made due with a large breakfast and pina colodas for lunch! My advice... go and enjoy if you want a moderately priced vacation at a "middle of the road" resort that is clean, enjoyable with very friendly staff always willing to make your vacation enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Just got back on Jan11/05->not great”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We returned from the real playa del carmen on Jan 11/05, and have to say if it were not for the location of this hotel, it would NOT be worth it! The hotel is alright, rooms are a bit small but OK for two people...we requested 2 double beds but apparently all they have are king sized beds so we had to share...NOT accomidating this way..but relatively clean. The food is bad. NO selection at all, and same menu repeated each day for each meal. We ate at the a la carte resteraunt one night and I got food poisioning an hour later and was up all night throwing up.......not fun! The entertainment AND BAR(which was the WORST part) closed at 11pm!! I have stayed in this area before at larger/nicer resorts and the bars were at least open till 2am! Not everyone is older and has children to go to bed at 10pm! The so called "24hr snacks" are old sandwhiches that are in a mini fridge that u can chance eating whenever your hungry! But thats it! The beach was beautiful! The beach bar was nice, but construction to the new REAL resort next door made jackhammering ALL day except on Sun! Now, the location was great. 5th AVE is like 10 min walk away, to shop and hit the night life (since no where to entertain past 11pm on the resort). The staff was in general friendly, but spoke very littlle english as it is a mostly european resort (very rude italians everywhere!!). However, housekeeping was knocking at the door a few times at like 7am!! And they don't speak english to tell them to stop!! SO, all in all, I would not recommend this resort, if u want the location, maybe try the Porto Real further up 5th ave right on the beach, which is a 4* resort. It is really worth it to pay the small amt. extra!!

Reviews.Title: “It was great”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend went all the way from Sweden to Mexico in November 2004. We stayed at hotel Real Playa del Carmen for 2 weeks and it was great. The good: All the staff were good and especially the maids (cleaned up the room perfectly), waiters, animation team (the italian ness was crazy but also very funny and nice, I can only say arriba, arriba, arriba). The beach was beautiful and the bar at the beach was perfect when you wanted to drink water, beer or a drink. The water was about 28* Celsius so it was nice to jump in to the ocean. The bad: The food at the hotel was not so good, we ate breakfest there every day but lunch and dinner we only ate 2 times. It was so cheap at the restaurants in town so we ate there instead. So the next time we go to Playa we will not have all inclusive. One other thing that was bad was the few tourists (especially the old ones) that complained on everything. At last something that you have to do when you are in Mexico and Playa: 1) The snorkleling at Playa was ok but if you really want to see something nice you have too snorkel at Akumal (turtles), Soliman (great coral reef) and of course the cenotes (crystal clear water and beautiful stalagtites and stagmatites) 2) You have to visit Chichen Itza and climb the "El Castillo". 3) You just have to try the real mexican food at a local restaurant, it´s the best. 4) Don´t buy the cheap tequila, buy one that is reposado or anejo, you can buy a bottle for 200-300 pesos in one of the larger supermarkets (San Fransisco or Cedraui). Hasta Luego

HotelInfo.Name: Real Playa del Carmen
HotelInfo.Address: 5th Avenue between 34th & 38th Sts, Playa del Carmen 77710, Mexico
